loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael, de 62 años de edad, pero a pesar de su avanzada edad el se siente muy fuerte y con deseos de seguir trabajando por su familia; está casado y actualmente vive con su esposa, con quien tuvo 6 hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad y viven a parte pero siempre están pendientes de ellos dos. 

Rafael, dedico toda su vida a la agricultura, pues ese fue el trabajo que le enseño su padre, cultiva maíz, frijol y arroz para vender y para el consumo de su familia.

Rafael, necesita el préstamo para pagar mosos que le ayuden a recoger la cosecha de este año. 

Los sueños de Rafael, son seguir trabajando y disfrutar de su vida junto a su esposa, sus hijos y sus nietos.
texts.en:
Rafael is 62, but despite his age, he still feels strong and wants to continue working to help his family.

He is married and lives with his wife. Together they have six children who, although they are now all adults and live independently, still take care of them.

Rafael has worked all his life in agriculture. He learned this trade from his father, growing corn, beans and rice to feed themselves and to sell.

He needs this loan to pay the laborers who will help him collect the harvest this year.

He wants to keep working and enjoying life with his wife, children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay labor costs at harvest time.

loans.name: Asael Antonio

texts.es:
Asael de 46 años de edad,  solo estudió hasta sexto grado, está casado y su pareja se  dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 4 hijos los cuales están estudiando y dependen de Asael.

 
Asael tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas, el trabajo lo aprendió de un amigo suyo que tenia un taller, en el trabajo solo se involucra su ayudante y laboran en un horario de 6:00 AM a 3:00 PM.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar una máquina de soldadura que necesita en su taller.

Su mas grande  sueño es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Asael, 46, studied until sixth grade. He is married and has four children who are all studying. His wife looks after the house, so they all depend on him for financial support.

He is an ironmonger. He learned this trade from a friend who had a workshop. He works every day from 6 am to 3 pm, and only has one assistant to help him.

He is asking for a loan to buy a soldering machine which he needs for his workshop.

He dreams of providing a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a soldering machine for his workshop.

loans.name: Madre Nazarello Group

texts.es:
“Madre Mazzarello” está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2  de las 17  señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema, cada una poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Araceli es una de las que integra este grupo, tiene una modesta peluquería que le permite poder ayudar a su familia a tener una vida digna y sin privaciones, ella poco a poco ha ido mejorando y creciendo en su negocio, hoy ya tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre se acerca a su local para hacer uso de su buen servicio y atención.
Araceli pide este préstamo para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros insumos variados, de manera a seguir con su arduo trabajo, luchando para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Madre Mazzarello” is completing the poverty elimination program, where 2 of the 17 women are below the poverty line, which is to say in extreme poverty. Each one is putting her best effort into being able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

Araceli is one of those who make up this group. She has a small hair salon which allows her to be able to help her family have a dignified life without want. Little by little, she has been improving and growing in her business. These days she has a very good customer base that always comes to her space to make use of her good service.

Araceli asks for this loan to be able to purchase the necessary supplies for her hair salon such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and a variety of other supplies, in such a way to continue with her arduous work, struggling to be able to help her family through her income.

loans.use: to purchase hair styling supplies such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and a variety of other supplies.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es una joven casada, y tiene un hijo pequeño, por quien ella y su familia se esfuerzan. Ella tiene una peluquería con muy buena clientela, además vende prendas que trae del extranjero.
Ella se inició con un dinero que junto con otros trabajos anteriores, mes a mes va aumentando su negocio con su trabajo de peluquera y las ropas que vende. Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo en la peluquería que tiene, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y otros insumos.
texts.en:
Edith is a married young woman and has a small son for whom she and her family work hard. She has a beauty salon with a very good customer base and in addition she sells clothing that she brings from other countries.

She began with money that she saved with her other previous jobs, month by month she is increasing her business with her hair styling work and the clothing that she sells. She is a very responsible person with desire to improve herself.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies to be able to continue with her work in the beauty salon she has, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase hair styling supplies, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and more.

loans.name: Sergio Miguel

texts.es: Sergio es un comerciante que maneja en su almacén ubicado en Madrid una amplia variedad de productos; prendas de vestir, calzado, productos de temporada, juegos de mesa, artículos coleccionables, películas entre otros.  Su negocio inició comercializando puerta a puerta, exclusivamente prendas de vestir, sin embargo decidió organizarse en un local y aunque su experiencia es de 10 años, cuenta con 8 años de funcionamiento en un punto fijo con mejores resultados económicos y ha podido ofrecer bienestar a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su hija de ocho años de edad.  Su horario de atención es a partir de las 12 meridiano hasta las 10 p.m., todos los días de la semana y sus compras las realiza en San Victorino y por encargos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para realizar adecuaciones al local y comprar vitrinas para modernizar su negocio y surtirlo con nuevas mercancías, esta inversión es muy propicia para la temporada decembrina y para darle una nueva imagen al negocio. Su meta de negocio es tener una sucursal.
texts.en: Sergio is a businessman who manages, in his store located in Madrid, a wide variety of products: clothing, shoes, seasonal products, board games, collectible items, movies, and more. He began his business selling from door to door, exclusively clothing, however he decided to organize himself in a retail space and though he has 10 years of experience, he has 8 years of experience functioning in a fixed space with better economic results and has been able to offer well-being to his family, made up of his spouse and 8-year-old daughter. His opening hours are from 12 noon to 10 pm every day of the week and he makes his purchases in San Victorino and by order. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to make improvements to the retail space and purchase display cases to update his business and stock it with new merchandise. This investment is very favorable for the December season and to give his business a new look. His business goal is to have a branch.

loans.use: to make improvements to the retail space and purchase display cases to update his business and stock it with new merchandise.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a locksmith in Bergen County, New Jersey, and has been in business for the past three years.

Originally from the Dominican Republic, Manuel learned about locks and keys at a very young age from his father and his grandfather. For several generations, Manuel’s family has been in the locksmith business.

Manuel’s father worked hard to send him and his sister to school in the Dominican Republic. In school, Manuel studied computer programming and learned about electronic locks. Together with his wife, Manuel decided to come to the United States in 2012 to pursue their dream of running a business and providing a better life for their growing family.

Manuel started his business by visiting dozens of mechanics and body shops and selling them on his locksmith services. He was successful in developing a network of regular business customers who call him first. Manuel's business is mobile and he keeps his equipment and tools in his van. Manuel always drives to his customers and many of his sales now come from private repairs. He receives calls every week from new customers.

Manuel is applying for a loan to purchase new equipment. With a Kiva loan from you, Manuel will purchase a device that will allow him to access the computer inside cars made by GM. This device will expand Manuel's business offerings to unlock car computer systems. Manuel also wants to build his credit score with this loan. Since he has been in the United States for only three years, his credit history is limited, which makes it difficult for his business to access capital.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and build his credit.

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad, solo estudió hasta noveno grado, ahora está casado y su pareja se  dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos los cuales están estudiando y por lo tanto dependen de José. 


José tiene una peluquería, se ha dedicado por más de diez años a esta actividad, lo aprendió desde pequeño, además tiene ventas de golosinas y sodas para los clientes que llegan a cortarse el pelo, nadie mas se involucra en su trabajo y labora de 8:00 AM a 5:00 PM. 


 El crédito lo necesita para comprar una silla que necesita en su peluquería, además piensa tener a otra persona para que le ayude hacer los cortes ya que tiene una gran demanda de clientes.

Su sueño es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old. He only studied until the ninth grade. Now he is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have two children who are studying in school, so they are dependent on José.

José owns a beauty salon, where he has been working for more than ten years. He learned this trade when he was very young. He also sells candy and soda to his customers who come to have their hair cut. He works alone in his shop from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

He is requesting a loan to buy a chair that he needs in his beauty salon. Also, he plans to hire someone to help him cut hair because his services are in great demand among his customers.

José's dream is to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a chair that he needs in his beauty salon.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 38 years old and has three children who are currently in school. Virginia is married.

Virginia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Virginia has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Joralyn

texts.en:
Joralyn is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Joralyn has a business buying and selling hair clips in the Philippines. Joralyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more hair clips to sell in her stall.

Joralyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more hair clips to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Rustita

texts.en:
Rustita is 50 years old, single, and has one child.

Rustita is in the agricultural business (poultry) in the Philippines. Rustita requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens. Rustita has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rustita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 41 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are presently in school.

Maricris is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maricris has been in this business for 9 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricris would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Janice Carla

texts.en:
Janice Carla is a 25-year-old married woman.

Janice Carla has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more used clothes, dresses and shoes to sell.

Janice Carla has been in this business for one year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes, dresses and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina es una emprendedora mujer de 41 años de edad, dedicada a la comercialización de carnes, actividad en la que lleva 15 años de experiencia y que le ha permitido incrementar su ingreso familiar.  Ella es madre de un hijo mayor de edad y en compañía de su cónyuge reside en un barrio de Cartagena de Indias en donde se consolida la gran mayoría de su clientela conformada por amigos, vecinos y tiendas del sector.  Esta actividad la aprendió de su padre quien por muchos años comercializó estos productos y al considerar que le generaba buenos ingresos, ella se motivó a incorporarse obteniendo el mismo éxito que su progenitor. Todos los días de la semana, ella compra a frigoríficos una variedad de cortes de carnes de res, de cerdo, pollo, pavo y embutidos que sus clientes previamente le solicitan, así mismo a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. realiza sus entregas que le son canceladas de inmediato y también ofrece facilidad de pago. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en jamones, perniles y pavos, productos que le han solicitado sus clientes.  Esta inversión le permitirá incrementar la gama de productos que ofrece y generar ganancias para el beneficio de su familia.  Su meta a futuro es aperturar un local y comprar una casa más amplia.
texts.en: Luz Marina is a 41 year old entrepreneur who sells meat. She has 15 years' experience in the activity and it has allowed her to increase her family income. She is the mother of one grown son and she and her spouse live in a neighborhood of Cartagena de Indias. Most of her customers are made up of friends, neighbors and area stores. She learned this activity from her father, who for many years sold these products. When she considered that it brought in good income, she was motivated to do the same and she obtained the same success as her progenitor. Every day of the week, she buys a variety of cuts of meat of beef, pork, chicken, as turkey, as well as deli meats previously ordered from her customers, from refrigerated warehouses. She makes her deliveries from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. They are paid for immediately and she also offers ease of payment. Right now, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has made with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in hams, fresh ham and turkey,  products that her customers have asked her for. This investment will allow her to increase the range of products she offers and generate earnings for the benefit of her family. Her goal for the future is to open a locale and buy a bigger house.

loans.use: to invest in ham, fresh ham, and turkeys.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor, aged 45, is a married mother of four dependent children, one of whom is not yet school-age. She resides in Battambang province and has been running a rice growing business for years. In order to earn more income, she spends her leisure time working for others for a fee. The rice crop was destroyed by rats.

She leads a group of four members to apply for loans from VisionFund, which is her third time. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds. Some portion of the loan will be used to pay for plowing fees and to apply for a passport. She hopes that she can get abundant outputs to expand her business, to improve her living conditions, and to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds in order to grow her crop well

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, tooth paste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods. She is married woman and has two grown children. Aside from operating a sari-sari(variety) store, she raises and sells hogs.

Her husband works in construction.

Due to high demands for basic commodities, Sylvia decided to avail a loan to cater to her financial needs.

She would like to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, hard drinks and other beverages, and to purchase piglets. This could improve the inventory of merchandise and attract potential customers to shop. Slowly, she could now able to settle her obligations and handle her finances. Thus, her hog raising business will start to boom.

Slyvia is hoping that she could make it in order to be more productive and to become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, hard drinks and beverages, and to purchase  piglets.

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es:
Dinora es una mujer trabajadora de 41 años de dad, ha estudiado hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, tiene dos hijos ya adolescentes que se encuentran estudiando.

Dinora es empleada en una farmacia, tiene 9 años de experiencia en ese lugar, adquirió este empleo por la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 AM a 6PM.

 
El préstamo lo utilizará para cubrir gastos de graduación de su hija, ya que en noviembre se gradúa y quiere empezar a comprarle lo que ella necesita ya que es un logro en su vida.

El sueño de Dinora que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales y  con el tiempo trabajen y se sostengan por ellos mismos.
texts.en:
Dinora is a hardworking 41 year old woman. She has a high school education. She is married and her husband works as a bricklayer. She has two children who are teenagers and who are in school.

Dinora is an employee at a pharmacy. She has 9 years' experience in the place. She acquired the job out of a necessity to get her children ahead. Her work schedule is from 8:00 AM to 6PM.

She will use the loan to cover expenses for her daughter's graduation. She is graduating in November and she wants to start buying her what she needs since this is a life achievement.

Dinora's dream is for her children to get an education and graduate from college and after a time work and support themselves.

loans.use: to cover the expenses of her daughters' graduation.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn is 26 years old and she is married with two school-aged sons depending on her. Rresiding in Kampong Cham province, this family’s living is based on income from growing rice, working for others for a fee, driving a taxi, and buying chicken to sell. Daily income is about USD13 and Thoeurn is able to save about USD5 each day for future needs.

This will be the first loan cycle for her with VisionFund and she is going to use her loan to buy a water pumping machine to irrigate farmland.

She hopes that her rice crop will produce good outputs so that she can improve the family’s living conditions and keep her sons in school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy a water pumping machine to irrigate farmland so that she can get good rice yields to keep her sons in school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Leonafe

texts.en:
Leonafe is a married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonafe is 35 years old.

Leonafe has a food vending business in the Philippines. Leonafe requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices, cooking oil, and other items for her food production business.

Leonafe has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices, cooking oil, and other ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María es una mujer luchadora, madre soltera y emprendedora, que se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 8 años, con la que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y darles una vida digna. Su negocio, ha sido de gran ayuda económica para su hogar, es por eso, que planea seguir invirtiendo en él, tal y como lo ha hecho anteriormente, es por eso que María solicita un nuevo préstamo, que le permita comprar más prendas de ropa para su tienda, esta vez de mejor calidad y prestigio; con las cuales espera tener muy buenas ganancias, ya que, se acerca la mejor temporada del año para las ventas.
texts.en: María is a determined woman and a single mother. She is also enterprising and, for 8 years, has been running a business selling clothing. Through this, she has managed to support her family and give them decent living conditions. Her business has been a big financial help for her family and, therefore, she plans to continue investing in it, as she has done before. Consequently, María is applying for a new loan, which will enable her to buy more items of clothing (of better quality and brands for her shop. This will allow her to earn a good income as the best time of year for selling clothes is approaching.

loans.use: to buy more clothing items foe her shop

loans.name: Soney

texts.en:
Soney is 27 years old and married. From Tbaung Khmum province, she has a dependent son under the age of school. To support a living, she and her husband have been growing cassava and rice for years. Pests and diseases are challenges to her farming business.

Soney is a fifth cycle borrower with VisionFund. Past loans have enabled her to renovate her old house and to buy household supplies.

She is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide, and to pay for labor's fees.

She hopes that she can generate more income to expand her cassava farmland and to send her son to school.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer in order to increase productivity of her crop yields.

loans.name: Nora Esperanza

texts.es: Nora de 52 años reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla en compañía de sus tres hijas, ella es madre soltera y con su microempresa de arte religioso ha logrado sostener los gastos en el hogar. Esta actividad la aprendió en su vínculo familiar quienes se han dedicado por años al arte religioso, además son muy creyentes y siguen con las tradiciones de su iglesia, es por ello que elaboran vírgenes, pesebres, rosarios, mensajes bíblicos, entre otras artesanías que comercializan a personas de la congregación y también distribuye a almacenes religiosos y puestos estacionarios. Los materiales para la elaboración de las artesanías varían de acuerdo a lo que deseen realizar y los compra en ferreterías y almacenes especializados. En la actualidad desea ampliar su variedad y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar: yeso, moldes, pinturas, sellador, pinceles y tiner, con los que realizará imágenes religiosas. Esta inversión le permitirá incrementa su producción y poder ofrecer sus productos en un nuevo punto de venta.
texts.en:
Nora is 52 years old and lives in a neighbourhood of Barranquilla with her three daughters. She is a single mother and has been able to cover her household expenses with her micro-business selling religious art. She learned this activity from her family, who have worked creating religious art for many years. They are also strong believers and continue to maintain the traditions of their church, and so they create models of the Virgin, Nativity scenes, rosaries, Biblical messages and other craft works, which they sell to members of their congregation and also distribute to religious shops and stalls.

The materials needed to create these craft works depend on what she wants to make, and she buys them from specialised hardware shops and stores. She now wants to provide a greater variety of products and has applied for a Kiva loan, her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy plaster, moulds, paints, sealant, paint brushes and thinner to use to make religious images. This investment will allow her to increase production and be able to offer her products from a new sales outlet.

loans.use: to buy plaster, moulds, paints, sealant, paint brushes and thinner

loans.name: Zulma Dinora

texts.es:
Zulma es una joven de 22 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, está soltera, madre de 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella, viven en casa de su madre junto con una hermana.


Zulma se dedica a los oficios domestico, actividad que realiza desde la edad de 15 años y que aprendió de su madre, también se dedica al cuidado de animales como pollos y cerdos.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar semilla y fertilizantes para la siembra de verduras y hortalizas.


El sueño de Zulma es seguir trabajando para darle una buena educación a sus hijos, prepararlos para un mejor futuro y poder construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Zulma is a 22 year old woman. She went to school up to the 9th grade. She is single and a single mother of 2 children who depend on her financially. They live in her mother's house with her sister.

Zulma does domestic work, an activity she has been doing since she was 15 and which she learned from her mother. She also takes care of animals such as chickens and pigs.

She needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to plant vegetables and produce.

Zulma's dream is to keep working to give her children a good education, prepare them for a better future, and be able to build her own life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to plant vegetables and produce.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, de 58 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° grado, está casada y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería y también le apoya en algunas actividades del hogar .


Blanca, se dedica al destazo de cerdos, actividad que aprendió a los 14 años, también muele maíz, vende pan y tamales, de manera que tiene distintas actividades productivas para obtener ingresos económicos y llevar el sustento al hogar.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar 1 vaca parida, también comprara 3 cerdos para engordarlos y después destazarlos.


El sueño de Blanca, es seguir trabajando para mejorar sus ingresos y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: 58-year-old Blanca had two years of primary education, is married and has 2 children. Her husband works in agriculture and cattle rearing and he also helps her with some of the household duties. Blanca's work involves slaughtering pigs, a job she learned when she was 14. She also grinds corn and sells  bread and tamales, so she has a number of means of earning an income and supporting her family. She will use the loan to buy a calved cow and also 3 pigs which she will fatten an then slaughter. Blanca's dream is to continue working to boost her earnings and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy 1 calved cow and 3 pigs which she will fatten and then slaughter.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Tierra Nueva L Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Tierra Nueva l, Este Grupo esta conformado por la señora Marlin Estela, de 38 años de edad, ella desde hace 2 años de ha dedicado a elaborar y vender pasteles, le ha ido muy bien pero sus clientes han aumentado y nececita mas capital para invertir por esa razón esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de arina y materiales para la elaboración de pasteles para vender. Esperando que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en: The Tierra Nueva l support group is a group that includes Marlin Estela. She is 38 years old. For 2 years, she has made and sold pastries. It has gone very well for her, but her clientele has grown and she needs more capital to invest. That is why she is asking for this loan to buy flour and materials to make pastries to sell.  She hopes you can help her with the loan she has asked for.

loans.use: to buy flour and materials to make pastries to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Maritza

texts.es:
Carmen de 32 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado, está casada y su esposo reside en Estados Unidos, tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando y reciben ayuda de su padre.

Carmen ya tiene dos años de dedicarse a vender medicinas naturales, fue la necesidad de superarse y sacar adelante a sus hijos lo que la llevó a realizar este trabajo.

 
Ella utilizará el crédito para comprar mas medicinas naturales y continuar con la venta.

Su sueño es tener un local grande donde tener los productos y con el tiempo mas clientes y seguir trabajando con Credicampo para que le siga financiando sus prestamos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32 years old, studied up to 6th grade, is married (her husband lives in the United States) and has two children, who are students receiving assistance from their father.

Carmen has been selling natural medicines for two years already and started doing this type of work because she needed to improve her life and support her children.
 
She will use the loan to buy more natural medicines and continue to sell them.

Her dream is to own a large property to store the products in and, in time, to have more customers and to continue working with CrediCampo, so that they will continue to finance her with loans.

loans.use: to buy more natural medicines and continue to sell them.

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años de edad, no estudió porque no tenía las posibilidades económicas, está casada y su esposo es jornalero, tiene dos hijos que van a la escuela y dos trabajan.

 
María se ha dedicado al negocio de tortillera durante 19 años, lo aprendió debido a la necesidad de criar a su hijo y darles educación, ella elabora tortillas todos los días durante la mañana.


El préstamo lo necesita para comprar maíz y leña para continuar con la venta de tortillas.

El sueño de la cliente es mantener su negocio y  obtener mas ingresos, de esa forma podrá vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old. She did not go to school due to a lack of financial resources. She is married to a journalist and has two children who are in school and two who are working.
 
María has worked selling tortillas for 19 years. She learned this trade in order to support her children and give them an education. She makes tortillas every morning.

She needs the loan to buy corn and firewood so that she can keep selling tortillas.

Her dream is to maintain her business and gain more income so that she and her family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood so that she can keep selling tortillas.

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
José tiene 45 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado porque sus padres no tenían los ingresos para seguir apoyándolo, está casado y su esposa se dedica a la elaboración de tamales, tiene cuatro hijos que dependen de él.


José junto a su esposa trabajan en la elaboración de tamales, ellos dos lo iniciaron debido a que tenían pequeños a 
sus hijos y tenían que ver como hacer para darles todo lo que ellos necesitan, vende tamales dos días por semana y en el fin de semana vende panes.


José está solicitando el préstamo para comprar maíz, aceite, y otros insumos para elaborar tamales, y  otra carreta ya que la necesita para movilizare con la venta. 

El sueño de José es siempre tener las fuerzas necesarias para poder trabajar y  darles todo lo que necesitan sus hijos para que ellos en un futuro sean profesionales y tengan un empleo seguro.
texts.en: José is 45 years old and attended school until the second grade as his parents did not have sufficient money to continue funding his education. He is married with 4 financially dependent children, and his wife makes and sells tamales. José and his wife started a tamales business when their children were small as they needed money to be able to raise them properly. They sell their tamales 2 days each week and at the weekends they sell bread. José is applying for this loan so that he can buy maize, cooking oil and other ingredients for making his tamales, and he would also like to buy a new cart that he can use for mobile food sales. José hopes that he will continue to have the means necessary to provide his children with everything they need to secure themselves a good, professional job in the future

loans.use: to buy maize, cooking oil and other ingredients for making tamales and another cart for his mobile food sales.

loans.name: Romy Xiomara

texts.es: Romy es un una mujer trabajadora de 32 años de edad que vive con su madre en vivienda de su propiedad, ella es una joven responsable que apoya a su madre en su vejez. Romy se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de promoción de salud en su comunidad y las comunidades cercanas. Ella cambiar las láminas de paredes y techo, lo cual le permita brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su madre, por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar las láminas de paredes y techo en su vivienda y proteger a su madre.
texts.en: Romy is a hard working and responsible 32 year old woman who lives with and cares for her elderly mother in their own home. She earns her living working as a healthcare worker in her community and in the nearby area. She would like to replace the metal sheeting used for their walls and roof which would allow her to protect her mother and create better living conditions for them both; consequently, she has applied to FUSAI for this loan which she plans to invest in metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to replace the metal walls and roof of her home so that she can protect her mother.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
A local villager residing in Dambae district of Tbaung Khmum province, Mom is a 28-year-old woman who is married and has three dependent children, two of whom are in school, while the remaining one is too young to attend school. To make a living, she is growing cassava and rice, which she has been involved in for ten years. She earns about USD 8 per day and can save about USD 3 each day for future needs.

She has been with VisionFund for five cycles already; those past loans have helped her improve her living condition and buy more household supplies. Mom is going to use her new loan to buy organic fertilizer for growing cassava and rice. Part of the loan left will be used to buy school supplies for her children.

She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farmland and to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for growing cassava and rice so as to gain more returns to keep supporting her children's studying.

loans.name: Merian

texts.en:
Merian is 36 years old and married with three children. With her three children in school, Merian works very hard to provide for them.

Merian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Merian has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, coconut wine, candies, coffee, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Merian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Phanna's Group

texts.en:
Phanna, aged 34, is a married woman who is blessed with two dependent children, one of whom is in school, while the remaining one is too young to attend school. She lives in Kampong Cham province, where she and her husband have been raising pigs and fishing for years. She earns about USD 15 per day and can manage to save about USD 7 per day. A challenge she faces is her pigs get ill.

Phanna, the new client, is now leading a two-member group to apply for loan support from VisionFund to save her business. She will use her loan to purchase feed to nourish her pigs.

She hopes she can generate more income to improve her living condition and to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed to nourish her pigs so that she can keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru: Шамсидин родился в 1971 году на районе Джоми в семье дехканов. Его родители имеет большой земельный участок и больше домашних животных. Шамсиддин было 15 лет, когда он заинтересовался заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Он всегда старается идти вперед и Шамсидин уверенный человек в себе. Шамсиддин с начало думает, потом делает работу. Он сейчас продвигает деятельность отца, решил идти по его стопам. Шамсиддин сейчас работает на земле, он выращивает растение. Шамсиддин уже собирает урожай. Он хочет после сбора урожай готовить земельный участок к посеву новый урожай. Шамсидин трудится и зарабатывает честно нажитым трудом. Его доходы только от этой деятельностью. Шамсидин очень нуждается на Вашу поддержку. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему посадить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Shamsidin was born in 1971 in the Jomi region to a family of farmers. His parents have a large piece of land and a large number of livestock. Shamsidin was 15 when he became interested in working in farming. He always tries to go forward, and he believes in himself. He thinks about things first, then does his work. He is now continuing the work of his father, and has decided to follow in his footsteps. He now works the land and grows crops.

Shamsidin is already gathering his harvest. Afterward, he wants to prepare the land for replanting. He works hard and earns a living with honest work. His income is only from this business, and he is in great need of your support. The loan amount will help him to plant a new crop.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 20-year-old single young man. Due to his family's limited income, he left school at early age to help in covering their needs and expenses. Almost a year ago, He opened his own bakery. He has six years of experience in this domain. Now, he is working hard to attract customers and he is getting good results. He is becoming well-known in his area. He now needs a new and larger oven.

Kassem is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business through buying larger furnace to increase his production and satisfy his customers' requests.
Kassem hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and build his own future and family.

loans.use: to buy a larger oven to increase his production.

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es: Doña Suyapa, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, vive en comunidad de potrerillos, Villanueva  Cortes. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas para vender en el sector donde vive, esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años en su casa, ella ofrece su producto a los vecinos de la localidad donde tiene clientes fijos que consumen a diario. Ha obtenido varios préstamos con la institución para mantener su negocio activo, actualmente está solicitando la cantidad de 21,000 Lempiras para la compra de materia prima como maíz y leña en cantidades mayores para la elaboración de tortillas, y poder producir una mayor cantidad y de esta manera poder abastecer el mercado que ella tiene. Su meta es seguir mejorando y aumentar la zona en donde se distribuye su producto y así generar mejores ingresos que le permitan ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de su educación.
texts.en: Doña Suyapa, 57 years old, is a single mother of four children and lives in the community of Potrerillos, Villanueva, Cortes. She makes and sells tortillas in the area where she lives. She has been doing this for several years from home. She offers her products to the neighbors of the area, where she has regular customers who consume daily. She has received several loans with the institution to keep her business active. Currently, she is seeking 21,000 Lempiras for the purchase of raw materials such as corn and firewood in larger amounts to make tortillas, produce more and thus satisfy the demands of the market she has. Her goal is to keep improving and to increase the area where she distributes her product in order to generate a higher income that will allow her to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as corn and firewood to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: Rosendo de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica a la apicultura desde hace 4 años, comercializa la miel que cultiva en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cajas para el cultivo como muestra la fotografia y azucar para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Rosendo, age 31, lives in his own home with his partner and their four children. He's been raising bees for four years, and he sells the honey he gets in various markets near his home. With his earnings, he manages to meet some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more cultivation boxes as shown in the picture, and sugar, so that he can continue his work and earn greater income.

loans.use: buy bee hive boxes and sugar

loans.name: Izz-Aldeen

texts.en:
Izz Al-deen is a 22-year-old man from Ramallah City, in the west bank.  He is single and lives with his family in a small house. Izz Al-deen works as a Is a factor in Roasted Nuts  where he gets a low income.
 
He wants to improve himself and be an entrepreneur and his business idea is to sell cosmetics and accessories for ladies. Izz Al-deen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start his own business. He hopes that, By taking this loan, Izz Al-deen will be able to improve his family's conditions. Izz Al-deen appears in the photo while he working.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start his own business.

loans.name: Busara Group

texts.en:
Baraka, who is in her early 30s, is married with two school aged children. She has been running a gengeduka business since 2008. She works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be BARAKA's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase on the genge business and opened a duka shop. She has paid back all her loans successfully and is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees for the kids, to repay the loan, bought a plot of land and built her own house and also restocked the out of stock items in the gengeduka to meed his customers' demand. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Baraka will share this loan with her group Busara which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the gengeduka to meed her customers' demand.

loans.name: Gertrida

texts.en:
Gertrida is 40 years, married with three children and all attending school. She is currently dealing in cocoa farming supplemented by buying to top on hers to increase her sales and profits. She lives in Bundibugyo Uganda with her family.

Because of the urge to fight illiteracy, Gertrida has embarked on educating her children since she never got the chance to study. She also hopes to provide her family with the basic needs. In-spite of this,she is a hardworking lady who faces challenges of limited capital in her business alongside competition, since cocoa business is the major economic activity in her area. She has requested for a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, John has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, John would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support John can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, John will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. John is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is 43 years old, is married and has three children who are presently in school.

Anelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Anelyn has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Khema

texts.en:
Khema is 39 years old, is a housewife and her husband a rice farmer.  Together they have 2 school- aged children. Years ago, Khema started with the support of Seva MFI with floristry business. She currently has her own flower farm and maintains her family with the income of it.
Her plants are sold from the market and also from home; she expanded business by importing some exclusive flowers for her customers. Khema needs a loan of SRD 5.000 to construct a shade (netting) for the flowers to make sure they remain fresh for a longer period in the dry season.

loans.use: to construct a shade (netting) for the flowers

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is married and a father of seven children, living in a six room’s house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. He hates thinking about the death of her sister, sickness, and the poverty he has passed through. He is very confident that the activities will success because he has grasp perfect knowledge about the business, the strategic location of the business, and also because of his high optimism of success in anything he does.

With this new loan requested, he will buy one hundred plastic chairs, four canopies, and other spare parts of the canopies. This business will greatly help the community in that the chairs will be rented out to people during occasions like births , marriages and death celebrations.

With the profit from the business, he will be able to expand his business; he will also improve on the state of his house. He will also take care of his children’s education and medication.

He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of its low interest rates, a new loan can be given as soon as you finish the old one, also coupled with the fact that GHAPE offers non-financial services including training and social net during bi-monthly Center meetings.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs and canopies to rent out for local celebrations

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene was able to sustain and grow her general store through the loan granted to her by Kiva and its supporters. She is thanking them for their valuable support on her livelihood. 

Once again she is seeking your help for a Php 15000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past nine years which sustained her family's basic needs. She trusts her request will be granted. Her earnings will enable her to send three children to school. 

Mylene dreams to own a big grocery store someday to better serve her community. She prays that all her children will get to College. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 44-year old married woman with two grown children. She is in the pork barbecue vending business, her livelihood for many years now. She caters mostly to neighbors and locals. Her husband's way of earning a living is by being a mason (construction work).

Teresa would like to improve her business, including the services and the quality of food she will sell. She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, CEVI to purchase pork, charcoal, bamboo skewers and materials for house repair. With a loan, she could have an adequate supply of barbecue and also purchase materials for home improvement. Thus, she could boost her earnings and manage her finances wisely.

Teresa thanks Kiva and CEVI.

loans.use: to purchase pork, charcoal, bamboo skewers.

loans.name: Ladies Group

texts.en:
Mrs Loan is 34 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fishes for 4 years. Loan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is unstable because when the amount and the price of fishes belong to the weather conditions.

The main hardship that Loan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing more fresh fish to resell.

In 2015, Loan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business.
She is the group leader of "Ladies", which consists of six members. In the future, Loan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more fresh fish to resell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 32 years old and single with two children. With one child still in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap and other personal care products.

Liza has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Claire is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Claire has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Claire requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her local market.

Claire has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a 55-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marcelina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Marcelina has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Kimheang's Group

texts.en:
Kimheang, a 27-year-old, married woman, is a resident in Prey Veng province. This woman is blessed with a dependent son under school age.

To make a living, she and her husband are growing rice and working for others for a fee. The daily income of this family is about USD $13 per day, and Kimheang can manage to save about USD $6 each day. Drought is the main challenge to the farming business.

In a group of two, she is the leader, and she will use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee.

She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her living conditions and send her son to school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield, as well as her income.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 39 years old and has three children. Mary Ann is married and has three children who are presently in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural poultry business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Mary Ann has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Indri

texts.en:
Mrs Indri is the mother of 1 children and lives in Tumpang, Malang Regency on Java, Indonesia's largest Island in terms of population.
In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mrs Indri attended a meeting by Nazava's sales team about alternative household water treatment options. There she learnt about Nazava Water Filters. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Mrs Indri who fulfills a leading function in her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This is the first time Mrs Indri applies for a loan. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans.
This loan will allow Mrs Indri to buy 90 filters and sell them on consignment to her community making safe drinking water available to 450 people.

loans.use: to obtain 90 water purifiers to sell to her community members providing them with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Esmeralda De Jesus

texts.es: Esmeralda de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposo, ella posee una tienda desde 15 años con la cual ha podido salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, anteriomente solicito un credito para la compra de mercaderia, hoy esta solicitando un credito para la compra de pollos por mayor ya que desde hace algunos meses se ha dedica a la crianza, por esa razon esta solicitando dicho credito, ya que gracias a sus dos trabajos pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, age 38, lives in her own home with her husband. She's run a store for fifteen years, and it's enabled her to get ahead and meet her household expenses. She has a previous loan with which she purchased merchandise.

Today she is requesting a loan for purchasing chickens at wholesale. For several months now, she's been in the business of raising them. That's why she is requesting this loan; with these two jobs, she will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: get her second business off the ground by buying chickens at wholesale

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 51 years old and single. She is residing at Kinuman, Ozamiz City. Living with her parents, Fe has been helping in managing their farm for many years, and she earns better income from this.

Her previous loan was used for buying farming materials. She has repaid successfully her previous loan and is now planning to take a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients to have a productive harvest.

She is now happy to say that with this loan, the entire farm will be fertilized and rest assured of a productive farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jelly is 41 years old, and four of her children are currently in school.

Jelly has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Jelly requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted ready-to-wear products like T-shirts, dresses, shorts, underwear, etc.

Jelly has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted ready-to-wear products like T-shirts, dresses, shorts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena logro estudiar hasta 3 grado, esta casada y su esposo es empleado publico, tienen 4 hijos y todos son mayores de edad, actualmente en su casa vive una de sus hijas, su esposo y 3 nietos, ellos son los que le ayudan con los oficios domésticos, como dependientes no tienen a nadie aunque comparten los gastos del hogar entre todos.

Magdalena se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 30 años, esta actividad la aprendió de una señora con la que ella trabajaba cuando era joven y decidió dedicarse a este negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, anteriormente tenia también una granja de pollos de engorde y de gallinas ponedoras,  la cuchera la tiene en su casa y es ella con su hija y nietos los que cuidan de los animales.

El préstamo será utilizado para reactivar la granja de pollos de engorde, comprara pollos, granza, concentrado, vitaminas y medicinas, ya que tiene toda la estructura, con esta nueva actividad pretende ampliar sus negocios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Magdalena desea poder mantener su nueva actividad con la granja de pollos para mejorar un poco sus ingresos y su calidad de vida y le permitirá también ayudar a su hija y sus nietos; este deseo podrá cumplirlo con el préstamo que se le otorgara.
texts.en:
Magdalena earned a third grade education. Now, she is married and her husband is a public employee. They have four children, all grown up. Currently, she has one of her daughters, her husband, and three grandchildren living with her. They all help with the household work. She has no dependents, although everyone shares the household expenses.

Magdalena has thirty years of experience in the field of raising pigs. She learned the work from a woman she worked with when she was young, and decided to go into business herself to help her husband with the household expenses. She used to also have a farm with both chickens for fattening and laying hens. The pigpen is in her home, and she and her daughter and grandchildren care for the animals.

The loan will be used to start up her chicken farm again, buying chickens for fattening, grain, concentrated feed, vitamins, and medicines. She already has all the infrastructure, and with this new line of work, she'll be able to expand her businesses and improve her family's quality of life.

Magdalena wants to be able to sustain her new chicken farming business so that she can improve her income a bit, and thus her quality of life. That way, she can help her daughter and her grandchildren. She can do all of this with the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: restart her business raising fattening chickens by buying chickens, feed, and supplies

loans.name: Srey Lot's Group

texts.en:
A 37-year-old villager in the Kampong Cham province, Srey Lot is married and has three dependent children. Two children are in school and the other is too young for schooling.

Srey Lot sells groceries to make a living. Because she needs working capital, she is leading a group of four members to apply for loans. She will use her loan to buy more items to replenish her grocery store and attract customers.

She hopes that she will make good sales and earn more money. This will help improve her living conditions and enable her to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to replenish her grocery store.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang, age 39, is a resident of the Kampong Cham province. She is married with four dependent children, one of whom is too young to attend school. She and her husband make a living through growing rice and working for others for a fee. Drought is the challenge to the rice growing business.

Neang is now leading a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields. She hopes to generate more income to improve living conditions and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Dues

texts.en:
Dues, a 44-year-old resident of the Siem Reap province, is married and blessed with five dependent children, one of whom is in school. She has been growing rice and cassava to make a living for years. Weeds are the main challenge to her farming. She can earn USD15 per day, and save about USD8 every single day for future needs.

Dues has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and it has had great impact on her standard of living. She can meet family needs and send her child to school.

Dues has requested a loan that will be used to buy organic fertilizer to improve cassava farmland. She hopes that she will earn more income to improve her standards of living and to buy school supplies.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve cassava farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
El socio Moisés es un padre de familia emprendedor y trabajador, que se dedica a dar servicio de taxi y también trabaja en una empresa de transporte de servicio público. El se dedica a su trabajo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. 
El socio tiene 33 años y dos hijos, el desea salir adelante y el requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, necesita para comprar llantas, lunas, retrovisores y pagar servicios de mantenimiento.
Moisés está contento y agradecido con el préstamo y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA, por el préstamo . Y promete cumplir puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Our member, Moisés, is an enterprising and hard-working family man. He drives a taxi and he also works for a business that provides public transportation. He works from 7:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night.

Moisés is 33 years old and has two children. He wants to get ahead, and needs a loan so that he can maintain his vehicle. He needs to buy tires, window glass, a rear-view mirror, and pay for maintenance services.

Moisés is pleased and thankful for the loan, and wishes to thank Kiva investors. He is committed to making his loan repayments on time.

loans.use: maintain his vehicle by buying tires, glass, rear-view mirrors, and paying for maintenance services

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a young man living in Rafah Gaza strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of high cost of living, he decided to open a new business. He transports goods and inventory between traders in his rickshaw. A few months ago Imad bought a new rickshaw and become successful and also has loyal customers.

Imad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay for his rickshaw. By taking this loan Imad can working more efficiently and increase his sales also his profit.


. Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to pay for his rickshaw,

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Patricia is 39 years old and has one child in school.

Patricia has a buying and selling of personal care products business in the Philippines. Patricia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, lotion, etc.

Patricia has been in this business for one year. In the future, Patricia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, lotion, etc.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es: Hace 21 años que doña Ana se dedica a la venta de café, café de leche y sándwich, este es el segundo préstamo que solicita doña Ana ya que el primero le ha sido de gran ayuda ya que ha logrado invertir, obtener mayor estabilidad y mejores ganancias que le han permitido mejorar su vivienda, es por esta razón que solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar café, mayonesa, azúcar y otros. Con este crédito podrá surtir la demanda de sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Ana started her business of selling coffee and sandwiches 21 years ago and this is her second loan. The first one was a big help to her, allowing her to invest in her business and achieve greater stability. The added income helped her to improve her home.  That's why she is requesting this loan, which she will use to buy supplies like coffee, mayonnaise, sugar, and more. With this loan she will be able to buy stock to meet the demands of her customers and earn more money.

loans.use: stock her business selling coffee and sandwiches by purchasing coffee, mayonnaise, sugar, and more

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 30 years old. He lives in Ozurgeti district with his parents and pensioner grandmother. The family is involved agricultural activities. In particular, they have an agricultural plot of land, where they grow nut trees and mandarin trees. Besik and his parents sell the harvested products locally to generate income.

Besik decided to start additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 5200 GEL. With the received credit he will start trading fruits and vegetables. He will also purchase a minibus and will trade fruits and vegetables from village to village. This will increase his income and with increased income will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. Besik awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trade in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a mother with one child. She lives with her husband in the area Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been running her beauty salon for the past two years, and she is passionate about her work. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair styling, and she is a well-known beautician in her community. Farzana is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of her husband. Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy more beauty products including lotions, makeup kits, and lightening creams. The loan will enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Sreysor's Group

texts.en:
Sreysor is 25 years old and married. She has a dependent preschool daughter. She resides in Tbaung Khmum District where she and her husband are growing rice and cassava to support their living. They earn about USD $9 per day and can save about USD $5 each day.

This will be Sreysor's third cycle with VisionFund. Past loans have helped her to buy more household supplies and renovate her house to be in good condition.

As the leader of a four member group, Sreysor will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and agricultural tools and to pay for plowing and labour fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to buy a hectare of farmland and to send her daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to increase her crop yields.

loans.name: Jose Sacramento

texts.en:
Sacramento lives with her wife and son in Xochimilco. He works at a tortilla stand that is owned by his mother in law selling, as he says, the best tortillas in town.

Sacramento is always looking at new ways to expand his business. He has asked his son to work in the afternoon doing tortilla deliveries to different houses, which has been good for his sales. Sacramento and his wife have been saving and building in very small steps a house for their small family. Her wife wants to bring her mother to live with them because she lives in a house made of wood that does not help with her health issues.

With this new home not only will they have their own space and a patrimony that some day will be for his son, but also they will welcome his mother in law, who has given them a good life through the tortilla stand. With this credit, Sacramento will be able to build the floors and finish the walls. Although some things will still be missing, they will be able to move in and give their son his own room.

Sacramento is employed informally so he has no validated proof of income. This makes it very hard for him to ask credit from other institutions. He is thankful for this opportunity and wishes to continue the relation so he can later on can continue making improvements to his home.

loans.use: to give his family a house of their own and better his mother in law's health by providing adequate housing

loans.name: Romalyn

texts.en:
Romalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Romalyn is 24 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Romalyn has a buying and selling of personal care products business in the Philippines. Romalyn requested a PHP 11,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, shampoo, soap, etc.

Romalyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Romalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Crislyn

texts.en:
Crislyn is 38 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Crislyn works very hard to provide for the family.

Crislyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap and other personal care products.

Crislyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Crislyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 43 years old and married with six children. Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a general store in the Philippines for six years, and she earns additional income from selling frozen foods.. Vilma requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home-care products, and groceries. Vilma has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. Vilma aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 40 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. Juliet works very hard to provide for them. For two years, she has operated a general store in the Philippines. Juliet requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, and personal-care products. In the future Juliet would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La socia Adriana pertenece al banco “virgen Asunta” , ella se dedica a vender productos artesanales y como actividad complementaria cría animales para venderlos como (gallinas, chancho, etc)
La socia tiene 50 años y tiene 7 hijos. con estas actividades logra sacar adelante a su familia, y aportar en los gastos familiares. Ella desea ampliar su negocio de venta de productos artesanales, ella solicito el préstamo para comprar mantas y ponchos. 
Adriana se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas y está muy agradecía con los inversionistas de kiva que le dan la oportunidad de seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en: The featured member, Adriana, is a member of the "Virgen Asunta" bank. She sells handicrafts and, as a side-line, breeds animals (hens, pigs, etc.) to sell. She is 50 years old and has 7 children. With what she earns from her businesses she manages to support her family and contribute to the household expenses. She would like to expand her handicrafts business and is seeking the loan to buy blankets and ponchos. Adriana promises to make her repayments punctually and she expresses her gratitude to Kiva lenders for giving her the opportunity to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy blankets and ponchos.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin pertenece al banco “virgen Asunta”, el se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi  y servicios particulares por el territorio peruano.
el socio tiene 33 años , su deseo es mejorar su calidad de vida por eso solicito el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su taxi, que le permita brindar su servicio de forma segura y a gusto de sus clientes.
El socio tiene 2 hijos, busca sacarlos adelante , por eso agradece a los  inversionista de KIVA por el préstamo y asegura cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Edwin is member of the community bank "Virgen Asunta".  He works by providing taxi services and special services around the Peruvian territory.

This member is 33 years old, his desire is to improve his quality of life and this is why he is requesting a loan:  to purchase replacement parts for his taxi.  This will allow him to provide his services safely and to his customers' delight.

The member has 2 children.  He is hoping to be able to help them move forward.  He is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan and ensures that he will  repay it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts for his taxi

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Arsenia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell dressed chicken.  Arsenia is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices and other utensils for her food production business.

Arsenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices and other utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Lina's Group

texts.en: Lina’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Lina makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Premanand

texts.en:
Premanand is 51 years old, and he has a family with 5 school-aged children. Previously he leased his rice paddies to third parties and worked for other rice farmers with his pick-up.

In 2009 he started his own rice cultivation with support from SEVA MFI. Meanwhile he expanded his areas and renovated his house. He has now applied to Seva MFI for a new loan of SRD 10,000 to buy a clutter plow for his rice paddies.

loans.use: to buy a clutter plow for his rice paddies.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana a 51 year old Lebanese woman, living with her husband and their two children in a rented apartment in Beirut.
While her husband is a furniture painter, Hana's ambition and hard work led her to open her grocery store in Beirut in order to help her husband in the house expenses. Her children also work and study at the same time in order to support their parents financially.

In 1994, twenty years ago, she established her business in a popular street of Beirut and gradually became renowned in the area with a good reputation as she is friendly with her customers and provides them with quality products.
For the first time, Hana is asking for 2,313,613 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. With this loan, she will be able to buy fresh food products as well as cleaning items and sell them to her customers who have been loyal to her for many years. This way, she is expecting to increase her sales, satisfy her customers and improve her shop's financial results.

loans.use: to buy food products and cleaning items for her grocery store

loans.name: Yin's Group

texts.en:
Yin, aged 49, is married and blessed with six children, two of whom are dependent and in school. She and her husband have been growing cassava and rice in Tbaung Khmum Province for 31 years.
