She earns about USD $10 per day and can save about USD $5 each day for future needs. Pests are the challenge to their farming business.

Having been with VisionFund for four loan cycles, Yin has managed her loans wisely. As a result, she has improved living conditions and bought more household supplies. Yin is now leading a three-member group to obtain a loan from VisionFund.

Yin will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticides, as well as to pay for labour fees. Some of the loan will be used to buy school supplies for her children.

Yin hopes are to produce abundant yields, buy two-hectares of farmland to grow cassava, and keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticides to grow healthy and fruitful crops.

loans.name: Jaqueline Rocio

texts.es:
Jaqueline, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su esposo es jornalero en las fincas de café de la zona y también es agricultor y tienen 1 hija en edad preescolar.

Jaqueline, se dedica a la venta de frutas desde hace 4 años, esta actividad la emprendió al ver los pocos ingresos que generaba su esposo y decidió poner este negocio, para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar; además de este negocio también vende ropa interior desde hace 2 años, este negocio lo inicio para mejorar sus ingresos; estas actividades las realiza diariamente de manera ambulante en todo el cantón y su esposo muchas veces es el que le provee de algunas frutas para que las venda.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ropa como camisas, ropa interior femenina y masculina; ella quiere incrementar el inventario de esta actividad.

Jacqueline, desea ayudar a su hija para que estudie y sea profesional.
texts.en:
25-year-old Jacqueline studied to the 9th grade. She is married, and her husband is a day laborer in the region's coffee plantations. He is also also a farmer. They have a preschool aged daughter.

Jaqueline has earned a living selling fruits for 4 years. She launched this business upon seeing the small income her husband was generating. She decided to set up this business to help him with household expenses. In addition to this business, she also had been selling underwear for 2 years. She started this business to improve her income. She carries out these businesses every day as a traveling vendor in her entire canton. Her husband is often the one who provides her with some of the fruits that she sells.

The loan will be used to buy clothing such as shirts, and men's and women's underwear. She wants to increase her inventory for this business.

Jacqueline wants to help her daughter to study and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as shirts, and women's and men's underwear.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet es una socia que pertenece al Banco “virgen Asunta” y tiene 41 años. Ella se dedica a producir y vender cucharones de madera, esta actividad artesanal es muy bonita pero trabajosa.
La socia tiene 2 hijos y su deseo es salir adelante con su negocio por eso solicito el préstamo para comprar una cierra ,madera y lijas.
Yanet está muy contenta por el préstamo, ya que le ayudara mucho para conseguir sus metas, y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por confiar en ella. Por eso se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of Banco "Virgen Asunto" and is 41 years old. She makes her living carving and selling wooden serving spoons, a beautiful but time consuming craft. She has two children and her dream is to keep her business going. That is why she is requesting this loan: to buy a saw, wood and sandpaper.

Yanet is very happy with this loan as it will be a great help in achieving her goals. She is grateful to the Kiva investors for trusting her and therefore promises to make the agreed upon payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a saw, wood and sandpaper.

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días el Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 6 años de edad, el mismo que estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja de ayudante de un camión que transporta aves.
Doña Carmen es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así poder ganar lo suyo para el bien familiar, ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa, allí ella todas las tardes vende  corviches, empanadas, batidos y jugos naturales, así como también pan con morocho que es una bebida de mucho agrado de sus clientes que siempre la visitan y consumen lo que ella prepara,  lleva 4 años con este negocio el cual le deja lo necesario para salir adelante y que puede sacar adelante gracias a los créditos que recibe de la institución razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pan, carne, plátano, frutas  y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella  sale adelante.  Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: The Estancia Vieja Communal Bank meets fortnightly in the Estancia Vieja district of Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo. The locals are modest people who work mostly in agriculture and trade. One of them is Carmen, who is 28 and married, with a 6-year-old son who goes school. Her husband works as an assistant on lorries transporting birds. Carmen likes working and this enables her to earn her own income and contribute to her family's welfare. She has a small shop in her home where, every afternoon, she sells corviches (stuffed plantains), pies, milkshakes and natural juices, as well as bread with morocho, a drink which is very popular with her customers, who always visit her and eat the dishes she makes. She has been running her business for 4 years and it provides her with what she needs to get by and make progress, thanks to the loans she receives from the institution. She is extremely grateful to the people who help her by making the loans possible. She will use this loan to buy bread, meat, bananas, fruit and other ingredients for preparing food. She has been a member of the Credit group for more than 2 years and likes it because the loans she has had have enabled her to get by. Her dream is to do the best she can for her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, bananas, fruit and other ingredients.

loans.name: Zobeida Jaqueline

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días el Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Zobeida, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 12 y 9 años de edad, tres de ellos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Zobeida es una mujer que le gusta ganarse sus propios recursos con su esfuerzo y así contribuir con los gastos que hay en su hogar, para esto ella  hace mas de 8 años atrás adecuo un local en su casa en la cual surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres, la misma que con el paso del tiempo y con la ayuda de los créditos que ha recibido ha ido aumentando hasta la actualidad que ya tiene una tienda bien surtida en la cual sus clientes encentaran víveres, carnes, cosas de bazar y papelería, ella cada vez que puede aumenta la variedad de artículos ya que así gana más clientela y esto le deja mejores ingresos que los invierte en la educación de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres y surtir su tienda. Esta desde el inicio   en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos para mejorar su negocio y su vida. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the area known as Estancia Vieja, in the Colon parish, Portoviejo city, meet every two weeks, the community bank Estancia Vieja.  This is a town of humble people dedicated to agriculture and trade in general.

This is where Zobeida lives.  She is 40 years old and lives in a common law relationship from which she has four children aged 15, 13, 12 and 9 years old.  Three of them are studying in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. The husband is a merchant.

Zobeida is a woman who likes to earn her own income through her own efforts and so contribute to home expenses.   To achieve this, 8 years ago she adapted in the premises of her home a small grocery store, the same one that with the passage of time and with the help of loans she has received , has grown to what it currently is:  a well-stocked store where customers can find groceries, meat, bazaar items and stationery.

Whenever she can, she increases the variety of items she sells because this way she can gain more customers and this leaves her with better earnings which she will invest in the education of their children.

This loan is to purchase groceries and stock her store. She has been a member of the loan group from the beginning.  She likes it because the help she receives from the loans allows her to improve her  business and their life. 

Her dreams are to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Zead

texts.en:
Zead is a 21-year-old man from Rafah City, in the Gaza Strip, which is a difficult place to live due to the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007. He is single and lives with his family in a small house. Zead works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.

He wants to improve himself and be an entrepreneur and his business idea is to sell cosmetics and accessories for ladies. Zead took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start his own business. He hopes that, by taking this loan, Zead will be able to improve his family's conditions. Zead appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start his own business.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama San Jose, es un grupo unido y nuevo, donde las integrantes vieron una esperanza de crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, esto gracias al programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mauricia quien en su encuesta mostro que está en una situación de pobreza extrema, pero ella se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de la venta de gallinas que está haciendo. Comenta que aunque su trabajo es humilde, está luchando por sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de pollitos para poder criar y luego venderlos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: The San Jose group is a new and supportive group whose members saw an opportunity to grow and improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones through then eliminating poverty programme. One of the group's members is Mauricia who, in her survey, showed that she lives in extreme poverty. Nevertheless, she works with great effort to improve her living conditions by selling hens. She says that although her work is quite simple, she is fighting for the sake of her loved ones. She is applying for this loan to buy chicks to raise and then sell. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Ñambaapo Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Ñambaapo Oñondivepa integrado  por  15 mujeres, está en el 1er. ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y a la vez están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por poder crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Sonia quien vende comidas que ella misma hace todos los días , se encarga de preparar cada comida, y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con la elaboración y venta de sus comidas.
texts.en:
The Ñambaapo Oñondivepa group is made up of 15 women. They are in the first cycle of the Committee of Women program, where they all work and are also in the elimination of poverty program, striving to be able to grow.

One of the members is Sonia, who sells food that she herself prepares every day. She is in charge of preparing all the food. Because of her sales, she has the means to be able to support her family and provide them a better quality of life. She seeks this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of ingredients to be able to make her dishes, such as meat, vegetables, and condiments, among others. In this manner she will be able to continue preparing and selling her dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food, such as meat, vegetables, condiments and others.

loans.name: Babra

texts.en:
Babra is 23 years old and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. Babra runs a poultry project selling broiler chickens in her local community. With her first Kiva loan, she expanded her business to produce 150-200 chicks per batch. She has been able to buy bulk stock feeds and to build a very big fowl run that will carry 200-300 chickens.

She is requesting a second loan so that she can further expand the capacity of her business. Now a major breadwinner in her family, Babra is able to buy clothes for her parents and younger sisters. Babra is also saving some of her profits so that when she gets a place at a teaching college she can train as a teacher, she can finance her own education. She continues to gain valuable experience through her volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, working with students at a local secondary school.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, chick feeds and vaccines.

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en: Chanthol’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chanthol makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller by selling cake to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Ninh's Group

texts.en: Ninh’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ninh makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Angela Narcisa

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días el Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es artesano.
Doña Ángela junto al esposo se dedican  a la artesanía,  ellos compran la piel de las vacas las mismas que luego procesan y curten con ciertos líquidos especiales, luego con este cuero ellos elaboran  riendas de caballos, baticolas, bozales,  monturas y otros trabajos que realizan con el cuero para adornar los caballos, ellos elaboran estos productos los mismos que luego entregan a comerciantes que los llevan a  otras ciudades y a otros países a vender, esta actividad la viene realizando su marido desde hace mas de 30 años y que es la forma como  se han ganado la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar cuero, tintes y muchos otros materiales para elaborar sus productos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque es así como ellos salen adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the area known as Estancia Vieja, in the Colon parish, Portoviejo city, is where the community bank Estancia Vieja meet every two weeks.  This a town of humble people dedicated to agriculture and trade in general.

This is where Angela lives.  She is 49 years old and lives in a common law relationship from which she has two grown children who are independent.  The husband is a craftsman.

Doña Angela, along with her husband, works as craft people.  

They buy cow skins which are then processed and tanned with certain special liquids.  They make these into leather which is then made into reins for horses, tail belts, muzzles, saddles and other work they do in leather to decorate the horses.

They make these products and then deliver them to dealers that bring them to other cities and other countries to sell.

Her husband has been working in this activity for over 30 years and this is the way in which they have earned a living.

This loan is to purchase leather, dyes and many other materials to make their products. 

She has been a member of the community bank from the start and likes it because this is how they are able to move forward. 

Her dreams are to be in good health.

loans.use: to purchase leather, dyes and other materials.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en: Faustino is 61 years old. He has 4 children and he lives with his wife in Tambogrande, Piura-Perú. He grows organic mangoes. Faustino needs $500 for buying fertilizer for his fields to increase the organic mango production. With the additional income, he will buy a laptop for his daughter because she studies industrial engineering and needs a laptop for her work.

loans.use: to buy manure for his organic mango production.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cecelia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Cecelia is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices and other utensils for her food production business.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices and other utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo tiene 16 integrantes, el grupo se llama Kuña guapa, lo que quiere decir mujer trabajadora, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Cada integrante de este grupo es muy trabajadora, se esfuerzan y luchan, entre las que se destaca la Sra. Edil, quien es modista, hace confecciones de todo tipo y comenta que sus clientes siempre quedan muy conformes con los trabajos que hace.
Edil siempre se esfuerza para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos a través de su trabajo, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group has 16 member, and is called Kuña Guapa, which means "hardworking woman." They are in the Elimination of Poverty program, fighting to improve their living conditions and those of their families. Each member of this group is very hardworking. They strive and fight.

Among them, Edil stands out. She is a seamstress who makes all kinds of clothes. She states that her customers are always very content with the work she does. Edil always strives to be able to support her loved ones through her work. She seeks a loan to buy fabrics, threads, elastic, and other products. In this way she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastic and other products to use in making clothing.

loans.name: Yessica Monserrate

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días el Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Yessica, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, el mismo que  estudian en jardín de infantes. El marido es Ing. civil.
Doña Yessica es una gran madre y esposa  que lucha día a día para sacar  adelante su hogar, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, edredones, zapatos, cortinas entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella realiza sus recorridos  cuatro días por semana allí mismo deja y cobra  ya que  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 2  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual logra ganar sus propios recursos que le sirven para salir adelante ya que su marido tiene tiempo que no  trabaja.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, sabanas, cortinas y otras prendas. Ella lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó esta actividad comercial. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a su hijo.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, in the area known as Estancia Vieja, the Communal Bank of Estancia Vieja meets in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place with humble people who work in agriculture and commerce in general.

This is where Yessica lives. She is 34 years old, in a civil union, and has a four year old son who is in kindergarden. Her husband is a civil engineer.

Yessica is a great mother and wife who strives everyday to provide for her household. She works in commerce and sells all kinds of clothes: sheets, quilts, shoes, and curtains, amongst others. She sells her products door-to-door. She completes her routes four days a week in which she delivers products on credit and charges them every week. She has been doing this work for more than two years, which allowed her to earn her own income and get ahead, since her husband has not worked for some time.

With this loan she will buy clothes, shoes, sheets, curtains, and other garments. She has been in the Grupo De Crédito [Loan Group] for two years, and likes it because thanks to these loans, she was able to start her business. Her dream is to provide the best things for her son.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, sheets, curtains, and other garments.

loans.name: Zoila Elena

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días el Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 23 años de edad es casada y de esta  relación tienen un hijo de 7 años de edad, el mismo que  estudian en escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Zoila es una mujer muy luchadora que le toca trabajar muy duro para ayudarle a su marido el cual no gana mucho en sus actividades en el campo, para esto ella todos los fines de semana se desplaza a la ciudad de Guayaquil ciudad en la cual su papá tiene un local en un mercado de la ciudad donde vende pollos enteros o por libras,  él para ayudarle a su hija le da pollos los días sábados y domingos para que ella vende por su cuenta. Ella requiere del crédito pues la inversión en estos días es grande y  no tiene, es por eso que solicita los créditos ya que es así como ella puede salir adelante, lleva más de 2 años con esta actividad con la cual se gana muy buenos ingresos por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos para la venta. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que  le dan con los créditos.  Sus sueños son tener un local propio para vender todos los días.
texts.en:
In the area known as Estancia Vieja, in the Colon parrish, in the city of Portoviejo, the Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja meets every 15 days. It is a place with humble people who earn a living in agriculture and general commerce.

Ms. Zoila lives in this place. She is 23 years old, married, and from this marriage they have a 7-year-old child who studies in school. Her husband earns a living in agriculture.

Ms. Zoila is a very hard working woman. It is her turn to work very hard in order to help her husband, who does not earn much in his field work. For this, she leaves every weekend for the city of Guayaquil where her father has a market stand where he sells chickens whole and by the pound. In order to help his daughter, he gives her chickens on Saturdays and Sundays for her to sell on her own account.

She needs a loan as the investment on these days is large and she does not have enough. Because of this, she requests loans. It is already like she can get ahead. She brings more than 2 years with this business with which she earns very good income for her family's wellbeing.

This loan will be used to buy chickens for sale. She has been in the "Grupo de Crédito" ["Credit Group"] for 2 years and likes it for the help that they give her with the loans.

Her dream is to have her own stand in order to sell every day.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Mathew Nahabi

texts.en:
Mathew is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mathew is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Mathew would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Mathew will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Mathew now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: San Cayetano 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, esforzándose para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio del programa.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosalba quien vende bebidas y también comidas, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar y tener los medios para poder dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones. Es una mujer sacrificada que pese a los inconvenientes lucha para poder salir adelante y seguir dando a su familia una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas variadas e insumos de todo tipo para poder hacer comidas y de esa forma poder vender.
texts.en:
The group San Cayetano 2 is in the first cycle of the Committee of Women, where they all work and help each other to move forward. They are using the elimination of poverty measurement tool, striving to be able to help their loved ones through the program.

One of the members is Rosalba, who sells drinks and prepared foods. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person who gives her all to improve and have the means to be able to give her family a life with dignity and without hardship. She is a sacrificial woman, who despite obstacles fights to be able to get ahead and to continue to give her family a life with dignity. She seeks this loan to be able to buy varied drinks and ingredients of all types to be able to make prepared food, in order to be able to make sales.

loans.use: to buy varied drinks and ingredients of all kinds to be able to make prepared food.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married with four children living in a three room house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has face some difficulties in live which are the death of her loved ones, sickness, embarrassments from her in-laws and the difficulty to send her children to school and pay the school fees.

With the new loan, she will buy seedlings like beans, maize, yam tuber, fertilizer for her farm. Also part of the loan will be used to buy fowls for her small poultry, buy feed, and part of the loan will be used to buy vaccine for her fowls. She is positive that this business will succeed because she has being doing farmer for long and has a good market site for her farm produce and steady customers. More so, the villagers are very impressed because their time will be saved to go far to buy fowls for their families.

With the profit from this loan she will buy more fowls, build her house, pay the children’s school fees and expand her business. She prefer a loan from GHAPE because of its low interest, the loan will be paid in installments, low interest rates and the repayment duration is unstressful also because of the non-financial services offer by the organization such as training and social networking.

loans.use: to buy yam tuber, maize, beans, fertilizer, fowls and feed.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Itá, está en su primer ciclo, cada una pone su mayor entusiasmo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mercedes quien s través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la venta de Ropas que hace en forma ambulante, se gana la vida de una manera digna.
Mercedes pone todo de sí para poder crecer y dar a su familia una calidad de vida digna y que no les falta nada.
La Sra. Mercedes solicita  este préstamo para la compra de las prendas de vestir, blusas, remeras, pantalones, entre otros, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas y tener los medios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group was formed in the city of Itá. It is in its first cycle. Each member brings great enthusiasm in order to be able to improve their living conditions. One of the members is Mercedes, who through effort and continuous work, and the sale of clothes which she does as a street seller, makes a living in a dignified manner. Mercedes gives her all to be able to grow and give her family a dignified quality of life in which they lack nothing.

Mercedes seeks this loan to buy items of clothing such as blouses, shirts, and pants, among other things. In this manner she will be able to continue with her sales, and have the means to help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing items such as blouses, shirts, and pants, among others.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 46-year-old single lady who started twenty years ago working as a hairdresser to cover the needs and expenses of her family that consists of two members. She is a hard worker and independent lady who is well-known in her area for her professional skills in beauty care domain.

Today, Amina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through buying a car which will facilitate her work and help her move easily to her client's houses.
Amina hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car, which will help her move easily to her client's houses.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
This is Rogelio, 37 years old, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Has a live-in partner named Blessie who takes care of their Elementary child. Majority of Filipinos who live in rural areas experience poverty for lack of financial resources to get an education for better job opportunities. 

Rogelio is into food business. He cooks and sells popular street food in the Philippines such as squid balls, fish and chicken balls,"tokneneng" (deep-fried orange batter covered hard-boiled egg) served with sweet sour or spicy sauce. Filipinos loved to eat them for snacks. He stations his stall in a populated area. 

He hopes trusts out of your good heart you could lend him funds in the amount of Php 11000 to pay for dozens of chicken balls, fish balls, squid balls, chicken, eggs and seasonings to cook and sell at his community. He is thanking God and you in advance for your valued help. It will help him really sustain his business to feed his family.  

Rogelio aims and dreams to one day have a small eatery to give his loved ones a better quality of life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for chicken balls, fish balls, squid balls, chicken, eggs and seasonings for the sauce to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a 49-year-old mother of five children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Analiza has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business such as, vegetables, meat, and spices..

Analiza has been in this business for three years. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business such as, vegetables, meat, and spices.

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita is 61 years old and widowed with four children. Sanita works very hard to provide for them.

Sanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap and personal care products.

Sanita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Sanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap and personal care products.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a 60-year-old married mother of nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Fe has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell from her stall.

Fe has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Yonnel

texts.en:
Yonnel is 41 years old and married with two children, both in school, Yonnel works very hard to provide for her family.

Yonnel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap and personal care products.

Yonnel has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Yonnel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap and personal care products.

loans.name: Johannes

texts.en:
Johannes is 50 years old and lives together with his wife and 2 school- going children. He has converted half of his rice plot into a fish farm and poultry business. He has sheep, ducks and laying hens. Furthermore, he planted fruit and vegetables on the dams.

On the other half of the rice plots he cultivates rice and uses that as poultry feed.

Johannes wants now to dig a fish pond. For this he needs a loan of SRD 4.000. His long terms goal is to use his plot completely, earn enough to reach self sustainability for him and his family.

loans.use: to dig a fish pond

loans.name: Vatha

texts.en:
Vatha is 18 years old and she is an Accounting student who lives in the Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. Her father is a policeman and her mother is a factory worker. Vatha is a hardworking student.

Because she is short of finances to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year, she has decided to borrow the money. This money will help her earn a bachelor’s degree and have a chance to find a proper job for her future. For her dream after graduation, Vatha hopes to work in a bank, build a new proper house for her parents to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year, for a BSc. in Accountancy.

loans.name: Tojikhon

texts.en:
Tojikhon was born in 1991 and is an industrious woman. Tojikhon is single and lives with her parents in Tajikistan.

Tojikhon has been busy buying and selling fruit from a store at a local market. She has been in business for more than four years. She mainly sells lemons, bananas and apples.

Tojikhon is going to increase her working capital by developing her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to achieve her goal. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as apples and bananas.

loans.name: La Virginia Group

texts.es:
La Virginia se llama este grupo, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son 17 mujeres muy unidas y sacrificadas que quieren superar cualquier situación que puedan presentarse.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Andrea quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, también se debe destacar la lucha que ella hace para poder ir superándose a sí misma, y de esa manera poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Andrea agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo al formar parte de este grupo.
La Sra. Andrea solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para vender, como ser: verduras, frutas, carne, hortalizas, panificados y otros, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Virginia", and is part of a programme to eliminate poverty. The 17 women that make up the close knit, self sacrificing group want to overcome whatever situation they may find themselves in.

Andrea is one of the members of the group, and makes a living by selling clothes. The effort she makes to improve herself to provide a better life for her family is worth emphasizing . Andrea is grateful for the opportunity she has by being a part of this group. She is asking for a loan to buy goods for sale, such as: green vegetables, fruit, meat, vegetables, baked goods and so forth. This will allow her to firm up her business plan and help to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods for sale, such as; vegetables, fruit, meat, garden produce, baked goods and other items

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 72 years old and married with 12 children. Caridad works very hard to provide for them.

Caridad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Caridad has been in this business for 50 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, eggs, hopia, soft drinks, coffee, condiments and other groceries.

In the future, Caridad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Sydney

texts.en:
Sydney is 31 years old and single with one child who is still in school, Sydney works very hard to provide for them.

Sydney runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap and other personal care products.

Sydney has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Sydney would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap and other personal care products

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 29 years old and has three children. Lenie is a woman and one of her children is in school.

Lenie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lenie requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lenie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lenie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Chihera Group

texts.en:
“Chihera” is a Shona clan name based upon the Eland whose brothers or fathers are “Mhofu”. Members of the clan are well known for working hard and are highly respected. The Chihera group consists of three members of the same totem (zvihera) which can be translated as “the sacred”. Jesca, a hardworking widow, aged 41 is a cross border trader restocking from South Africa and supplying small shops in Zimbabwe since 2009. Before, she used to be a dressmaker selling her products in Mozambique then Lesotho. Business was flourishing, crossing the border five or six times a month.

After prosperous adventures she managed to make good profits which she then used to put a dura-wall at her homestead and re-furnish her home. A better life is what we all wish for; and she has been working extra hard to provide for her family. She managed to send her children to boarding schools and her siblings too and bought a car. However, due to the economic hardships that have bedevilled Zimbabwe, 2013 began to be yet another turning point in her life as many people flooded into the informal business sector giving her stiff competition. Jesca broadened her products ranging from tracksuits, traveling bags, satchels and kitchenware and other goods that were market dominant during the time.

Her business continued to decline, as she said, “my husband fell ill, could not do any work and I was the only one working for the family. This also hindered my business operations as I had to take good care of him simultaneously and pay his medical bills”.

However, this did not stop Jesca, strong like the Eland even with all these hardships she is still in business. She is now operating with less capital. She needs $500 to inject into her business so that it gets vibrant. “Gore rino tichadzidza zvakawanda” (meaning 2015 is a year of learning) sums up her thanks to Thrive’s trainings which have taught her how to keep financial records and plan effectively. With the loan she will restock with household products to sell from her stall.

loans.use: to restock with household products to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is the age of 49 and living along with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son runs a small business with the help of his cousins. His practice is to paste sequins, pearls and precious stones over shawls and he has been selling them in the market.

He wants to expand his production, and for this is reason he wants to buy additional raw materials.
Therefore, Zahida has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son; he will utilize the amount to purchase sequins, gums, pearls and shawls to increase his business.
She wishes is to provide better education and medical facilities to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material for her son's embroidery pasting business.

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en:
Rutchel is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rutchel is 55 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rutchel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rutchel requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell .

Rutchel has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rutchel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 36 years old now.

Alma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Analie works hard to support her family.

She has a food processing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Analie is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her business such as, flour, spices, etc. for her food processing business.

Analie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business such as, flour, spices, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmen is 60 years old now.

Carmen has a buy and sell beverages business in the Philippines. Carmen requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of beverages to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for 33 years. In the future, Carmen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of beverages to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 54 years old and married with five children. Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Elvira has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Ruhsat

texts.en: Ruhsat was born in 1996. She is a student in the second course of the Medical University of Tajikistan. Ruhsat will be a dentist in the future after graduating from the university. Ruhsat studied at school well and now she is one of the successful students. Her teachers like her because she is hardworking and clever. Ruhsat is asking for a loan because she must pay for her university tuition. Her parents have no opportunity to pay for the university tuition for Ruhsat. She awaits your mercy and she dreams of being a good doctor in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Nosir

texts.en:
Nosir was born in 1964 year. He is married and has 2 sons. His sons are in 19 and 9 years age. Nosir more than 20 years has been busy with animal husbandry, raising cows. He lives in a village and that’s why he has good opportunity to develop this business. Nosir has a great experience in this field.

His income is not enough to hold the wedding party for his son and that’s why he is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni from IMON and KIVA. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold the wedding party for his son.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 36 years old and has one child. Salome is married and her child is in school.

Salome is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Salome requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Salome has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Salome would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Pheap’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Pheap makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old and has four children. Jocelyn is married and has four children in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  “KUÑA GUAPA”  está en su ciclo número 1º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos de una mujer exitosa cada una se encuentra creciendo.
Silvana es una de las que integra este grupo, tiene una modesta peluquería en la que trabaja todos los días, es una mujer muy trabajadora que sobresale gracias a su trabajo y lucha diaria.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y otros.
texts.en:
The group named “KUÑA GUAPA” is in its first loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program, where all women work and help each other to get ahead. Through effort, continued work and the practice of habits of a successful woman, all of them are progressing. 

Silvana is one of the members of this group. She has a modest hair salon where she works every day. She is a very diligent woman who excels thanks to her daily labor and struggle. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, conditioners and others, in order to be able to continue providing a good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, conditioners and others.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old, with seven children. With two children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a 37-year-old married woman living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a very poor and needy woman. The major problem with her poverty is that her husband has not adopted a profitable business yet. She is passing her life with her family hand to mouth.

Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed the whole family. Due to continuously working, the planks have broken and lose their smoothness, which means they need to be replaced with new ones.

Now her husband is unable to continue his business without smooth planks, wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Naila requested a loan for her husband so that her husband will be able to buy new smooth wooden boards and bamboo to continue his business again.

Naila hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy sheltering material such as wooden planks and bamboo for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Heydi Karina

texts.es:
Heydi  es una joven de 20 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, actualmente está acompañada, su compañero de vida se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y también atiende un molino, tienen dos hijos en común de 5 y 3 años de edad.

Heydi es dueña de una tienda la cual está ubicada en su casa, tiene a la venta todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como bebidas, granos básicos, golosinas, etc; el cual aperturó por iniciativa propia; esto lo hizo porque en su cantón no existía ninguna tienda y las personas de dicha comunidad tenían que viajar mucho tiempo para ir a comprar los productos que necesitaban en su hogar. Su compañero de vida se encarga de atender un molino que tienen en su misma casa de habitación. El horario de trabajo de Heydi es de lunes a domingo de 08:00 a.m hasta las 05:00 p.m


El presente crédito Heydi lo utilizará para comprar bebidas, golosinas, granos básicos, azúcar, café, condimentos, huevos, aceite, etc para tener mas surtida su tienda, de esta manera podrá cubrir la demanda de clientes.

Heydi sueña con darle a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir una vida digna, especialmente a sus hijos, ya que desea brindarles una buena educación y todo lo que ellos necesiten. Con el presente crédito, Heydi  incrementará el inventario de su tienda y de esta manera aumentará sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Heydi is a young girl aged 20 who studied up to the eight grade. She currently is in a relationship and her partner engages in agriculture, growing basic grains on top of working in a mill. They have two children aged 5 and 3.

Heydi owns a shop, located in her own house, where she sells a wide variety of basic necessities such as drinks, basic grains and sweets. She opened this activity on her own, and she decided for this kind of business because there where no shops in her village and it took a lot of time to the people of her community to go buy the products they need for their families. Her partner works in a mill located in their own house. Heydi works Mondays to Sundays from 8 am to 5 pm.

The loan Heydi is requesting will be used to buy drinks, sweets, basic grains, sugar, coffee, dressings, eggs and oil on top of other products, in order to better stock her shop up and to be able to satisfy her customers' requests.

Heydi's dream is to provide her family with everything they need to live a decent life, caring in particular for he children, to whom she wants to grant a good education and provide for everything they need. Thanks to this loan, Heydi will stock up the inventory of her shop, consequently increasing her sales and her earnings.

loans.use: buy drinks, sweets, basic grains, sugar, coffee, dressings, eggs and oil to stock up her inventory.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old and widowed with ten children. With five children in school, Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Lourdes has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Challenge Accepted Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy is 43 years old and she is married. She has been selling scrap metal for 10 years.

Thúy lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region. The income from her business is not high enough for her to cover the living costs and save money.

The main hardship that Thúy faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase her income by purchasing more scrap metal to resell.

In 2011, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of "Challenge Accepted", which consists of seven members.

In the future, Thúy hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase her income by purchasing more scrap metal to resell.

loans.name: Elenida

texts.en:
Elenida works hard to support her family. Elenida is widowed with five children and has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines.

Elenida requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase assorted clothes and pants to sell to her stall.

Elenida has been in this business for 7 years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Elenida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothes and pants to sell to her stall

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina de 57 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de nivel básico, actualmente está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y también trabaja como vigilante en una gasolinera ubicada a unos doscientos metros de su vivienda; tienen hijos pero ya son mayores de edad y cada quien cuenta con su vivienda y se mantienen solos.


Aquilina se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos en su caserío, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, ella se encarga de comprar cerdos pequeños, luego los desarrolla a basa de concentrados de buena calidad para un buen crecimiento; así como también realiza compra de medicamentos para mantener libres de cualquier enfermedad a sus animales,. Aquilina tiene que recorrer una distancia corta para lograr vender sus animales, ya que a las personas que se los vende viven en su mismo cantón.


Aquilina necesita el préstamo para comprar medicamentos, vitaminas, desparasitantes, inyecciones, etc. Para mantener en buen estado a sus cerdos.

Aquilina sueña con dar a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir bien y que en su casa no falte nada para su bienestar.
texts.en:
Aquilina, 57, attended school until the third grade. She is married, her husband works in agriculture and also has a job as a security guard in a gas station located two hundred meters from their home. They have children, but they are all grown and live in their own homes and support themselves.

Aquilina raises and sells pigs on their property, she learned this work from her parents. She buys piglets, and raises them on high quality feed so they grow well. She also buys medicines to make sure her pigs stay free of disease. Aquilina only has to go a short distance to sell her animals, since the people she sells to live in the same vicinity.

Aquilina needs the loan to buy medicines, vitamins, anti-parasiticals, injections, etc. to maintain her pigs in good condition.

Aquilina dreams of giving her family everything necessary to live well, and that they lack for nothing in their home.

loans.use: to buy medicines, vitamins, anti-parasitics, injections etc. to maintain her pigs in good condition.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de 39 años de edad,  estudió hasta bachillerato, actualmente está acompañada, su compañero de vida se dedica a realizar viajes en un vehículo tipo Pick Up en su mismo cantón, María tiene dos hijas las cuales están estudiando.


María es dueña de una tienda y  un comedor el cual esta ubicada en su casa en dicha tienda tiene a la venta todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como bebidas, granos básicos, golosinas, etc;  esto lo hizo porque en su cantón no existía ninguna tienda y las personas de su comunidad tenían que viajar mucho tiempo para ir a comprar los productos que necesitaban en su hogar. Sus dos hijas ayudan a atender el negocio cuando María tiene que salir.- El horario en que atienda su negocio es de lunes a domingo de 08:00 a.m hasta las 05:00 p.m.


El presente crédito María lo utilizará para comprar bebidas, golosinas, granos básicos, condimentos, café, azúcar, pan, huevos, sopas, etc. y de esta manera espera que pueda tener otros productos disponibles que algunos de sus cliente le solicitan.

María sueña con darle a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir una vida digna, especialmente a sus hijas, ya que desea brindarles una buena educación y todo lo que ellas necesiten.
texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old and studied to high school level. She is currently in a relationship and her partner earns a living with a pick-up truck in his own canton. Maria has two daughters who are studying.

Maria owns a shop and a canteen which is based in her home. The store is sells all kinds of products such as drinks, grains and candy. She started the business because there wasn't a store in her canton and the people in her community had to travel far in order to buy the products they needed at home. Her two daughters help out with the business when Mary isn't there. The schedule for her business is from Monday through to Sunday from 8am to 5pm.

Mary will use the current loan to buy drinks, sweets, grains, spices, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs and soups. Through this she hopes to have other products available which some of her customers ask for.

Maria dreams of giving her family everything they need to live a decent life, especially her daughters, because she wants to provide them with a good education and everything they need.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sweets, grains, spices, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs and soups in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Inspired Ladies Group

texts.en:
Constance, 56 of the Inspired Ladies group hopes to further her inspiration to better her life. She is in the poultry and pre-school businesses. Constance started her poultry business in 2014 and currently her pre-school has an enrolment of thirty one pupils. Constance is greatly inspired by children. Her passion is in teaching and she believes that education is the most powerful weapon which one can use to change the world. In dealing with the little toddlers at her pre-school, she believes that most worry about what a child will become tomorrow, yet they forget that they are someone today. Her goal is to unleash that potential in every child she meets. In addition to her passion in teaching children, Constance also rears chickens for resale. She does batches of 50 birds at a time and has a large clientele base in the form of her pupil’s parents.
Constance came to know Thrive through a friend and where both eager to learn much about its operations because of their business financial limitations. She was interested to discover that in addition to lending, Thrive is committed to help women in furthering their knowledge enabling them to make informed business decisions and how best to deal with the loans they are given. She enjoyed the training greatly and leaned a lot during the period. She is looking forward to building a more conducive and reliable pre-school infrastructure and improve her business capacity. With a loan from Thrive, Constance also hopes to increase her batches of chicken from 50 to a 100 to be able to cater for her fast increasing clientele base.

loans.use: to redecorate her pre-school and increase the number of chickens she is helping.

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en: Run’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Run makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Kyrey está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Concepción, la cuan aún se encuentra en crecimiento, es una zona alejada de la capital del país que no accede a muchos beneficios.
La Sra. Marta es una de las integrantes, ella se dedicaba al trabajo en su casa, pero con la intención de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia se unió a este grupo, y pide este préstamo para poder montar un copetín, donde podrá vender comidas como  empanadas, sándwiches, croquetas, etc., lo que le permitirá poder tener un negocio fijo para poder tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
Marta agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The group called "Kuña Kyrey" is in their first loan cycle with the Woman's Committee program. It is located in the city of Concepción, which is still growing. It is an area far from the capital that doesn't receive many benefits.

Marta is one of the members. She works taking care of her house, but with the goal of improving her living conditions and that of her family she joined this group. She is requesting a loan to open a snack bar where she can sell foods like empanadas, sandwiches, croquettes, etc. This will allow her to have a regular business to have more income for her family.

Marta is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to open a snack shop to sell a variety of foods.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie livesd in Concepcion, Iloilo where most of the community earns a living through fishing. She and her husband, a fisherman, have been proficiently doing this livelihood for 20 years. They work together to give the best to their children. They have eight children; three adult and five-school-aged children. Thus, Elsie is asking for a bigger amount of loan to buy fishing net, fishing weights and fishing rope (that serves as the main line of fishing net). In the future, she wants to enhance their livelihood to have enough money to send her children to school. Elsie dreams of letting her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing weights and fishing rope

loans.name: Atwagala Development Group

texts.en:
Grace is a repeat client with Ugafode Microfinance. Previously she applied for a loan of UGX 500,000. She is a married woman with children.

She is a businesswoman practicing agriculture, especially maize and ground nuts. In a bid to increase her working capital to expand in the agriculture business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy a plough to quicken her process. However, she is faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

The picture includes the whole group including all the members who have just signed the waiver form, as some of them are still saving in order to be able to acquire the loan next year. They appreciate the vision that the Kiva funders have of alleviating poverty in rural communities.

loans.use: to buy agriculture equipment.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel lives a simple life with her family in the town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines. She is a 43-year-old woman, and a mother of six children; two adult and four school-aged children. Her husband works hard as a fisherman, while Richel helps her husband with this livelihood. They have been doing this for two years to earn a living and to support the needs of their family.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials, but her main reason why she is asking for a loan is to buy dried fish. Perhaps, she is thinking of other business opportunities like selling fish to the community that will help her augment their livelihood. Richel’s only wish is to live a harmonious life and have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and dried fish.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband but at the time of purchasing she was short of some money. Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of their savings. She had received a loan in past but she could not buy the rickshaw for her husband due to household expenses. This time, she will successfully buy the new rickshaw with the contribution of their savings.

Shamim is a 36-year-old woman living with her seven children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She hopes that this time her husband can easily generate sufficient income to cherish his children and can pay all the installments on time. She is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband so he can generate sufficient income to cherish his huge family.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina works with her husband producing aluminum chancellery. It is now more of a family business where her to older sons also help producing, measuring and selling the chancellery. The only family member that does not work in the business if their daughter, Damaris, who was eager to be on the picture with her mom. Georgina and her husband work hard to give their kids a better life that the one they had. Although they do help in the business, they all still attend school because they are convinced that education brings opportunities.

Little by little the family has built what they today call home, however there are still major things missing. Damaris sleeps with her parents because she can no longer share room with her brothers. She is soon to reach puberty and this arrangement will no longer work. The family share the restroom and they use the neighbors shower at nights when she "rents" them out. Georgina has started building the second floor to her house that will allow for a complete bathroom and an additional bedroom for her and husband.

She is asking for a credit to finish with the construction so the family can live more comfortably and they can stop scheduling and paying for their showers. Because the family business is not a formal business and they have a low income, Georgina and her husband have no access to credit from traditional institutions or organizations. With this credit Georgina will be able to give her family a better life and as she says, rewards everyone's hard work.

loans.use: to provide a proper home and finally a full bathroom for her family.

loans.name: Haydee Noemi

texts.es:
Haydee Noemi con 18 años, de estado civil soltera,vive junto a su madre, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Haydee Noemi se dedica a prestar servicio de costura,arreglos de prendas y confección de blusas, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 meses. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio. De esta manera le facilitará obtener mayores ingresos.

Haydee Noemi es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Haydee Noemi is 18 years old and single. She lives with her mother in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, in the department of Lambayeque, Perú. She has very good references both personal and for work from the people in her area. The inhabitants of this place work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Haydee Noemi works offering her services sewing, altering clothing and making blouses. She has more than 10 months experience in the field. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business. In this way will help her gain greater income.

Haydee Noemi is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sewing business.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar is a 38-year-old woman living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw, which does not belong to him. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. The engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new rickshaw. He wants to start driving but is looking for a lump sum amount.

Therefore, Kausar has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a new rickshaw and can drive his rickshaw happily. Kausar hopes that now her husband will be able to generate constant income.

Kausar is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband so he can start driving and can generate income for family.

loans.name: Bidala

texts.en:
Bidala is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a cashew nuts selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Bidala is requesting a loan to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is the age of 32, living along with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her house is situated in backward area, and roads are unpaved with a poor sanitary system.

According to people's needs her husband setup a small motorbike showroom. Initially he presented few bikes for offering on an installment basis. He wants to buy two more bikes of another brand, but he has no cash left in hand. This is the reason Shabana has requested a loan for her husband's showroom. By utilizing amount, he will buy new bikes. He hopes that his business will work well and he will be able to generate reasonable income in this business.

Shabana wants a separate home in an established society, so she can provide a better atmosphere for her children. She will spend money for household expenses and make saving as well. She is thankful for this honorable support to Kiva, Kiva lenders, and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new motorbikes for her husband's newly setup showroom.

loans.name: Narjes

texts.en:
Narjes is a 33-year-old divorced lady who runs her home based clothes selling business to cover her increasing living expenses.

Narjes has five years of experience in her domain and is working hard to develop her business so that one day she can manage opening a specialized clothes selling shop. Since Narjes's business has been successful lately, she acquired a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her current clothing merchandise with the newly released winter season clothes collection.

She hopes that this loan will help increase her sales and allow her to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to increase her current clothing merchandise with the newly released winter season clothes collection.

loans.name: Mariles

texts.en:
Mariles is 35 years old, married and has two children. She has involved herself in a direct-selling business as the source of her income. She has been in her business for about three years now. She wants to sell more products, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy colognes, perfumes, soap and shampoo to sell.

In the future, Mariles hopes to keep selling products to gain good profits for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy colognes, perfumes, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Kaphemba

texts.en:
Kaphemba is a 32-year-old, motorcycle transporter at Mariakani, Kenya. She is a mother of four, whose spouse provides with additional income. She has been in this business for the last four years, doing well.

This is her third time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, after successfully servicing her loan. She will use the money to purchase a second motorcycle and the anticipated profits to educate her children. She hopes to own several motorcycles in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a second motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
María Emilia con 27 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural.Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

María Emilia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, artículos de aseo, etc, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio,su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de SU vivienda y para la compra de mercadería, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona.

María Emilia es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido 5 créditos de S/.500,00; S/.1000,00; S/.1500,00; S/.2000,00 y S/.2501,00 los cuales los ha pagado de manera puntual
texts.en:
María Emilia is 27 years old.  She is in a live-in relationship.  She lives with her partner and her two children in a rural area in the Oyotún district of the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, Peru.  The people in this area mainly work in agriculture, ranching, and trade.  María Emilia has very good personal references, as well as good work references from those living in her area. 

María Emilia works selling groceries such as milk, oil, rice, sugar, soda, cleaning products, etc., and has more than five years of experience in this business.  Her business is located in her home.  She is asking for this loan to make repairs on her home and also to buy merchandise.  This investment will serve to increase her sales, with a great influence on her business.  In this way she plans to have a larger stock of products to take care of the diverse needs, requirements, and tastes of her customers in the area.

María Emilia is an ongoing client of Edpyme Alternativa.  She has had five loans of 500 soles, 1,000 soles, 1,500 soles, 2,000 soles, and 2,501 soles, all of which she has paid on time.

loans.use: to make repairs on her home, and to buy merchandise

loans.name: Fatuma
