texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma has operated a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of seasonality in her place of operation. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos que asisten a la escuela, mientras su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura.

Dora, se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 5 años, ella lo hace 3 días a la semana, porque los otros dos días de la semana los dedica para vender tamales por las tardes; todos sus productos los vende en el caserío donde vive, porque es muy conocida y termina rápido sus productos.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más verduras para vender más y así obtener mejores ganancias para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia.

Dora, sueña con ver graduados a sus hijos, además de seguir trabajando duro con su pareja, para que a sus hijos no les haga falta lo necesario.
texts.en:
Dora, age 37, went to school through the seventh grade.  She is in a relationship and has three children who are in school.  Her partner works in agriculture.

Dora has worked selling vegetables for five years.  She does this three days a week, because the other two days of the week she sells tamales in the afternoons.  She sells all of her products from the house where she lives.  She is very well known and her products sell out quickly.

She needs this loan to buy more vegetables in order to sell more and, in this way, get better earnings in order to meet the basic needs of her family.

Dora dreams of seeing her children graduate.  She also wants to keep working hard alongside her partner so that her children aren’t lacking for anything.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables in order to sell more

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Sanjuaneras Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres SanJuaneras sigue siendo conformado por doña Claudia  líder de este dúo, sigue manteniendo su negocio de venta de producto medicinal Onmilife, a la fecha doña Claudia se siente muy motivada ya que sigue compartiendo este beneficio a varias   personas, las asesora y ha creado nuevas fuentes de ingresos para muchas más personas quienes ya la conocen en el área de San Juan y San Raymundo, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos medicinales, espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
The Duo Women of San Juan remains put together by Claudia, the leader of this duo.  She continues to keep her business of selling the medical product Onmilife.

To this date Claudia is very motivated since she is sharing this benefit with several people. She´s giving them advice and has created new sources of income for many more people who already know her well in the San Juan and San Raymundo area.

She requests this loan to buy medical products and hopes that you can help her with the loan.

loans.use: to buy medicine to resale

loans.name: Munojot

texts.en:
Munojot comes from Tajikistan. She is a kind and hardworking woman. Munojot is married and has one child. She has own business deal selling children’s clothes in a local market. She likes little children and she always tries to sell high quality clothes for them.

Munojot has been busy with this business more than 17 years. She has a great experience in this field. Little by little with the passing of the time, she has developed business. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy children’s clothes for the new season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Optimism Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hà is 38 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling a few dry food and general things for more than 10 years. Hà lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is not high enough to cover the life cost and comfort of her life.

The main hardship that Hà faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing more items to sell. In 2012, Hà joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Since then, she has covered the living costs easier and has bought some appliances for her home.

She is the group leader of "Optimism", which consists of four members. In the future, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more items to sell.

loans.name: Lalaina Dolly

texts.fr:
Lalaina a 43 ans. Son mari est un maçon. Le couple a 4 enfants dont trois ( (16-14-10 ans en classe de première, troisième et dixième dans une école publique, l’aîné a arrêté ses études. 
Elle est à son second  prêt pour développer l’activité d’engraissement porcin. Les bénéfices tirés de l’activité antérieure ont servi à la production de briques qui seront encore stockés dans l’attente de la hausse du prix sur le marché. Devant ce problème de trésorerie, elle a demandé ce second prêt. Elle dispose de 25 années d’expérience dans l’élevage: aviculture, engraissement porcin. Elle travaille auprès d’une ONG la matinée et elle s’occupe de l’ élevage l’après midi.
La famille vit dans une maison héritée de ses parents, elle ne paie pas de loyer  mais la maison est très étroite  d’où le projet de construction d’une maison beaucoup plus grande.  Elle compte réaliser son projet à partit de l’extension de l’élevage.
texts.en:
Lalaina, age 43, is married to a mason and the couple have 4 children. Three of them (10, 14 and 16 years old) attend public school in first, third and tenth grade respectively; the eldest is no longer studying.

Lalaina is seeking a second loan to develop her hog fattening activity. Past profits were used to make bricks that are currently stored until market prices go up. Now facing a shortage of funds, Lailana is seeking this new loan. She has 25 years of experience in animal farming, namely poultry raising and hog fattening. She works for a NGO in the morning and switches to animal farming in the afternoon.

The family lives in a house that she inherited from her parents. She doesn't pay rent , but the house is rather small which is why they are planning to build a much larger home. Lalaina expects to achieve this goal through the expansion of her animal fattening activity.

loans.use: to buy 2 pigs.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Progreso está en su 1er ciclo Del programa de comité de mujeres, todas trabajan y se ayudan las unas a las otras por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una participa de manera activa para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Una de las personas que integra este grupo y que se destaca por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora es la Sra. Basilia, quien vende verduras frescas de manera ambulante, y a través de sus ventas tiene los ingresos para procurarse para ella y su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras frescas para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Basilia agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group El Progreso is in their first cycle with the communal bank of women program. They all work and they all help each other to move forward. They are taking part in the Poverty Elimination Survey Project where each one participates in an active manner to be able to help their loved ones.

Basilia is a member of this group and she stands out for being a very hard-working, determined and, above all, entrepreneurial woman. She sells fresh vegetables as a street vendor and through her sales she has the income to give her family a decent life without privations.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fresh vegetables to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. Basilia is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to improve the conditions of her life and those of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 26-year-old, married mother of two. Three years ago, due to the low income of her husband, she started selling cosmetics to help him in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She used to work in a beauty salon before she decided to start her own business. That’s why she has a wide experience in cosmetics and beauty materials.

Sahar is a hardworking and ambitious lady, who is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car which will help her promote her products and move to her client's houses easily. Sahar hopes to expand her business more in the future, to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car to promote her products and move to her client's houses easily.

loans.name: Deysy Margarita

texts.es:
La señorita Deysy es una mujer luchadora, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos que pasan con la abuelita ya que tiene que salir a trabajar en otro sector para salir adelante. Ella vive y tienen su negocio en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos Recinto Chipal este sector tiene un clima cálido húmedo y su gente es muy unida por ser una comunidad pequeña. 
Deysy tiene su negocio de producción de pollos esta actividad la aprendió por iniciativa propia buscando la manera de tener otro ingreso para dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos, a esta actividad le dedica 4 horas diarias, a veces cuando no puede porque debe salir a su trabajo le ayuda su madre pero ella siempre está pendiente de todo; las ventas las realiza en una tienda en los Bancos ya que su hermano trabaja en la misma y es quien le ayuda con el contacto para las entregas.
Con este crédito busca incrementar su producción comprando más pollos ya que tiene mucha demanda y en algún momento dedicarse solo a esta actividad para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos.
La señorita Deysy agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Deysy is a fighter. She is a single mother with three children who spend time with their grandmother as she goes to work in another area in order to get ahead. She lives and has her business in the community of Chipal in San Miguel de los Bancos Cantón. The area has a hot humid climate and it's people are very united being a small community.

Deysy has a business producing chickens. She learned the business on her own initiative searching for a way to have another income to provide a better future for her children. She spends four hours per day at this business. Sometimes she can't as she has to go to work so her mother helps her but she is always looking after everything. She sells her product to a store in Los Bancos as her brother works there and he helps her facilitate the deliveries.

She is looking to increase her production with this loan, buying more chickens as she has high demand and at some point she will just work at this business to spend more time with her children.

Deysy is grateful to Kiva for the support and help they provide.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to increase her production as she has a lot of demand.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 50 years old, and a widow with six grown up children. She lives in a village near Naivasha, northwest of Nairobi. One of her daughters has been very ill for some time. She can barely walk or talk, and is wholly dependent on her mother. The medications required are very expensive and have been a major drain on the family budget.

As a result, Teresia works hard on her farm, cultivating two acres of potatoes, kale and cabbages. She is keen to take out a Kiva loan to invest in the business: she wants to employ some casual labour to help with the potato harvesting, and to diversify into maize growing. The loan will enable Teresia to establish a sustainable business, providing enough income to support herself and her daughter. She is grateful for Kiva lenders’ support.

loans.use: to employ casual labour to help with the potato harvesting, and to diversify into maize growing.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 61 years old and married with ten children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Eleonor is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Eleonor has been in this business for 11 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 23 years old and married with three children, two of whom go to school in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She used the previous loan to restock her shop items like beer, salt and others to sell to her customers. Oliver does not regret being in this business for five years, because it has enabled her to provide for her family.

She grows and sells cocoa to supplement the income from her general store shop. She is looking at trading in wholesale and fully stocking her business to make more sales. Just like other retailers, Oliver complains of price fluctuations and inflation. She is again requesting a loan to buy more merchandise like sugar, cosmetics, and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like sugar, cosmetics, and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Gevina

texts.en: Gevina is a 28-year-old single living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells food staffs to the people around her town and has been in business for four years.  She is a hardworking woman looking forward to expanding her business but faces hardships of competition and increasing transport costs to markets to sell her products. This limits her in meeting all her personal and business expectations. She gets additional income from her cocoa garden. She is requesting for a loan to rent cocoa gardens to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to  rent cocoa gardens to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en:
Shaista is a 31-year-old woman living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been doing a job as a laborer in a firm. Now he has become fed up due to low wages. This is the reason he decided to drive an auto rickshaw. He wants to buy an auto rickshaw to generate income for the entire family. Due to a lack of available funds, he is unable to purchase a new rickshaw.

Shaista has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband but at the time of purchasing she was still short some money. Therefore, Shaista has requested a loan for her husband so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. She hopes that now her husband won't have any need to pay a daily fare, which will become the cause of an increase in income.

She hopes that now her husband would be able to get more income because he will not pay a daily fare to anyone. She says she is very happy after taking this loan.

loans.use: to provide a source of income for her husband by purchasing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga, 63, is the farmer living in a rural area of Kratie province and he is a widower. Nga is a father of eight children, two of whom are dependent children. Growing cassava is the primary source of his family’s income for 7 years. Moreover, he can earn more income via working for others for a fee to improve his living. Since his farmland was destroying by insects, he couldn’t get high yields as his expected.

This is Nga’s second loan with VisionFund to grow his cassava. With the previous loan, he can afford to buy household supplies much better. As the leader of this new loan, he will manage his portion of loan to buy pesticides to protect his farm from threats by insects. He hopes that his cassava will be well growing in order to sell it in good price and allow him to upgrade his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect his farm from threatening by insect.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 52-year-old, mother of six children, and two of them are still at school. She lives in the village of Nyambiri, near Naivasha in the Kenyan Rift Valley. Jane is the sole earner in the family, providing for the children. At the moment, she grows potatoes and rears two cows. The business gives her a small income that helps contribute toward the children's school fees.

With a Kiva loan, Jane will be able to diversify from her potato farming into cabbage and carrot cultivation. The opportunity to grow the business in this way will ensure she has a sustainable income, and enough to continue supporting herself and her children.

loans.use: to expand her potato crop and to diversify into cultivation of carrots and cabbages.

loans.name: Reangsey

texts.en:
Reangsey is a 18-year-old, single, first-year university student, who is pursuing a degree at university, majoring in Finance and Banking. He works as a security guard to have some income.

He resides in the Tboung Khmum Province in Cambodia. For being a security guard, he can make approximately USD 4.8 per day. Reangsey doesn’t have enough finances to buy a computer and to pay his university fees from the first to the second year, so he has decided to take a loan. With the loan, he will be able to buy a computer, to pay his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree.

For his plans after graduation, he is going to find another job with a good salary and he also wants to save money to renovate his parent’s house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees from the first to the second year in Banking and Finance and buy a computer to help his studies.

loans.name: Sokaina

texts.en: Sokaina is a 32-year-old married mother of a daughter. She is acquiring this loan to pay for her daughter's school tuition fees and stationary. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Sokaina hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the necessary living needs, and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school tuition fees and stationary

loans.name: Tuất's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tuất is 54 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Tuất lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable, because when some poultry disease happens, they can die, leaving her nothing to sell, and she would be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Tuất faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to increase her income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard.

She is the group leader of a four-member group. In the future, Tuất hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to increase her income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 59 years old and married with eight children. With one child in school, Leticia works very hard to provide for them.

Leticia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 1300 loan through NWTF to buy solar lamp.

Leticia has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Leticia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy solar lamp

loans.name: Mable

texts.en: Mable used the previous loan to buy maize grains for selling. She has a business of selling produce in a busy market found in Fort Portal town. She also does farming and is actively working for 12 hours a day. She started these businesses with a hope of employing herself and in future she hopes to build rentals as a way of expanding on her income. Mable faces challenges of weather changes and price fluctuations that hinder her business growth and expansion. Mable has asked for a loan to help her to buy maize grains and cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize grains and cassava flour for selling

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret used the previous loan to buy groundnuts for planting. She is a farmer growing food crops like banana, groundnuts and also owns a bar that earns her an extra income. She is challenged by weather changes and price fluctuation. However, in future she hopes to construct a permanent house and have enough capital and a healthy family. She is now asking for another loan which she will use to pay workers who are weeding and pruning her banana plantation.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding and pruning her banana plantation.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is a forty one year old married woman with three children all living in Masindi-Uganda. She sells used clothes to get income. She as well built rentals to add on her income. When she generated enough savings, she decided to start up a business of selling second hand clothes. She dreams of constructing more houses for rent however inadequate capital is still a challenge for her to meet her dream. She is a hardworking woman who wants a loan to buy more clothes for sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: José Marcelino

texts.es:
José de 47 años de edad, no sabe leer ni escribir pues no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, actualmente está casado; vive con su esposa  y dos  hijos, ambos menores asisten a la escuela de su cantón; su esposa  se dedica a vender ropa y otros productos de casa en casa en su mismo cantón, mientras que José trabaja en labores agrícolas en diferentes lugares.


José se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, actividades que realiza desde hace muchos años, el cual aprendió de su padre; sus cultivos los realiza a una distancia corta del lugar de su vivienda por lo que no tiene que caminar mucho tiempo para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo.- En su casa José es el único miembro de la familia que se dedica a dichas labores agrícolas, ya que sus hijo son menores de edad  y por lo tanto ellos actualmente están estudiando niveles básicos en la escuela, es importante mencionar también que José cuando no trabaja en la agricultura realiza labores de albañilería cuando lo alguien lo busca.


El presente crédito, José lo utilizará para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, pagar a jornales y preparación de terreno para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con el cual espera tener una buena cosecha a finales de este año.

Él sueña es con dar a sus hijos una buena educación y una vivienda digna, cómoda y segura, todo esto con la ayuda de su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose is 47 years old. He does not know how to read or write since he didn't have the opportunity to go to school. He is married. He lives with his wife and two children who go to school in their canton. His wife works selling clothing and other products from house to house in their canton while Jose works doing agricultural labor in different places.

Jose works growing staple crops such as corn and beans. He has done this for many years and learned it from his father. He grows the crops at a short distance from where he lives and so he does not have to walk for a long time to get to his place of work. In his house, Jose is the only member of the family who works in agriculture since his children are young and thus they are currently doing their basic levels of study in school. It is also important to mention that Jose, when he is not working in agriculture, works as a bricklayer when someone is looking for those services.

Jose will use the loan to buy fertilizers, manure, pay for labor and the preparation of the land to grow corn and beans with which he hopes to have a good harvest at the end of this year.

His dream is to give his children a good education and a decent life, comfortable and secure, all of this with his wife's help.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, pay for labor and for the preparation of the land for growing corn and beans

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 34-year-old woman, living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Mostly people like to chew betel leaf, so that a few years ago her husband decided to open a paan shop to offer different kinds of betel leaf to the people. He offers kinds of betel leaf such as sweet pan, which consists of a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, betel nut, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), and various spices, and tobacco pan, which consists of powdered tobacco.

He is an expert in preparing pan because he has been running this shop for many years, and lots of customers like to take betel leaf that is prepared by him. To cope with the increasing demand, he wants keep more stock of ingredients so that he can maximize his income. 

Therefore, Sobia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, tobacco, etc. to sell. 

Sobia thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, tobacco, etc. for her husband's paan shop.

loans.name: Diamond Sapphire Group

texts.en:
Hazvinei is a 32 year old lady from the Diamond Sapphire group. When she came to Thrive in 2013 with her group mates, her cross border business was very small and seasonal. She relied on small orders from her clients in her neighbourhood and these were mainly clothing items. The clothing items that she restocked from South Africa took time to be paid for since they were all sold on credit. This rather long business cycle was not helping her to sustain her household which consists of two school going children.

Hazinei and her colleagues appreciate the training and loans that they have received from Thrive to date. Her business has grown from being a seasonal business activity to a daily market table at a major shopping centre in Harare. Her business has flourished and has had a ripple effect of creating employment. She now has one employee who assists her at the busy market.
A Kiva loan of $800 will help Hazvinei to restock a variety of ladies clothes in preparation for the festive season when demand for clothing is very high.

loans.use: to restock a variety of ladies clothes in preparation for the festive season when demand for clothing is very high.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 30-year-old, married mother of one child. She has been working in clothes-selling business from her house for two years to support her husband, who works as a chef, in covering their beloved family's increasing living needs. She is a hardworking woman, who puts so much effort into developing her business to reply to her family's increasing living needs. Her income combined with her husband's, currently is barely enough to cover their family's increasing living needs. Thus any unexpected financial need requires an external financial supporter.

Today, Layla is experiencing her first acquired loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. She is going to invest her loan to pay for an urgent surgery medical expense. She hopes that in the future, she can expand and develop her current business, and establish a separate clothes-selling company.

loans.use: to pay for urgent surgery medical expenses.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Babylyn is 47 years old and has one child in school.

Babylyn has a buy and sell home product care business in the Philippines. Babylyn requested a PHP 1300 loan amount through NWTF to buy solar lamp.

Babylyn has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Babylyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy solar lamp

loans.name: Francisco Arnoldo

texts.es:
Francisco de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, actualmente está casado, su esposa a se dedica a realizar labores domesticas en su casa, tienen dos hijos en común, uno de 14 años y el otro de 2, el hijo mayor de Francisco va a la escuela y ayuda en su tiempo libre a su papá en el negocio familiar que poseen.


Francisco es dueño de un negocio de reparación y venta de llantas nuevas y usadas, el cual está ubicado en su casa, dicha actividad la aprendió hace algunos años porque trabajó en un taller y gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio decidió empezar su propio negocio. En su taller, Francisco realiza reparación y venta de llantas para vehículos livianos y pesados, su horario de trabajo es de 08:00 am hasta las 05:00 pm.


El presente crédito, Francisco lo utilizará para comprar llantas nuevas y usadas de diferentes medidas, todo esto servirá para tener mas inventario y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Francisco sueña con darle a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir una vida digna, especialmente a sus hijos, ya que desea brindarles una buena educación y todo lo que ellos necesiten.- Con el presente crédito Francisco incrementará el inventario de su negocio y de esta manera logrará mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 44, studied until the 9th grade. He is married and his wife performs the domestic chores at their house. Together they have two children, ages 14 and 2. Francisco’s oldest son goes to school and during his spare time he helps his father in the family’s business.

Francisco owns a business that repairs and sells new and used tires. It is located at his house. He learned this activity a few years ago while he was working at a vehicle workshop, and thanks to his effort and sacrifice he decided to start a business of his own. At his workshop, Francisco repairs and sells tires for light and heavy vehicles. His work schedule is from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.

Francisco will use this loan to buy new and used tires of different measures, which will help him to have a bigger inventory and give his customer a good service.

Francisco’s dream is to give his family everything that they need in order to have a dignified life, especially to his children. He wants to give them a good education. With this loan, Francisco will increase his inventory and improve his profits.

loans.use: to buy new and used tires of different measures.

loans.name: In His Grace Group

texts.en:
No one can live without a vision for their future. Without a vision a person flounders aimlessly. Rebecca likens it to Proverbs 29:18 “Where there is no vision, the people perish”. Her vision has been her inspiration to achieve great heights and to be the best flock mother she can be as a pastor’s wife. She has to juggle these two contradicting yet important areas of her life. On one hand she has to be available for the church where she aids her husband in prayer meetings, couples counselling and home visits to the sick etc. On the other hand she has to see that she keeps her business running so that as a family they have enough income to sustain them.

Rebecca, 39, registered with a local cellular phone company and set up her money transfer business in a busy Harare suburb and started earning commission from the transactions. She employed someone to be permanently based in that business while she crosses the border to buy African java print material and jewellery for resale from neighbouring Zambia. She then sells the jewellery, hair products and cosmetics at a flea market stall in in a local market.   She also sells to individuals working from various companies in town and has established a good client base for herself where her regular clients introduce her to new ones.

Rebecca is always counting her blessings and believes it is the grace of the Lord that has taken her and her fellow group members this far, hence the name “Ïn his grace”. The group joined Thrive as four young, zealous mothers who want to grow their businesses. Rebecca used her previous loan to cross to Zambia to restock the African print material which is highly demanded. She has even managed to capture clients in the affluent low density suburbs of Harare. The group has applied for a second loan as three members while the other member takes a sabbatical.

With her second loan Rebecca wants to increase the float money in her mobile transfer business as more money means a bigger profit margin. She also wants to buy jewellery in bulk so as to wholesale to other sellers around her flea market.

loans.use: to buy jewellery in bulk so as to wholesale to other sellers around her flea market.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 33 years, a mother of two children and one dependent who is her relative. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda and is engaged in operating a retail shop selling soap sugar ,bread, maize and cassava flour soft drinks among others. She is located on one of the busy streets in town, her customer turn up is good and she is so far happy with the progress of her business which she started in the year 2011. Her family hope is to educate her children as her business desire is to expand her shop and be able to make enough money to build a family house in future. Juliana is requesting for a loan to buy merchandise such as biscuits,sugar,cooking oil and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as biscuits, sugar,cooking oil and others to sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat is a woman with a kind heart. She is married and has five children. She lives together with her big, happy family. She has her own farm. She grows a variety of vegetables in a 1.30 ha land. She works hard from early morning in her land. Her husband and children help her with managing the business.

Sharofat has additional income from animal husbandry. She has been in farming business more than 21 years. Sharofat is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers to process the soil. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers to process the soil.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
For the past three  years, Vivian engages in hog raising livelihood.  She raises and sold pigs to the local settlers in her place.  She is twenty-one- year old woman   and has two-year-old son.  
Her partner in life works in one of the private company in her town.
Together with her family, she lives in the rural town of Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to buy pig feed.  These could help improve the quality of pigs she is about to raise.
In that way, she could able to improve her livelihood and continue provide the needs of her growing children.

She is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage it successfully to support the welfare  of her growing child.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en: Lim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Lim makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past six years, she has operated a cashew nuts selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Soha

texts.en:
Soha is a 33-year-old married mother of four and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of her husband, she started fourteen years ago, working as a hairdresser to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. 
Soha is a acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate her business and family life. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy a car which will facilitate her business and family life

loans.name: Rozayna

texts.en:
Rozayna is a 43-year-old married mother of three. Nine years ago, she started selling clothes and crafts to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She is well known in her region and has her loyal customers.

Rozayna is working hard to develop her business. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her range of merchandise with a new collection of clothes for the winter season, as well as souvenirs and crafts materials, to satisfy her customers' requests.

Rozayna hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her range of merchandise with a new collection of clothes for the winter season as well as souvenirs and crafts materials.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 36-year-old married mother of three. Six years ago, she opened a cosmetics and perfumes shop to help her husband in satisfying their family's increasing needs. She is an ambitious lady who is well known among her region for her good communication skills.

Manal is working hard to develop her business; thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter cosmetics and perfumes, to provide her customers with a wide range of diversified products and items.

Manal hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of winter cosmetics and perfumes, to provide her customers with a wide range of products.

loans.name: Dúo San Martineca 2 Group

texts.es: Dúo San Martineca 2 Lo forman Alba Leticia. Alba se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo como lo son: perfumes, shampoos, cremas faciales y corporales y muchos artículos más. Tiene muchas clientas y está solicitando el crédito para comprar productos(cosméticos) y así ofrecer en Navidad un buen surtido a sus clientas. Tiene buenas referencias y las recomendaron unas socias responsables. Su sueño es conseguir un mejor local para exhibir mejor sus productos y así vender más.
texts.en: One of the members of the "Dúo San Martineca 2" is Alba Leticia. Alba works selling beauty products by catalog such as perfume, shampoo, facial and body cream and many other items. She has many clients and she is requesting a loan to buy product (cosmetics). This way she can offer her clients a good selection for Christmas. She has good references and the recommendation of some responsible members. Her dream is to get a better space to exhibit her products and sell more.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Sahjanan

texts.en:
Sahjanan is a 31 years old divorced hardworking mother of three children.
Sahjanan has seven years of experience in beauty services, she developed her talents trough a vocational college, where she got the basics of this business, then in January 2011, she established her current beauty salon.
Her business is going on fine, but she always seeks the best. Her acquired income is managed well to cover her children increasing living needs, and developing her business at the same time, to make sure she can maintain sustainability and ready for customers future demands.
Today, Sahjanan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop her business through purchasing new released special Autumn and Winter facial, cosmetics and beauty products collection.
She hopes to stay capable of developing her business in a well managed way to make sure she can provide her children at least the necessary standards of living.

loans.use: to develop her business through purchasing new released special Autumn and Winter facial, cosmetics and beauty products collection.

loans.name: Rehab

texts.en:
Rehab is a 53-year-old married mother of two. Twenty years ago, she started preparing and selling "Mouneh" to help her husband who is a farmer in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She has professional skills in this domain, as she is well-known among her region for her tasty and delicious "Mouneh".

Rehab is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through buying necessary "Mouneh" foodstuff to increase her production of strained yogurt, vinegar, olives, jams, Lebanese kishk, etc..)

Rehab believes in the benefits of plantings and crops to humans health and she hopes to expand her business more in the future through finding new markets to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff to increase her production of strained yogurt, vinegar, olives, jams, Lebanese kishk, etc..

loans.name: Raise And Gain Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuân is 41 years old and she is married with three children. She has worked in agriculture raising shrimps for more than 10 years. Xuân lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable because when some shrimp disease happens, they can die, leaving her nothing to sell, and she would be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Xuân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby shrimps to raise and sell in the future. This is Xuân first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard.

She is the group leader of "Raise and Gain", which consists of six members.
In the future, Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby shrimps to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Marifer

texts.en:
Marifer is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marifer is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marifer has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marifer requested a PHP 1300 loan amount through NWTF to buy solar lamp.

Marifer has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Marifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy solar lamp

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past seven years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Lucy operates a grocery stall, selling vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

Lucy decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this KES 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Magreti

texts.en:
Magreti is a divorced mother of one child. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She deals in clothing wraps, locally called bitenge, as her main source of income. By doing this, she manages to take care of herself and the child, since she is a single parent. Magreti has vowed to take care of her child because she is her only source of happiness.

Her business desire is to expand her shop and buy the latest designs as the festive season approaches, but she is limited by capital to meet her dream. She is requesting a loan facility to buy classy bitenge to sell.

loans.use: to buy classy bitenge to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 38 years old with 4 children whom are in school.
Joseph started his business of bicycle repairs and parts shop, when his contract in his old company ends and as a provider to support his family. Joseph works from 8 am up to 10 pm repairing and selling parts to his customers.
Joseph has been operating his business for 5 yeas and though his shop has seen improvements adding parts for sale and hiring an employee to help him in the shop. Customers demand items to him in which he cannot provide due to lack of additional capital.

Joseph is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 10,000 to buy bicycle tires, chains, saddle seat, pedals and other spear parts to sell and to be used in repairs for his customers.
The additional loan capital will enable him to expand his services and sell more bicycle parts to his customers thus gaining more customers and income.

Joseph is hoping to see all his children finish their school as he works hard to support and provide for them.

loans.use: To buy bicycle tires, chains, saddle seat, pedals and other spear parts to sell and to be used in repairs for his customers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a maize farmer from Kunda village. As a Babban Gona member, Elizabeth is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Elizabeth would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Elizabeth can to store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Elizabeth no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Elizabeth hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 44 años de edad, está acompañada, es bachiller, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen una hija de 16 años de edad que estudia bachillerato a distancia y en su casa también vive su papá. 

Silvia, trabaja en el cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles, esta actividad la ha realizado desde que era joven; pero hace dos años atrás también tenía ganado, pero por falta de recursos económicos para la alimentación decidió venderlo.

Silvia, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono para 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y para comprar una vaca, para comenzar nuevamente a trabajar con ganado.

Silvia, sueña con reactivar su ganadería y darle la oportunidad a su hija de que estudie una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Silvia is 44 years old. She is in a relationship and she is a secondary school graduate. Her partner works in agriculture. They have a 16-year-old daughter who is studying for her secondary school diploma via distance-learning. Silvia's father also lives with them.

Silvia works growing staple crops such as corn and beans. She has done this since she was young. Two years ago she also had cattle, but due to the lack of economic resources to feed them, she decided to sell them.

Silvia needs this loan to buy manure for 21,000 square meters of corn and to buy a cow so she can start working with cattle again.

Silvia dreams of reactivating her cattle business and giving her daughter the opportunity to study at university.

loans.use: to buy manure for 21,000 square meters of corn and to buy a cow.

loans.name: Dúo Santa Fe Ocaña Group

texts.es: Dúo Santa Fe Ocaña El encargado de este grupo es el señor Ricardo  de 31 años de edad, casado  y tiene dos hijos.  El se dedica a la siembra y venta de rosas de  diferente calidad desde hace 11 años.  Su sueño es ser un exportador de rosas en varios países y ser muy reconocido,  y construir una casa más grande para su familia.  Las fuertes lluvias han caído y los techos de nylon de los jardines se han lastimado y roto en algunas aéreas.  Por ese motivo el señor Ricardo necesita con urgencia cambiar techado para no afectar la siembra.  El debe comprar rollos de nylon para techado de cultivo valorados en –Q, 1,500.00 c/u  y el dinero que tiene no le alcanza.  El necesita con urgencia otro préstamo y así salvar su cosecha.  Esta muy agradecido por las oportunidades anteriores y les desea muchas bendiciones.
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo is in charge of the group Duo Santa Fe Ocaña. He is 31 years old, married and has two children. He has sown and sold roses of different qualities for the last 11 years. His dream is to export roses to several countries and become widely recognized. He also wishes to build a bigger house for his family.

The heavy rains have broken and damaged the roofs made out of nylon located in the gardens. For this reason, Mr. Ricardo urgently needs to change the roofs so the plants are not affected.

He has to buy rolls of nylon used for the roof of crops, which cost Q1,500.00 each and the money that he has is not enough. He urgently needs another loan to save his crops. He is greatly thankful for the previous opportunities and he blesses you all.

loans.use: to cultivate roses and sell them.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama is an ambitious 24 years old divorced mother of one child, who decided despite all the social obstacles she experienced after divorce, she wants to prove that she can control her own life and make something out of nothing.

Lama is working as a nurse and is still in progress with her nursing university degree, her limited monthly income is barely enough to cover her living needs, but she is insisting or acquiring her university degree, to improve her situation and promote with better degrees in her work.

An acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, will be invested in paying for her nursing university degree education costs.
She hopes to provide her child a better living and make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay for her Nursing University degree education costs.

loans.name: Inoyatkhon

texts.en:
Inoyatkhon was born in 1969 in Tajikistan. She is married.

Inoyatkhon has her own business deal. She has been busy with buying and selling children's clothes. Inoyatkhon has a selling place in a local market. She has worked in this way for more than 17 years, and she has great experience.

Inoyatkhon has regular customers because she periodically renews the assortment of her goods. She is going to buy children's clothes for the new autumn season. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for the new autumn season.

loans.name: Dinalyn

texts.en: Dinalyn is a sari-sari store owner who lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is 26 years old married woman and has four-year-old son. Her husband works hard as a security guard; while Dinalyn sells varieties of goods to her sari-sari store. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as sugar, salt, powdered juice, coffee, candies, chips, biscuits, bread, spices, noodles, canned goods and drinks. In this way, she wishes to enhance her earnings and expand her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, powdered juice, coffee, candies, chips, biscuits, bread, spices, noodles, canned goods and drinks

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 35 years old married with 4 children and she used to help her husband working on their own farm for a living. She sells their farm produce in the village. She earns better income from this business than working just on the farm, and she is able to help sustain their daily life. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer. In the future, she wants to use the additional earnings from the wholesale work to expand her farm, for it is their main source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merla is 53 years old and has three children who are in school.

Merla has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Merla requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruit to sell in her business.

Merla has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Merla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell in her business

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en: Gorreti is a single mother who lives in Kasese-Uganda. She owns a boutique, deals in coffee buying and selling, and also earns a monthly salary from the local government. The responsibility of paying school fees and providing all her children’s needs solely depends on her. Gorret is working hard to ensure that she builds her children a residential house. Gorreti is requesting for money to buy cement, sand, and iron sheets for building her family house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand to build her family house.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a soft-drink fruit-juice-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality and high cost of transporting raw materials.

Mejumaa decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits for making fruit juice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits for making fruit juice to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three-and-a-half years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers go. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients; hence, perishing of goods leading to losses.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonita is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Leonita has a nipa weaving business in the Philippines. Leonita requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additonal materials for her nipa waeving business.

Leonita has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Leonita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additonal materials for her nipa waeving business

loans.name: Maykel Antonio

texts.es: Maykel está en quinto año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, estudia los sábados y con mucho esfuerzo está a punto de culminar su carrera. Sus hijos y su esposa son su principal soporte para seguir estudiando. Para lograr culminar su carrera Maykel solicita un crédito para pagar su curso y su título. Con este préstamo Maykel podrá graduarse y desempeñarse en el mundo laboral.
texts.en:
Maykel is in the fifth year of his major in Business Administration. He studies on Saturdays and with a lot of effort, he has almost completed his degree. His children and his wife are the main reason he has continued studying. 

To achieve his degree, Maykel is requesting a loan to pay for his course and degree. With this loan, Maykel can graduate and perform in the working world.

loans.use: to pay for his course and his degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Feti

texts.en:
Feti is with Gjyle, his wife and they are seen in the photograph mixing the dried wheat with fertilizers before they plant it. Feti is 56 and a father of two in their early 20s and all these past twenty years, his focus has been in agriculture, in addition to working for a monthly pay of $214 in the department of agriculture in his region. In the seven dynym land that his family owns, they plant mostly what, corn and fodder, however, they only sell corn and fodder earning about $421/year from corn and $280/year from fodder. They keep the wheat for themselves to secure the bread and flour for the year.

Feti hasn't been feeling well lately and concerns about his health has been growing and the loan he is requesting will be used for health visitation and possible treatments. " My stomach has been hurting consistently now for the past almost six months. I have been drugging the situation because we have no money and you've got to pay from your pocket, because we have no insurance.Health related issues are a great concern for the poor and middle income families in our country, as you know," said Feti to the loan officer.

loans.use: to pay for a visitation to a health specialist

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 28-year-old student at Mount Kenya University. He is in the final year of his Bachelor of Business Management degree, and he is majoring in Supply Chain Management.

Nelson currently works with the Kenyan Ministry of Education, Science and Technology, but all of his salary goes to supporting his wife and children. A Kiva loan will enable him to pay his final year's tuition fees and to complete his degree.

Ultimately, Nelson’s ambition is to head the Procurement Department within one of the government ministries. In his own words, he would like "to use my knowledge to help the government procure quality products and services to help hardworking Kenyans." And, from a personal perspective, his dream is to build a good home for his family.

Please help Nelson achieve his dreams by contributing to his loan today.

loans.use: to pay his final year's tuition fees and to complete his degree.

loans.name: Maryamu	Samaila

texts.en:
Maryamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Maryamu now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to diversify her farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, de 42 años de edad, está casado y su esposa se dedica al destazo y comercialización de carne de cerdo y sus derivados, juntos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo 3 están estudiando en la escuela.

Dolores, se dedica a la crianza y comercio de cerdos desde hace 10 años, este negocio lo aprendió gracias a su tío quien también se dedicaba al comercio de cerdos; Dolores, viaja a los tiangues para comercializar sus cerdos.

Dolores, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado y cerdos, para criarlos y comercializar en el tiangue. 

Sus sueños son, comprar un camión para trasladar sus animales cuando los lleva a vender.
texts.en:
Dolores, age 42, is married. His wife butchers and sells pork and its derivitaves. They have four children, but only three of them go to school. Dolores has been raising and selling pigs for ten years. He learned this business thanks to his uncle, who also sells pigs. Dolores travels to Los Tiangues [livestock market] to sell his pigs.

Dolores needs the loan to buy livestock and pigs to raise and sell at the Tiangue.

His dream is to buy a truck to transport his animals when he takes them to sell.

loans.use: to buy livestock and pigs to raise and sell at the Tiangue [livestock market].

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is the age of 35; she is mother of five children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband sews school and hand bags along with his son at home to feed the entire family. He has two sewing machines for sewing school and hand bags and can operate both of them. He deals outside’s customers, takes orders from them and sews the bags on order.

He wants to buy an additional sewing machine for sewing bags but does not have enough cash in hand. Therefore, she has requested a Kiva loan through field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a sewing machine and additional raw material such as rexene, zippers, buckles, etc for sewing bags.
His desire is to sell his sewed bags directly in the market, so that he can get maximum reward against mutual efforts. Samina thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and raw materials for her husband's bag sewing business.

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en: A local resident living in a bed-room house located in Ponhea Krek district of Tbaung Khmum province, Ya has three children and she is 40 years old. The main source of her income is from growing rice for 22 years. She also raise piglets and work for others for a fee to earn supplement income to upgrade her family’s living. The farming business is progressing not well recently due to the threatening by insect. For Ya, she has never been with VisionFund, which is the first time of her to get a loan to support her farmland. As the group leader of two, she will spend her portion of loan on fertilizer and pesticide to produce good yields. She hopes that this first loan will help her to get high yields to earn more income and upgrade her living life style.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve the quality and quantity of her crop yields so as to gain more income.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum Province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mayra Liseth

texts.es:
Mayra, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.

Mayra, trabaja en una farmacia desde hace 3 años; pero también tiene una tienda en su casa y el lugar donde trabaja está a 10 minutos de su casa y viaja en bus para llegar hasta ahí.

Mayra, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, pan, café, entre otros, de esta manera espera mejorar el inventario de su negocio y surtir más su tienda.

Ella sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Mayra, age 33, went to school through the fourth grade. She is a single mother, and she has two children who go to the community school. Mayra has been working in a pharmacy for three years. However, she also has a store at her house. Her place of work is ten minutes from her house, and she travels by bus to get there.

Mayra needs the loan to buy products like rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, and coffee, among others, for her store. This way she hopes to improve the inventory in her business and to stock her store more.

She dreams of her children becoming professionals.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, and coffee, among others, for her store.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael de 65 años de edad, está soltero, anteriormente estuvo acompañado pero no funcionó, ahora él vive con su sobrino con quien trabaja para salir adelante.


Rafael se dedica al comercio de ganado como también a la agricultura en la zona, tiene aproximadamente 25 años de dedicarse a la actividad, de esa manera se gana la vida, en la actividad solo se involucra el sobrino y así es como logran salir adelante.

Rafael ocupará este préstamo para comprar una ternera.  

Rafael siempre ha soñado con tener un buen lote de ganado para obtener ingresos suficientes .
texts.en:
Rafael is 65 years old and single. Previously he had a partner, but it did not work out, and he now lives with his nephew with whom he works in order to get ahead.

Rafael is engaged in the livestock trade as well as agriculture in the area. He has approximately 25 years of experience in this business, and this is how he makes a living. In this business it’s just him and his nephew, and that's how they get ahead.

Rafael will use this loan to buy a calf.

Rafael has always dreamed of having a good batch of livestock in order to earn sufficient income.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Salloum

texts.en:
Salloum is a 31-year-old single man who got employed almost a year ago in a clothes shop to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who hopes to open his own business in the future. 
Salloum is a responsible and sacrificing man who is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his sister's university tuition fees. He believes that educations is very important these days and its the only way to guarantee his sister's future to live a descent life.

loans.use: to pay his sister's university tuition fees

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 49-year-old married mother of three. Due to the low financial situation of her family, she started ten years ago tailoring to help in satisfying their children needs. She has professional skills in this domain and is well-known in he area. She is always working hard to develop her business in order to increase her income.

Unfortunately, Najah's income is still not enough to cover any additional expenses, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house especially the bathroom to provide her family with healthier living place.
Najah hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house especially the bathroom to provide her family with healthier living place

loans.name: Keep Moving Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hà is 22 years old and she is married with 1 children. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 2 years.Hà lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is unstable because when some disease on poultry happens, they could die, which left her nothing to sell. And she will be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Hà faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to increase her income by purchasing more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

In 2014, Hà joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Since then, her life has been changed significantly. She could cover the life cost easier and save money.
She is the group leader of "Keep moving", which consists of four members.
In the future, Hà hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to increase her income by purchasing more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is married, 43 years old, with four children and helping her husband operate their own banana farm for a living. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs for farm fertilization and weeding maintenance. She has been in her farm for many years earning well to support the family and her children's education. In the future, she wants to buy farmland for her own better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique con 74 años, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Nueva Arica,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Enrique se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio,su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para surtir su negocio y de esta manera diversificar los productos que vende,con lo cuál obtendrá mayores ventas y mayores ganancias.

Enrique es socio recurrente y exclusivo para Epyme Alternativa, con un crédito anterior de S/.2500 cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Enrique, age 74, has a house of his own in which he lives along with his life partner and his children. It is located in a rural area of the district of Nueva Arica, in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, Peru. People in this place work mostly in agriculture, commerce and stockbreeding.

Enrique sales groceries and basic commodities and has over 15 years of experience. His business is located at his place of residence. He is requesting this loan to buy supplies for his business and in this way have a wider variety of products. This will increase his sales and improve his incomes.

Enrique is a recurrent and exclusive member of Epyme Alternativa, with a previous loan of S/.2500 which was paid punctually.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha  is a married mother of one child, who is still young to attend school. She lives at her own house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years  she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Inmer Iván

texts.es:
Inmer es un joven de 18 años de edad, estudia en el instituto de la ciudad, donde tiene que caminar por veinticinco minutos y luego tomar el bus urbano que lo lleva a la ciudad a recibir sus clases, y regresa por las tardes a la comunidad, vive con sus cuatro hermanos y sus padres.


Inmer trabaja en la agricultura desde que tenia diez años de edad, él se dedica  a los trabajos en el campo por las tardes cuando regresa de los estudios, actualmente tiene sembrado media hectárea de maíz y frijol en la comunidad, le ayudan sus hermanos ya que todos ellos aprendieron el trabajo de su padre.

Este crédito le ayudará al joven para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, también pagará alquiler del terreno.


Él sueña con seguir trabajando con sus cultivos pues le ayudan para el desarrollo de la familia y puede vender una parte de las cosechas obtenidas para generar ingresos que le ayuden para otros gastos en el hogar. Además espera seguir estudiando poco  a poco para lograr sus sueños de ser un profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
18-year-old Inmer is a young man that studies in the city. He has to walk 25 minutes and take a city bus to go to school. He returns in the afternoon to his community, where he lives with his four siblings and his parents.

Inmer has been working in agriculture since he was ten. He works the land in the afternoons, when he returns from school. He planted half a hectare with corn and beans. His siblings help him; all of them learned this activity from their father.

This loan will help this young man to buy organic and chemical fertilizers to grow corn and beans. He will also use it to pay the rent of the land.

He dreams of continuing working with his crops, since they help him and his family to develop. He can sell some of his produce and generate an income that helps him to cover some of the home expenses. He also hopes to continue studying and, little by little, achieve his dreams of becoming a professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers for his beans and corn plantations, and to pay the rent of the land.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with two children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no  piped water. Her greatest monthly is food . 

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of  transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Likita

texts.en:
Likita is a maize farmer from Kunda village. As a Babban Gona member, Likita is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Likita would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Likita can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Likita no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Likita hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en Ciudad del Este, hace varios ciclos que las integrantes de este grupo vienen trabajando de manera unida, y es por ello que les está yendo muy bien, además están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fatima, quien se dedica a las costuras, hace todo tipo de confecciones, y por medio de ellas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Fatima es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por ser alguien en la vida y dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener y evitar que pasen por necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos en cantidad para poder hacer sus confecciones, como ser telas, hilos, gomas, y otros, y agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando en su trabajo.
texts.en:
This group formed in the City of Este, for the past several loan cycles the members of this group have been working in a unified manner, and this is why it's going very well for them. Additionally, they are in the poverty elimination program, pushing themselves to grow and improve. One of the members is Fatima, who works at sewing. She makes all types of clothing, and through them she has the means to be able to help her loved ones. Fatima is a very hardworking woman who pushes herself to be someone in life and give her family all that she couldn't have and avoid that they lack necessities.

She is applying for this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and others, and is thankful for this opportunity that she receives to be able to continue growing and improving in her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and others.

loans.name: Dúo Cristo Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es: Dúo Cristo Rey de Reyes Este dúo está conformado por Demetria es casada y madre de familia es originaria de Sumpango, Demetria es dueña de una venta de helados  así como también se dedica a tejer blusas típicas, ella necesita de un crédito ya que necesita comprar suficiente hilo y tenerlo de reserva ya que el costo del mismo sube cada vez  más, es el segundo crédito que solicita y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien a pesar de que ha estado enferma  pero ella sigue luchando ya que tiene una hija que pronto será maestra y no duda de que kiva será parte del sueño que ella tiene que es ver a su hija una profesional.
texts.en:
Cristo Rey de Reyes [Christ, King of Kings] duo.

Demetria is one of the members of this duo. She is married, and a mother. She is originally from Sumpango. Demetria owns an ice cream shop, and sells also traditional blouses.

She needs a loan because she needs to buy enough threads to keep in inventory, since the prices are constantly rising. This is the second loan she applies for, and she has done well, thanks to God, despite being ill. She continues fighting for her daughter, who will soon become a teacher, and is sure that Kiva will share her dream of seeing her become a professional.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional weaves.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano con 41 años de edad,de estado civil casado,vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Querecotillo,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.
