Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Mariano se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de maíz amarillo duro. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en el mantenimiento del terreno cultivable. Esta inversión le permitirá obtener ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.

Mariano es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Mariano is 41 years old, married, and lives in his own house, which is composed of rustic materials, with his wife and their two children. They reside in Querecotillo district, in Cutervo province, and Cajamarca department, in a rural zone of Peru. He can count on very good personal and labor references from residents of the zone. The inhabitants of this locality are dedicated, in the majority, to agriculture, commerce and cattle-raising.

Mariano is a farmer, cultivating specifically hard yellow corn. He will use this loan to invest in the maintainance of his cultivable land. The investment will enable him to obtain sufficient earnings to improve his economic condition and, as a consequence, to invest in improving his living conditions.

Mariano is an ongoing member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining his cultivable land.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia a resident of Kasese district is married with children. She deals selling of crude salt and owns a motorcycle transport business. Through her business, she able to cater for her family's needs. Her desire family desire is to educate her children to higher levels of learning as her business. At this point, Sylivia wants to buy and stock more crude salt, but the money at hand is not enough to do so. Lydia is then requesting for a loan facility to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.name: Oktom

texts.ru: Октом, 54 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, в поисках источника дохода, начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. Она приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 0,72 Га земли, где она выращивает помидоры, капусту, болгарский перец. Скот Октом недавно распродала, для восстановления поголовья она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). В будущем, она планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Oktom is 54 years old, married, and has four children. She has higher education, and whilst searching for a source of income, she started farming. She has put all her efforts into the development of her business, and today her farm has 0.72 hectares of land, where she cultivates tomatoes, cabbage and peppers. 

Not long ago Oktom sold off her livestock, and in order to restart her herd, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). In the future, she plans to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to invest in her business and increase her herd.

loans.name: Tariro

texts.en:
Tariro is 23 years old and lives in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. Tariro runs a poultry project selling broiler chickens in her local community. She is producing 65 chickens per circle. Her business is doing so well and has managed to build a very big fowl run that will carry 100 chickens. With her first loan,she managed to build herself a fowl run.

She is now requesting a second loan so that she can further expand the capacity of her business. Now a major breadwinner in her family, she is the mother of one. Tariro is able to buy clothes for her parents, her child and younger sisters. Her desire is to get a bigger loan from Kiva so that she can boost her business and get bigger sales during the festive season.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, chick feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Apiza

texts.en: Apiza was born in 1961 year. She is widowed and has 5 children. Apiza is a hardworking woman. She has own business deal. Apiza produces carpets. She makes carpets from wool of sheep. She makes very wonderful national carpets. Apiza works in this line more than 21 years and she has a great experience. Apiza’s daughter and neighbors help her with manufacturing carpets. Now, Apiza is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy row materials for manufacturing carpets. She is reaped client of IMON and KIVA and she hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for manufacturing carpets

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fátima, de 24 años de edad, está casada, su esposo trabaja cultivando maíz, frijol y café, juntos tienen una hija de 4 años de edad.

Fátima, se dedica al comercio de frutas desde hace dos años y lo aprendió gracias a su tía; pero también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos.

Fátima, necesita el préstamo para comprar un novillo y también para comprar cerdos.

Sus sueños son, terminar de construir su casita y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Fátima, 24, is married. Her husband works growing corn and coffee. They have a four-year-old daughter together.

Fátima has been selling fruits for two years, taught by her aunt. However, she also raises pigs.

Fátima needs this loan to buy a steer and some pigs.

Her dreams are to finish building her house and improve her daughter's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a steer and pigs.

loans.name: Ismelda

texts.es:
Ismelda, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera, tiene una hija que está estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad y viven con su mamá y dos hermanos que trabajan en la agricultura.

Ismelda, trabaja en como empleada doméstica desde hace 4 años, pero también se dedica a la crianza de ganado y de cerdos, los potreros están a 30 minutos de su casa y trabaja de 7:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde.

Ismelda, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar ganado para criarlo, engordarlo y venderlo.

Ismelda, sueña con darle a su hija la oportunidad que estudie y en un futuro sea medico.
texts.en:
Ismelda, 31, studied up to the sixth grade. She is a single mother, and has a daughter who goes to the community school. They live with her mother and two brothers that work in agriculture.

Ismelda has been working as a housekeeper for four years, but she also raises cattle and pigs. The pastures are located 30 minutes away from home, and she works from 7:00 a.m. until 4:00 pm.

Ismelda is requesting a loan to buy cattle to raise, fatten, and sell.

She dreams of giving her daughter the opportunity to study and become a doctor in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise, fatten, and sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 44 years old, married and has two children. Joel has a sari-sari store. He has been operating his business for more than three years. This business is the number one source of the family daily needs and also the source of the education of his two children which is already now in high school. Joel applying loans for the purpose of capital of his sari-sari store and to purchase additional goods and also to renovate of his business place.Joel plan to expand his business from sari-sari store into mini-groceries it is because they want to improve their living and has a sustainability source of their income.

loans.use: to pay for additional goods for his sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Fanomezana

texts.fr:
A 28 ans, Fanomezana est divorcée. Le nombre d’enfants est de trois (11-9-8 ans) scolarisés dans des établissements publics. L'ex-mari participe  à la couverture des  dépenses familiales  par le versement  mensuel d’une somme fixe. 
Elle est à son troisième prêt pour développer l’activité d’engraissement porcin, les bénéfices tirés des activités antérieures lui ont permis de rénover la maison où la famille habite. Elle s’est formée auprès d’un cabinet vétérinaire  avant de créer l’activité, le suivi technique de l’élevage est encore assuré  par ce technicien. Elle dispose 7 années d’expérience en la matière. C’est une activité familiale. D’autres sources de revenus sont la vente des produits de l’aviculture. Ses enfants l’appuient dans ces activités
Elle et ses trois enfants vivent dans une maison héritée de ses grands  parents, son projet est de pouvoir éduquer ses enfants à partir des revenus tirés de l’élevage car elle ne peut plus compter sur son mari qui s’est déjà remarié.
texts.en:
Fanomezana is 28 years old and divorced. [She has] three children (ages 11, 9, and 8), who attend public school. Her ex-husband contributes to the family expenses with a monthly payment of a fixed amount.

Fanomezana is on her third loan to grow her business raising pigs. The previous profits from her business have allowed her to renovate the house in which her family lives. She received some training at a veterinary practice before establishing her business, and specialized care of the livestock is still provided by a technician [from that practice].

Fanomezana has seven years of experience in this area. Hers is a family business. Other sources of income include the sale of products from poultry farming. Fanomezana's children help her with her business.

Fanomezana and her three children live in a house inherited from her grandparents. Her goal is to be able to educate her children with the income from raising pigs, since she can no longer count on her [ex-] husband, who has already remarried.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en:
Barnabas is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Barnabas has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Barnabas would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Barnabas can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Barnabas will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Barnabas is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Arcenio

texts.es:
Arcenio con 40 años de edad , de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Arcenio se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de cafeto, de la variedad Catimor, sembrando 1 hectárea de cafeto de su propiedad,su predio se ubica en el Caserio el pueblo lo hizo del Distrito Santo Tomás de Cutervo,con una experiencia en la agricultura desde hace 11 años y hace 4 años cultiva cafeto. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar.El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de su cultivo. De esta manera obtendrá buenos rendimientos y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Arcenio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Arcenio is 40 years old and living in a common-law marriage. He resides with his wife and their four minor children in Santo Tomas district, Cutervo department, and Cajamarca department in Peru. Arcenio can count on very good personal and labor references from residents of the zone. The inhabitants of this locality are dedicated in the majority to agriculture, commerce, and cattle-raising.

Arcenio is a farmer; specifically, he cultivates coffee of the Catimor variety, sowing one hectare of his own property in coffee plants. His fields are located in the village of Caserio in Santo Tomas de Cutervo district. Arcenio has 11 years experience in farming, four of which were in coffee. In addition, he raises and sells small farm animals and cultivates products to put bread on the table.

The purpose of the loan will be to invest in maintenance of his crops. In this manner, he will obtain a good harvest and greater income so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Arcenio is an ongoing member of Edpyme Alternativa. He and his wife will both sign for the loan.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his crops.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 38 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, biscuits, home product care, and other groceries.

Marites has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, biscuits, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
With her first Kiva loan, Sona from Tsovagyugh village in Gegharkunik region perfectly and on time solved her health problems, for which she is very thankful and again hopes for one more deal with Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon.

Sona has a farm and now it is the only source of income for her family. She has cows, bulls, sheep, lambs and chickens on her farm. Her farm products she makes and sells right from her house and these are macun (national dairy-product), cheese, curd, butter, milk and also meat and eggs. She is also great at potato cultivation and she sells a rather great amount of potatoes to re-sellers right from her farm. Sona simultaneously works at a kindergarten as a nanny. Sona is married and she has a daughter and a son. With this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams, Sona wants to buy two more calves for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle since she stores fodder for the long winter months.

loans.use: to buy two more calves for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle since she stores fodder for the long winter months.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis de 34 años de edad, solo estudió hasta el cuarto grado del nivel básico, se crió con sus abuelos y por eso no pudo seguir estudiando. Se caso de 24 años y es padre de una niña de 9 años de edad quien estudia tercer grado en la comunidad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y además esta en un taller de sastrería que están impartiendo en la  comunidad.


Luis trabaja en las hortalizas (siembra de pepinos, ejotes, tomates y otros) trabajos que emprendió gracias a su iniciativa y es así como ya tiene mas de cinco años de trabajar en las hortalizas, además trabaja en la siembra de maíz y frijol, en la comunidad tiene sembrada una hectárea de maíz y media  de frijoles, cuando no trabaja en los cultivos propios trabaja en las fincas de café en el volcán.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar abono para el cultivo de maíz, frijol y para iniciar siembra de pepinos.


Él sueña con hacer su vivienda de adobe o de bloque en el futuro, así el le podrá dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y espera seguir apoyando a su hija en los estudios.
texts.en:
Luis, 34, studied only up to the fourth grade. He was raised by his grandparents, which is why he could not continue studying. He got married when he was 24, and is the father of a nine-year-old daughter, who is in third grade in the community school. His wife works as a housewife, and is learning to sew in a course being taught to the community.

Luis works growing vegetables such as cucumbers, green beans, and tomatoes, something he learned on his own. He has now more than five years of experience in this field. He grows also corn and beans. He has half a hectare planted with corn, and half a hectare with beans. When he is not taking care of his crops, he works for the coffee farms located by the volcano.

He needs this loan to buy fertilizers for his corn and beans plantations, and to start growing cucumbers.

He dreams of building his house in adobe or bricks in the future, in order to offer his family better living conditions. He hopes to be able to continue helping his daughter with her studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his corn, beans, and cucumber plantations.

loans.name: Inva

texts.en:
Inva is giving Brunilda, her best friend, a hair cut/dry.

Inva is 29 years old and has been a divorced mother since she was two months pregnant with her nine-year-old child. Ever since, she was living with her immediate family and her child. Their house was located adjacent to a public university, and for some years she and her mother operated some sort of snack/coffee place serving mostly students.

During these years, Inva also went to professional school and got her licence in hair cutting/aesthetics. Her uncle, who has been living in Italy for the past 20 years, allowed Inva to move into his house that is next to her parents' house and practice her profession from the house.

Since then, Inva has been living in and operating her activity from her uncle's house, and she is very content with her life, according to her. Her clients are mostly university students and people who live nearby.

Inva wants to buy items and products for her beauty salon, and this is the reason why she is requesting this loan from you.

loans.use: to buy items and products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Juan Rodolfo

texts.es:
Juan, es un hombre muy trabajador, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a vender frutas y verduras de manera ambulante y viven junto a uno de sus hijos que ya trabaja y varios nietos.

Juan, es electricista y aprendió este oficio cuando tenía trece años de edad, este trabajo llamo muchos su atención, mucho más que el otro trabajo que tuvo, el cual fue ayudante de albañil; fue así como empezó a ponerlo en práctica, hasta que dominó bien el oficio y ahora es un electricista reconocido que trabaja por contratos.

Juan, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar materiales electricos como rollos de poliducto, alambre, switch, entre otros.- Con esto se estaría ahorrando dinero porque los compraría en cantidades grandes y también se evitaría el tiempo de estar yendo constantemente a comprarlos a la ferretería.

Juan, sueña con que sus hijos y nietos se superen en la vida y lleguen a tener hogares prósperos y que tengan una excelente calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man. He went to school until the ninth grade. He is in a common law marriage. His partner works selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor. They live with one of their children, who works, and various grandchildren.

Juan is an electrician. He learned this trade when he was thirteen years old. This job really caught his attention, much more than the other job he had, as a mason's assistant. That is how he began to practice his trade, until he mastered it well. Now he is a well known electrician who works on a contract basis.

Juan is seeking a loan to buy electrical materials such as rolls of plastic tubing, wire, and switches, among other things. With this he will be saving money because he will buy them in large quantities, and will avoid having to constantly go to the hardware store to buy them. Juan dreams that his children and grandchildren will succeed in life, and one day have prosperous homes and an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials such as rolls of plastic tubing, wire, and switches, among other things.

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en: Joumana is a 41-year-old married mother of one child. She got employed as a secretary to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her child's school tuition fees. She believes that education is very important for her child's future.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school tuition fees

loans.name: Animal Farm Group

texts.en:
Thơm is 58 years old and she is married. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region and the income from this business is unstable because when some disease on poultry happens, they could die. It would leave her with nothing to sell and she would be in financial trouble. The main hardship that Thơm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to increase her income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Thơm joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Since then, she has had money to fix the hen coop in order to raise productivity. Her income has improved.

She is the group leader of "Animal Farm", which consists of four members. In the future, Thơm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: To increase her income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 48 years old and married with seven children. Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Nancy has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Virginita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell meat.  Virginita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy variety of spices to sell for her buy and sell spices business.

Virginita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of spices to sell

loans.name: José Hilario

texts.es:
José es un joven trabajador de 26 años de edad, está soltero y aún no tiene hijos, solamente vive con sus padres y tres hermanos.

José trabaja de ayudante de albañil en la zona, trabajó anteriormente en un proyecto de la construcción de una calle durante mas de una año, de cada pago que él recibía  iba comprando materiales para la construcción de su propio hogar, y es así como ahora en día tiene su propia vivienda.
Los trabajos los aprendió gracias a sus padres quienes le motivaron para  tener sus propios ingresos, además puede hacer pan de diferentes variedades. 

José solicita este crédito para comprar abonos y otros fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, frijoles y maicillo.

Él es un joven luchador, su sueño es ir mejorando su casa como él siempre ha querido, esto le permitirá vivir mas cómodo.
texts.en:
Jose is a young worker, 26 years of age, still single, and as yet has no children. He lives with his parents and his three brothers.

Jose works as a bricklayer's assistant in the zone. Previously, he worked for more than a year in a street construction project. With each wage payment he receives, Jose has been buying materials for constructing his home, and that's how he came to have his own home today.

Jose learned his skills thanks to his parents who motivated him to earn his own income. In addition, he can bake different varieties of bread.

Jose is requesting this loan to purchase manure and other fertilizers for cultivating corn, beans, and millet.

Jose is a combative youth; his dream is to continue improving his house, as he has always wished. This will permit him to live more comfortably.

loans.use: purchase manure and other fertilizers for cultivating corn, beans and millet.

loans.name: Makisimo

texts.en:
Makisimo, who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, is a 26-year-old hardworking woman dealing in cocoa buying and selling. She got involved in the business to earn an income to meet increasing family demands. She has a cocoa garden where she gets income on top of renting cocoa plantations for harvesting to sell to cocoa companies.

She is challenged by bad weather and limited capital that hinders expansion of her cocoa business. Another challenge is that the cocoa prices are not attractive given the fact that they sell to agents whose prices are low. Makisimo has asked for a loan to rent cocoa gardens to harvest for selling.

loans.use: to rent cocoa gardens to harvest for selling.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a single woman with two children one of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has  has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge oftransportation in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize
 flour and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize  flour and beans for resale

loans.name: Poverty Eradication Women's Grp Salama Group

texts.en:
Aminah is a repeat client in Ugafode microfinance, applying for a loan of 2000,000/=. She is a single woman with three children.

She is a business woman owning a boutique that sells clothes, a business she has done for more than five years. In bid to increase on her working capital /expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of 2000,000/= Ato buy new stock of clothes that she will sell to her customers.

She has however been faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital.
She is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.
The extra person at the extreme end (right) is the UGAFODE credit staff that monitors the group.

loans.use: to add more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Istiphanus

texts.en:
Istifanus is a maize farmer from Kunda village. As a Babban Gona member, Istifanus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Istifanus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Istifanus can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Istifanus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Istifanus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana, 32, she is a responsible mother and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap goods such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles and waste papers etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells it to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses he does not have cash in hand to buy scrap goods and does not have previous stock of scrap to sell for generating money.

Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.
She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scarp goods for her husband's recycle material sell and purchase business.

loans.name: Vina

texts.en:
Vina is a divorced woman who lives in a rural village of Kratie province, she is 41-year-old and a mother of three children, one of whom is schoolchild and needs her to support the studies. She has been growing rice on a hectare area of farmland for 23 years as the main source of income. Moreover, she can earn income via growing cashew and working for others for a fee to upgrade her lifestyle. Unfortunately, her hard-working at farming business has been ruined by drought. She can manage to earn about 10USD per day and she is able to save around 4USD each day after expenses.

This is the first loan cycle for her with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. For Vina, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase the productivity crop. She hopes to get more yields so to earn additional income and she can upgrade her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase her crop productivity.

loans.name: Mixed Fortunes Group

texts.en:
The year 2000 was the dawn of a new millennium, a year that was anticipated and at the same time feared by many. Despite the many fears and dire warnings, this new unique year brought a positive change to the life of one woman. She decided to put aside being just a mother and wife and added businesswoman to her title. In that year Fatima started selling clothing, shoes and bedding by her gate side as an income generating venture.

Fatima is 47 years old and customarily married. She is a biological mother to three children and “mother to her niece who resides with them”. School fees and other expenses are met by Fatima as her husband is only occasionally employed. Fatima uses her good taste in selecting colourful, eye catching beautiful clothing and bedding for resale to residents in her neighbourhood.

In the year 2012 Fatima decided to buy locally and go to Mozambique herself. This she saw as a cost cutting measure and at this stage she no longer had very young children so she could leave for days. She saved USD 300 and used it to go restocking in Mozambique, taking with her seat covers, sheets and different grocery items for resale in Mozambique. This benefitted her immensely as from the 300 USD she invested she made sales of 700 USD. This inspired her to cross more often and she established a good client base for herself. After her stay in Mozambique selling wares, she comes back to Zimbabwe with clothing, curtains, shoes and bedding for resale back home.

Fatima and four other women make up the group Mixed Fortunes and they all reside in a big high density suburb in Harare. With her Kiva loan Fatima is planning to buy bulk groceries for resale and also restock dried organic African food like mopane worms, pumpkin leaves, sugar beans and peanut butter for resale. These goods are in demand as they are healthy and taste good to the African palate. She also wants to stock up on beautiful, colourful cool summer sheets that are very welcome in Mozambique as they experience high temperatures.

loans.use: to buy bulk groceries for resale and also restock dried organic African food like mopane worms, pumpkin leaves, sugar beans and peanut butter for resale.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is age 32 and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is taking a loan for her husband's painting shop. In fact, he provides the services of banner writing for advertisements. His writing is very attractive because he has been writing banners for many years and has a great grip on banner writing. He can write in Urdu, English and Arabic languages as well.

He uses pieces of cheap cloth, paint, and brushes for banner writing. He does not have enough stock of paint and cloth to continue his services. Therefore, Haleema requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy multicolor cans of paint, brushes, and cloth. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy multicolor cans of paint, brushes and cloth for her husband's banner writing services.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old Palestinian father of two who grew up working in animal sales. He is married and lives with his wife and sons in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon.

When he was just 15, Mohammad started working with his father, until he proudly decided to take over the family business in 2008 with the support of his father and their clients. In fact, Mohammad relies a lot on the trust and loyalty of his clients in order to grow his business.

For the first time, he is asking for a 1,543,992 Lebanese pound loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. In fact, his pick-up truck needs some maintenance in order to avoid sudden interruptions of his work. This way, the loan will allow him to ensure business sustainability and improve working conditions.

Mohammad's wife is unemployed, which is why Mohammad is doing his best to ensure a stable income for his family.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs for his pick-up truck.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 49-year-old married father of three. Three years ago, he started working in the construction field seeking a better income to better cover the needs and expenses of his family. He gained experience in this domain from his brother.

Ahmad's family is his priority; thus, today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees. He believes that education is the only way to guarantee his children's future.

Ahmad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 28-year-old single Palestinian refugee who has been working as an English Language teacher for four years now. She comes from a well known family with a very good reputation in her region, who work hard to support each other for a decent satisfied living.

Faten decided to take on her account paying for necessary maintenance expenses for her father's car. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to do necessary maintenance to her father's car, which they use for the family's daily needs.

She hopes to stay capable of supporting her family's social and financial living.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to her father's car, which they use for the family's daily needs.

loans.name: Julia Mabel

texts.es:
Julia, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudió educación básica, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la albañilería y viven en su casa con sus dos hijos pequeños.

Julia, desde pequeña aprendió a trabajar al lado de su madre, ya que ella tiene un negocio de destace de cerdos y de reces, pero también elaboraban cuajada y quesadillas.- Julia, ha sido su brazo derecho todo el tiempo, y recibe un pago por su labor o compra carne a un buen precio, para luego venderla en porciones; pero últimamente sus esfuerzos se los dedica a su hija recién nacida y son pocos los momentos en que puede dedicarse a trabajar.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar cuatro cerdos, los cuales crecerá en el patio de su casa, para que cuando crezcan pueda destazarlos y vender su carne, de esta manera toda la ganancia será para ella.

Julia, sueña con llegar a tener una crianza de ambos animales, tanto cerdos como bovinos, para así disponer de la carne y crecer económicamente con la venta de ésta y mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is a very hardworking woman. She went to elementary school. She is in a common law marriage. Her husband works in masonry. They live in their home with their two small children. From an early age Julia learned to work by her mother's side, who has a business butchering pigs and cows. They also made milk curds and dessert cakes. Julia has always been her mother's right hand, and receives payment for her labor. She also buys meat at a good price to later sell in portions. But lately she dedicates herself to her newborn daughter, and has little time to work.

The loan she seeks is to buy four pigs which she will raise in the yard of her house, so that when they're grown, she can butcher them and sell the meat. In this way, all the profit will be hers. Julia dreams of one day raising both pigs and sheep, to profit from the meat and grow economically from its sale, and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four pigs.

loans.name: I Can Cook Group

texts.en:
Hiền is 38 years old and she is married. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been operating a food stall selling noodles for more than 10 years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region and the income from this business is unstable because nowadays there are many stores with diversified food. She has to make sure her food is delicious and hygienic with competitive prices to attract customers.

The main hardship that Hiền faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for cooking more dishes to sell.

Before Hiền borrowed from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, she was the main laborer because of her weak husband. In 2012, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Since then, she has covered the life costs easier and bought some appliances for her home.

She is the group leader of "I can cook", which consists of three members. In the future, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cooking more dishes to sell.

loans.name: Hadil

texts.en:
Hadil is a recently married young woman who lives in Beirut with her husband, a soldier in the Lebanese army. She is 25 years old with an entrepreneurial mind, which pushed her to establish her own business in early 2014, a shop that sells mobile phones, recharge cards and phone accessories. The shop allows her to support her household's income, especially that she opened it in a busy street of Beirut.

For the first time, Hadil is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She is planning on using the loan to buy a large quantity of phone accessories and sell them in her shop. She is hoping that increasing her supplies will have a direct impact on her sales and income.

Hadil runs her business alone and it has been performing well since she opened it, which allowed her to start building a good reputation in the area.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories for her shop

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is 54 years old married woman. Many years ago she started her milk selling business with the support of her son. Due to her efforts and work, she has good repute in her family. She helps her son in all family matters as well as financial matters. She uses the cow milk for her personal use and buffalo milk sells in the market with the help of her son. In this ways both are earning healthy income to support their family.

She shared her feeling of achievement that now she begin to send her younger children to schools for better education.
She is in her fifth loan cycle with the BRAC Pakistan. She has some past savings, and she has applied for a Kiva loan to purchase an additional cow for producing more milk to sell. She expects a boost in her income as she expand her business.

SAFIA is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow for her milk production and selling business.

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en:
Bulus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bulus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Bulus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Bulus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Bulus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Bulus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Julio Miguel

texts.es:
Julio Miguel con 44 años de edad,vive en casa familiar,junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Colasay,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Julio Miguel se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de arroz, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de peones para la instalación en su cultivo. De esta manera incrementará los rendimientos de su cultivo.

Julio Miguel es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, sus créditos anteriores los a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Julio Miguel, 44, lives in his family home with his parents in the province of Jaén, in Cajamarca, Peru.

He has excellent personal and professional references from people in the area. The inhabitants of the area work in agriculture, commerce and husbandry.

Julio Miguel works in agriculture. He grows rice. He has 10 years of experience in this field.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for day labor to sow the crop. This way he will increase his crop size.

Julio Miguel is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa He has paid all his previous loans on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for day labor to sow his crop.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is 51 years old and married. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rina has been in this business for 8 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman who lives in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines, together with her family. She is 46 years old and a mother of five children; they are 21, 18, 15, 9 and 6 years old.

Mary Ann and her husband earn a living by running a passenger boat, and they have been doing this for 10 years. They need a bigger loan for a boat renovation. They will use the money to buy a boat engine, plywood and paint.

In the future, Mary Ann wants to expand her business. She wants to earn more so she can have enough money to send all her children to school. She dreams of them to finishing their studies and becoming professionals some day.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine, plywood and paint.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers eat. She faces the major challenge of competition from other operators.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. 

She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is age 28, and is a married and hardworking lady charged with the responsibility of taking care of one child.

Rosemary operates a shop of farm supplies where she sells herbicides, insecticides, and other drugs used for agriculture. She desires to grow and expand her business, as well as improving the standards of living for her family. She is seeking for a credit facility to buy more insecticides to sell.

loans.use: to buy more insecticides to sell.

loans.name: Nkulausha

texts.en:
Nkulausha is a married woman with six kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Nkulausha operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Tazara Buyuni Group

texts.en:
ASHA is in her late 30s is married with two children, one is still small and the other one is in school.  She has been running two projects, a beauty salon and selling tape water for four years now. She works from 08am to 08pm daily and able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asha's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the salon products, started selling tape water and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is hard working and is shows.  She appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which can now support their families and can take their children  to good schools.  She used the profit to buy a plot of land, to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy the up to date salon products to meet the customers' requirement and to increase on the water stock to sell tape water to many customers.  She dreams of building her own house.

Ash will share this loan with her loan group  Tazara Buyuni  which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the up to date salon products to meet the customers' requirement and to increase on the water stock to sell tape water to many customers.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 24 years old and is married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leah runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Leah has been in this business for 3 years, selling a variety of items such as diapers, shampoo, noodles, eggs, biscuits, cereals, coffee, etc.

Leah would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma.nueda

texts.en:
Ma.nueda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a billiard business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy an additional billiard table for her billiard business.

Ma.nueda has been in this business for 6 years. Ma.nueda earns more income from raising chickens and fishing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma.nueda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional billiard table for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and is married with 4 children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.

Jocelyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jocelyn has been raising livestock for 5 years though she also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Aghabek

texts.en:
Aghabek already paid back four Kiva loans very successfully and on time. All his Kiva loans were profitable for his farm and developed it very much. He is still busy with his farm in Tsakhkunk village of Gegharkunik region. He has cows, calves, sheep, horses and chickens on his farm, and he works on it and cares for it very properly and skillfully. Aghabek earns his living also by selling his farm’s snow-white sheep-wool. Aghabek is married and lives with his wife; their children are married and live separately.

Aghabek asks for his fifth Kiva loan in an amount of 1,400,000 AMD. He has some health problems now, which cause him great discomfort and limit his activity, so with this loan he will take a medical examination at the hospital to diagnose his health problem.

loans.use: to take a medical examination at the hospital to diagnose his health problem.

loans.name: Ramón Alcides

texts.es:
Ramón de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado del nivel básico en la  comunidad, no  pudo seguir ya que no contaba con los recursos económicos, se acompañó hace nueve años y es padre de tres hijos su niña mayor estudia segundo grado en la escuela de la comunidad y sus dos varones están aun tiernos de edad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuido de las especies menores como aves de corral.


Ramón trabaja desde los doce años de edad en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, maicillo y frijoles,  ya que se crió solo con su madre y él tenía que apoyarla, además se dedica a la albañilería desde hace cinco años, aprendió gracias a que un amigo le enseñó el oficio y de esta forma es como él ha logrado salir adelante con su familia.


Él solicita este crédito para comprar abonos y otros fertilizantes para aplicar a sus cultivos, además pagará alquiler del terreno.


Él sueña con seguir trabajando en la albañilería, la agricultura y además seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios para que sean profesionales en el futuro, espera también construir una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Ramón, 27, went to school up to the third grade. He was not able to continue studying as he did not have the economic means. He has had a partner for the past 9 years and is the father of 3 children.
His oldest daughter is in the second grade in the community school and his two sons are still very young. His wife takes care of their home and takes care of small animals such as chickens.

Since the age of 12, Ramón has earned money by sowing seeds such as corn and beans. He was raised by only his mother and he had to help support them. Also, for the past five years he has worked as a bricklayer. His friend taught him the trade. This is how he is able to provide for his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for his crops as well as to pay for the rent of the land.

He hopes to keep working as a bricklayer and agriculture and also to continue supporting his children in their studies so they can become professionals one day. He also hopes to build a better house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops as well as to pay for the rent of the land.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Maryamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Maryamu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 40 years old and lives with his large family in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region. Karen lives with his wife, son, his parents and sister. In this large family, only Karen (a constructor) and his father (a watchman) are employed. Karen also is a farmer and has cows, calves, a bull, lambs, sheep and chickens on his farm. He also has a nice assortment of farm products, such as milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, butter, meat and eggs that he sells to earn his family's income.

Karen now has great need of this loan because his father has serious health problems. Karen very urgently needs this loan of 350,000 AMD in order to solve his father’s health problem.

loans.use: to solve his father’s health problem

loans.name: Sokorn's Group

texts.en: Sokorn’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokorn works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 38-year-old married father of one child and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, he left school at early age and started working in the construction field, specializing in aluminum detailing and installing, to cover the needs and expenses of his family. Although he is working hard to develop his business, his income is still not enough to cover any additional expenses.  Thus, today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua ,to pay for renovating his house expenses  to make it a healthier place inside the camp before winter season for his only child. Wissma hopes to keep on expanding his business to increase his income and provide his family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for renovating his house expenses to make it a healthier place for his only child inside the camp before winter

loans.name: Melhem

texts.en:
Melhem is a 42-year-old married father of three. He has been working as a security guard since seven years ago. He is a hard worker and sacrificing father who is depriving himself for the sake of his children. 
Due to his limited salary which is not enough to cover any additional expenses, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his daughter's school tuition fees. Melhem hopes to stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's school tuition fees

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
Marina de 34 años de edad, estudió solamente segundo grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en proyecto de agua de la comunidad donde viven, no tienen hijos son una pareja emprendedora y luchadora y viven solos. 
 

Actualmente, Marina compra cerdos para engorde, para luego venderlos tiene cuatro años aproximadamente de dedicarse a ello, además tiene pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras, el negocio lo tiene en su casa. Anteriormente vendía helados en su casa hacia pan artesanal pero ya no lo hace ya que esposo se enfermó unos días y ya no continúo.


El crédito actual lo utilizará para comprar cerdos ya que están siendo bien pagados en la zona y tienen buena demanda.


Marina sueña en un futuro tener vacas para producción de leche ya que posee suficiente espacio para tenerlos.
texts.en:
34-year old Marina has only a grade 2 education. She is married and her husband works at a water project in the community where they live. They don't have any children. They are a hardworking, dedicated couple who live alone.

Currently Marina buys pigs to fatten and then sell, a job she's had for approximately four years. She also raises chickens, a business she runs from her home. Beforehand Marina sold ice cream and bread from her home but she doesn't any more as her husband got sick.

She plans to use the loan money to buy pigs as she can earn good money in the area from this work, and there is plenty of demand.

In the future Marina would like to have some dairy cows and produce milk as she has enough room for them.



.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise and fatten

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
La joven  Fátima de 21  años de edad, es casada  tiene un hijo que depende de ella, vive en  San Lorenzo,  al  sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace  03 años  a la  abarrotería como ser la venta de arroz, frijoles, churros, café, pan, etc. es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
 
La joven está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de frescos, churros, detergentes, granos básicos, etc. Ya que viene la época de navidad y desea tener surtido su negocio, está muy contenta del apoyo que Prisma le puede brindar. 

Su sueño es tener su propia casa y poder darle una buena educación a su hijo.

San Lorenzo, honduras - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Fátima is 21 years old, married, and has one dependent child. She lives in San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras. For the past three years, she has been working selling groceries such as rice, beans, churros, coffee, bread, etc. She is a hardworking young woman who is driven to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy soft drinks, churros, detergent, basic grains, etc. The holiday season is approaching and she wants her business to be ready and well-stocked. She is very happy about the support Prisma is able to offer.

Her goal is to own a home one day and give her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, churros, detergent, and basic grains.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, who is in her mid 20s, is married with two school-going children. She has been running two projects--running a primary school and selling cosmetics--for four years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Maria's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her cosmetics stock and to buy the out-of-stock items in the school store, and she has paid back her loan successfully.

She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to reinvest in her business, to repay other loans, to pay school fees for her two kids, and to cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy school requirements like textbooks, notebooks, pencils, pens, chairs, and tables at the reception and to buy the bestselling cosmetics. She dreams of building her own house.

Maria will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy school requirements like textbooks, notebooks, pencils, pens, chairs, and tables and to buy the bestselling cosmetics.

loans.name: Twiyubake Group

texts.en:
Tharcisse is 36 years old and married, with five children. He is the president of the group TWIYUBAKE and is the one who raised up his hand. Tharcisse sells vegetable, such as aubergine, tomatoes, cabbage... He has four years of experience in this work. 

He works from 8 a.m until 6 p.m every day. Tharcisse has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase vegetable like: aubergine,tomatoes etc for resale... With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future, to pay school fees for his children, to pay medical insurance for the family and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable like: aubergine, tomatoes etc for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
This marks Florence eighth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her children's education through her fish business. 

Florence has since opened a food kiosk where her clients can get ready fried and fresh fish, which she sells at a good price together with hot cooked maize meal commonly referred to as 'ugali'. 

She has thus requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to buy more stock of fresh tilapia fish.


Her future hopes are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fresh tilapia fish

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en:
Arminda is 67 years of age and has one child. She is married and her husband is a caretaker of a beach resort. To support their family needs, Arminda rents out floating devices that are useful at the beach.

Arminda is availing herself of a loan amount of PHP 8,000 to buy additional floating devices to rent out. Her life is improving through their business because she earns income. Arminda plans to expand their business to earn more income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional floating devices to rent out.

location.town: Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman with seven children, one of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces the major challenges of competition and transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia deals in produce business, mainly beans for now three years. She is doing great, because she now knows the quality beans, which beans to plant in a certain season, which has attracted customers to her shop. She started this business to help her husband in family responsibilities, like buying food and other necessities. She desires to build a very good residential house for her family but the money at hand is not enough to buy the required materials. Scovia is requesting for a loan facility to buy materials like cement and sand to construct.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement and sand to construct a house.

loans.name: Maria Loyola

texts.es:
María Loyola con 47 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 12 años, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

María Loyola se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, trabaja con la marca Esika,con la cuál está trabajando hace más de 15 años,por su antigüedad y su buen desempeño es líder del grupo de consultoras de Esika en la zona de Pucará. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería,mostradores y vitrinas para exhibir sus productos puesto que también vende en su domicilio.

María Loyola es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, este es su sexto crédito.
texts.en:
María Loyola is 47 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her spouse and their youngest son, who is twelve years old, in the district of Pucará, in Jaén province, department of Cajamarca in Peru. She has very good work-related as well as personal references from residents in her area. People in this town mostly work in farming and retail.

María Loyola works selling beauty supplies by catalog. She works with a brand called Esika, and has been doing so for over fifteen years. Because of her seniority and good performance, she is the local Esika consulting group leader for the Pucará area. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise, counters, and display cases to show her products, since she also sells them at home.

María Loyola is a continuing member of Edpyme Alternativa. This is her sixth loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, counters, and display cases to show her products.

loans.name: Patricia Lisseth

texts.es:
Patricia, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja como empleado en una quesillera, de la cual es dueño un hermano de él y tienen dos hijas pequeñas.

Patricia, desde tempranas horas del día se dedica a realizar los oficios del hogar, pero también dedica tiempo para alimentar los cerdos que tiene en el patio de su casa; pues esta actividad la realiza desde hace algunos años y básicamente lo que hace es darles de comer, de beber y bañarlos en las horas de más calor.

El préstamo que está solicitado es para comprar cuatro cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, pues en éstos momentos no cuentan con muchos animales.

Patricia, sueña con tener una granja de cerdos más grande, en la cual esa se involucren todos los miembros de la casa, para que así vaya prosperando y esto les permita mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Patricia, 24, is a hard working woman. She finished high school and is married.  Her husband works at a dairy owned by one of his brothers. 
They have two young daughters. 

Early in the mornings Patricia takes care of the home and feeds the pigs she has in the patio of her house. She has been doing this work for a few years. Basically what she does is give them food, drink and bathes them when it is very hot. 

She is requesting a loan to buy four pigs and concentrate to feed them. Currently she does not have many animals. 

Patricia dreams of having a bigger pig farm where everyone in her family is involved. So that this way they keep prospering and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four pigs and concentrate to feed them.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María, de 61 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y viven con su mamá.

María, se dedica al comercio de cerdos desde hace diez años, este negocio lo aprendió por medio de su madre, que también se dedica a este rubro y al comercio de frutas.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado y hacerle algunas mejoras a su vivienda.

Su sueño es que su casa este en buenas condiciones para mayor seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old and a single mother. She has three children and they all live with her mother. For the past ten years, María has made a living selling pigs, a business she learned from her mother, who also works in this trade, as well as selling fruit.

María needs this loan to buy livestock and make some home improvements.

Her goal is for her house to be in good condition for her family to live more safely.

loans.use: to buy livestock and make some home improvements.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yusuf has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yusuf will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yusuf is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hei's Group

texts.en: Hei’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia.  Hei makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Brigitte Marie Lourde

texts.fr:
Brigitte a 53 ans, elle est veuve. Le nombre d’enfants est de trois dont deux déjà mariés. Le dernier qui travaille n’habite plus avec elle. Deux petits enfants de 7 et un an) sont à sa charge.
Elle dispose six années d’expérience dans la vente de divers produits tels que sceaux, cuvettes en plastique. Depuis, la création de l’activité, elle a déjà bénéficié trois prêts pour la diversification des articles et la constitution de stocks. Elle s’occupe de l’achat et de la livraison des produits auprès des clients fixes, un salarié gère le point de vente. Auparavant, elle disposait de 3 points de vente, sa stratégie est d’augmenter la livraison auprès des clients fixes.
Elle vit dans une maison louée. Son objectif est d’ouvrir un grand magasin et de devenir grossiste dans le secteur afin d’éviter les fréquents déplacements
texts.en:
Brigitte is 53 years old and a widow. She has three children, of whom two are already married. The last child, who works, no longer lives with her. Two grandchildren (aged 7 and 1) are in her care.

Brigitte has six years of experience selling a variety of goods, such as plastic buckets and tubs. Since establishing her business, she has already benefited from three loans for diversifying her goods and building inventory. She takes care of purchases and deliveries to fixed customers, and an employee manages the sales outlet. In the past, she had three sales outlets. Her strategy is to increase her deliveries to her fixed customers.

She lives in a rented house. Her goal is to open a large store and become a wholesaler in the sector, so as to avoid making frequent trips.

loans.use: to purchase plastic tubs, buckets, and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Artash

texts.en:
Artash is 51 years old and lives with wife in the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. He is is the father of two sons, both of whom are now living and working in the Russian Federation. Artash has a higher military education and is a military educator. He regards this as important work, in that he helps prepare boys to be ready to defend their homeland at any moment.

Artash works with great pleasure and devotion, but lately feelings of weakness and discomfort are causing him anxiety. He is requesting this Kiva loan of 1.400.000 Armenian drams to undergo a medical examination at the hospital to determine the cause of his health problems.

loans.use: undergo a medical examination at the hospital to find out the cause of his health problems.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a 46-year-old married mother of two children. She is acquiring this loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school/university expenses such as books, stationery, transportation, and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Safiya's daughter is studying biology, and she is in the second academic year.

Safiya hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the necessary living needs and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition fees in her second year as a biology major.

loans.name: Dúo Pachali Group

texts.es: Dúo Pachali, representado por doña Lubia casada y tiene dos hijas, su esposo se dedica a la venta de verduras por mayor,  doña Lubia se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y niñas, también vende lencería, y cosméticos por catalogaos, también vende regalitos pero todo esto es en su casa, todos los días sale a vender ella vende ambulantemente aprovecha para cuando va a traer y dejar a sus hijas, su venta la tiene desde hace ya doce años, este es el Cuarto crédito  que tiene y sin duda a logrado ver resultados con sus ganancias, Lubia sueña con darle y dejarles a sus hijas un capital para que puedan estudiar, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de ropa para niñas y niños para vender.
texts.en:
Duo Pachali is represented by doña Lubia, married, with two daughters. 

Her husband makes a living selling vegetables wholesale. Doña Lubia makes a living selling children's clothes, as well as lingerie and cosmetics by catalogue; and she also sells small gifts through her home-based business. Every day she goes out to sell. She sells on the street, taking advantage of when she takes and picks up her daughters.  

She has had her business for twelve years already. This is her fourth loan and she has been able to see results through her earnings.  Lubia dreams of giving and leaving capital for their daughters so they can study. 

She is requesting this loan to buy girls and boys' clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.fr: Rachel est une jeune entrepreneuse qui commerce des pagnes dans la rue de la ville, membre du groupe de crédits «Safina», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, célibataire et âgée de 25 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en cinq pièces de pagnes. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité, avec le premier capital reçu d’un crédit. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Rachel is a young entrepreneur who markets 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) on a street in town. A member of the loan group “Safina” and a client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 25 years old and unmarried. She is going to stock up with five lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth. Having started with a loan as capital, she has been in this business for two years. Her wish is to grow her business. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with five lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Elbis Estela

texts.es:
Elbis, de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado, se encuentra soltera, es madre de 5 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. 


Elbis se dedica a los oficios domésticos, trabajo que aprendió de su madre a los 14 años de edad, también se dedica a  la crianza de pollos y gallinas,  y de vez en cuando realiza venta de pan, de modo que se mantiene ocupada realizando varias actividades productivas.


El crédito que ella está solicitando lo necesita para comprar 1 vaca y pasto para alimentarla.


El sueño de Elbis es trabajar duramente para mejorar su calidad de vida y su capacidad económica.
texts.en:
Elbis is 52 years old and has a third grade education. She is single and has five children, who all live on their own now.

Elbis works housekeeping, a job she learned from her mother when she was fourteen years old. She also raises chickens and hens, and once in a while she sells bread also, so she keeps busy and productive in several different ways.

She is requesting a loan to buy a cow, as well as pasture to feed it.

Elbis' goal is to keep working hard in order to improve her quality of life and financial capability.

loans.use: to buy a cow and pasture to feed it.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
This woman’s name is Heghine, and she lives in Sevan City of Gegharkunik region. Heghine graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute, and from 1996 until today she has been working at the school as a teacher of elementary classes.

Heghine is a respected and beloved pedagogue in the school where she works. She is a very patient teacher, and she also has pupils whom, at her house, she helps to prepare their lessons. These are mainly those pupils who have some hardships in their learning process.

Heghine is married and has a son and a daughter. Heghine’s husband is a lawyer.

Now she asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams to purchase a computer, accessories for it, and also several special methodological books, all of these for her self-development activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it, and also several special methodological books, all of these for her self-development activities.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudió hasta cuarto grado de educación básica, está soltera y vive junto con dos de sus hijos, de los cuales uno se dedica a la panadería y hace antojitos para salir a vender en su comunidad.

Gloria, se dedica a la sastrería desde que tenía a sus hijos pequeños, pues como no tenían un padre que les diera el alimento, tuvo que ingeniárselas y empezó haciendo remiendos en una máquina vieja que una tía le regaló para que trabajara; pero con el tiempo fue adquiriendo más práctica y después empezó a hacer sus propias prendas, como blusas y faldas y actualmente se dedica a la fabricación de fundas, sobrefundas, cubrecamas y sábanas para camas.

Gloria, necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como tela, hilo y elásticos para la elaboración de las prendas, porque se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y la mayoría de las personas quieren cambiar las prendas viejas por nuevas. 

Gloria, sueña con que sus hijos y sus nietos se superen en la vida y formen sus propios hogares y que sean un ejemplo para su comunidad.
texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old. She is a very hard-working woman who went to school as far as the fourth grade. She is single and lives with her two children. One of her children works as a baker, and makes snacks to sell in their community.

Gloria has worked as a tailor since her children were very young. Since they did not have a father to feed them, she had to think up a way to do it. She started doing repairs on an old machine that her aunt gave her so that she could work, but with time she gained more practice and starting making her own articles of clothing such as blouses and skirts. She now sews pillowcases, bedspreads and bedsheets.
