Gloria needs the loan to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread and elastic material to make articles of clothing, because the end-of-year holidays are approaching and the majority of people want to replace their own clothes with new ones.

Gloria dreams of her children and grandchildren being successful in life, starting their own families, and being an example in the community.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, and elastic material to make articles of clothing.

loans.name: Ukweli Group

texts.fr: Lukambo est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Ukweli», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 7 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 3 n’étudient pas. Elle est  vendeuse des denrées alimentaires au domicile dans un quartier de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 2 sacs de maïs et 3 sacs de manioc. Elle commença son business  avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite achater une parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Lukambo is a merchant and a member of the community bank “Ukweli”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 40 years old and the married mother of seven children, of whom four are in school, and three are no longer students.

For ten years, Lukambo has been a vendor of grocery items out of her home in a district in town. She is going to stock up with two sacks of corn and three sacks of cassava. She began her business with funds from her husband. Her wish is to purchase a parcel of land and provide schooling for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with two sacks of corn and three sacks of cassava.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Mrs. Binh is a hardworking woman, 21 years old . She lives with her husband in a small house and without a hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and fishing.

She would like to take a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hoi

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoi is a hardworking woman, 21 years old. She is married and has a baby. Her family’s income is mainly from fishing.

She would like to take a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer from Maigadi village. As a Babban Gona member, Usman is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Usman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Usman can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Usman no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Usman hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria Argentina

texts.es: María, de 52 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien ha tenido 4 hijos, actualmente vive junto con su conyugue y 3 de sus hijos en una de las aldeas del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Ella se dedica a la venta y producción de café desde hace 5 años en el terreno de su casa. Ofrece café en pergamino, húmedo y seco para la venta. Ella solicita un préstamo de 8,000.00 Lempiras que utilizara para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de trabajadores para darle mantenimiento a su finca lo que le ayudara a tener una mejor producción de café. Mediante esta inversión espera mejorar en calidad y obtener más clientes. Su meta es plantar una parcela de finca más grande que la que tiene actualmente, para obtener mejores ingresos que mejoren su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
52-year old María lives with her partner. They have four children but only three still live at home in one of Gracias municipality's small villages called Lempira. María has grown and sold coffee for five years on the land around her house. She sells the coffe with husks, moist, or dry.

María is seeking a loan of 8,000,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on her farm and thus help her increase coffee production. Through this investment she hopes to improve the quality of the coffee and obtain more customers. Her goal is to plant a larger parcel of land than she does at the moment to earn more money and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on her coffee plantation

loans.name: Tunashukuru Group

texts.fr: Ntawabo est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Tunashukuru», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 49 ans, mère de 6 enfants dont 5 étudient et 1est gosse. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un depot de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 1 sac d’haricots. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite nourrir et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler q'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Ntawabo is a merchant and a member of the community bank “Tunashukuru”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 49 years old and the married mother of six children, of whom five are students, and one is very young.

For ten years, Ntawabo has been a retailer of grocery items at a warehouse in town. She is going to stock up with a sack of beans. She began her business with funds from her husband. Her wish is to provide food and schooling for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs. We really wish to indicate that one client is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to stock up with a sack of beans

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Fifty-eight year old Dioscora goes fishing. She sold fresh fish to the locals in her place. She is a widow-woman and has eleven children. Two of her children are still attending school. Aside from fishing, she also engages in a food vending business to meet the family's daily expenses.

Dioscora would like to buy fishing net, nylon and and ingredients for food vending. These could serve as fuel to improve her livelihood and continue to provide the needs of her growing children.

In the future, Dioscora is looking forward to improving her livelihood to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fishing net,  nylon and ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hard-working woman who earns a living through engaging in seaweed farming.  
She has been growing seaweeds for many years now.
She is 65-year-old married woman with one grown child. 

She is asking for a loan from CEVI to boost her livelihood. Marina wants  to buy straw, soft tie and pay for the laborer.  In this way she hopes to improve her financial income. Her seaweed production will improve and she could start to invest other source of income to become productive.
She dreams of expanding her livelihood to be able to support the welfare of her grand children.

With her previous loan, Marina  managed to invest in seaweeds seedlings to be propagated, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy straw, soft tie and pay for the laborer on her seaweed farm

loans.name: Judth

texts.en: Judith is a mother of two. She operates a bar business in a local market. She has a desire to expand her business, and she is working hard towards her goal. Of late, she has experienced an increase in customers because of her good customer care. Her present stock can no longer satisfy her customers.  She is now requesting money to buy more beers and sodas to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To buy beers, and sodas for selling

loans.name: Carmelo De Jesus

texts.es:
Carmelo, de 45 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.

Carmelo, se dedica a la agricultura y a comprar ganado, estas actividades las realiza desde hace 20 años; pero también conocer acerca de la albañilería.

Carmelo, necesita el préstamo para comprar cabras para tener un ingreso extra a futuro.

Sus sueños son comprar un pick up, para hacer viajes en su cantón.
texts.en:
Carmelo is 45 years old, married, and has two children who attend the local school. He earns his living farming and raising cattle, a job he's been doing for 20 years. He is also knowledgeable about construction.

Now Carmelo needs a loan to buy goats so he can increase his income in the future. His dream is to own a pick up so he can travel round the community.

loans.use: buy goats

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a maize farmer from Kunda village. As a Babban Gona member, Markus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Markus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Markus can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Markus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Markus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena is a 61-year-old married woman, living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is the mother of nine children.  Her son is a shoemaker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for eight years now.  He sews leather and rexine shoes by machine. After that, he attaches the sole through stitching by his hands. In this way, he is getting income for his family. He has been making shoes at home. Now he wants to increase his business on a wide level. But he does not have enough money to buy the initial raw materials for making shoes.Therefore, Sakeena requested a loan for her son so he can buy initial raw materials for making shoes. This will help him to continue his business. Sakeena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy shoe raw materials for her son.

loans.name: Yehowa Dzi Mila Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is an entrepreneur from the Chorkor district of Greater Accra Region. He runs a sewing shop business and earns a monthly income between 50 GHS to 100 GHS. He now seeks a loan to expand his business so he can stock his shop better. He plans to purchase items such as cloth and lining and pay for the servicing of his sewing machines. For this, he needs financial assistance.

Emmanuel leads a group with two women. Diana and Sylvia are the other members of the group. They joined Yehowa Dzi Mila to apply for a group loan to expand their respective businesses. The loan will help them contribute more to their household income. They are grateful to their lenders and promise to repay in loyalty according to the terms applied.

loans.use: to expand his business so he can stock his shop better.

loans.name: Al Oushak Group

texts.en:
Zainab is the featured borrower for the Al Oushak Group. She came along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Zainab is a 19-year-old single lady who started three years ago working as a tutor to help in covering the needs and expenses of her family that consists of three members.

She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is still continuing her university studies, and she is acquiring a loan to pay her university tuition fees.

Zainab is studying Arabic literature in her second academic year. She is the first lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Ghadir is the lady in the middle, and Soumaya is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees for her second academic year.of Arabic literature.

loans.name: Los Vencedores De Zapallal Group

texts.es: Annie es una joven de 21 años de edad pertenece al grupo Los Vencedores de Zapallal,se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanía como carteras,joyas,llaveros y mas que aprendió gracias a una tía que le enseño el secreto de la artesanía y le gusto mucho,así emprendió este gran negocio que le permite estar en contacto con la gente y a la vez tener mejor calidad de vida, el préstamo que solicitó le permitirá comprar mercadería como hilos platería cuero para la elaboración de sus carteras,cadenas,anillos y mas.Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva  por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Annie is a 21 year old young woman who belongs to the group Los Vencedores de Zapallal. 

She earns a living making and selling crafts such as wallets, jewelry, key chains and more. She learned thanks to an aunt who taught her the secret of crafting, and she liked it very much, so she started this great business which allows her to remain in contact with people and, at the same time, have better quality of life. 

The loan she requested will allow her to buy merchandise such as threads, silver materials and leather to make her wallets, necklaces, rings and more. 

She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread, leather and silver.

loans.name: Hodari Group

texts.fr: Amadi est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Hodari», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 7 enfants dont 6 scolarisés et 1 n’étudie pas. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un  dépôt de la ville depuis 7 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 4 sacs de farine de manioc. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite construire une maison et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler qu'une clente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Amadi is a merchant and a member of the 'banc villageois' called “Hodari”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 40 years old and the married mother of seven children, of whom six are students, and one is not.

For seven years, Amadi has been a retailer of grocery items at a warehouse in town. She is going to stock up with four sack of cassava flour. She began her business with funds from her husband. Her wish is to build a house and provide schooling for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs. We really wish to indicate that one client is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to stock up with four sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora was born in 1973. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a teacher. Gulnora is also a teacher. She teaches a technology subject and she has worked in schools more than 17 years.

Gulnora is a highly educated person. She is smart and her pupils learn her subject with pleasure. She has great experience in this field, and she always tries for the well-being of her children.

Her son is a university student in his first year and that’s why Gulnora must pay the tuition for her son. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition of her son

loans.name: Olimpia Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Olimpia de 41 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° grado, está acompañada y es madre de 1 hijo de 17 años, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura pues siembra maíz y de maicillo.


Olimpia, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual aprendió de su madre, el puesto de venta lo tiene en el centro del municipio para lo cual se traslada a pie.


El presente crédito le servirá a Olimpia para comprar 4 quintales de maíz y leña, los cuales le servirán para la elaboración de las tortillas.


El sueño de Olimpia es seguir trabajando para sacar a su hijo adelante, verlo graduada del bachillerato, y que continué en la universidad.
texts.en:
Olimpia is 41 years old and went to school as far as the second grade. She lives with her partner and is the mother of one son who is 17. Her partner works in agriculture, growing corn and sorghum.

Olimpia has worked for 12 years making and selling tortillas, which she learned to do from her mother. She sells from a stall in the center of her municipality, which she travels to on foot.

This loan will be used to buy 4 quintals of corn, and firewood, which she will use to make her tortillas.

Olimpia's dream is to continue working in order to raise her son, and see him graduate from high school and then continue on to university.

loans.use: to buy 4 quintals of corn, and firewood, which she will use to make tortillas.

loans.name: Nelly Marina

texts.es:
Nelly, de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y tienen dos hijos.

Nelly, se dedica a la agricultura juntamente a su esposo y actualmente tienen 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, además tiene una pequeña parcela de hortalizas donde tiene ayote, pepino y chile.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono e insumos agrícolas para el control de plagas y maleza en sus cultivos.

Nelly, sueña con obtener una buena producción de maíz, porque en el cultivo de invierno obtuvo perdidas debido a la sequía que afectó la zona oriental del país.
texts.en:
Nelly is 57 years of age and studied up to secondary school. She has a husband who makes a living from agriculture and they have 2 children. Nelly earns a living from farming with her husband, and they currently have 21,000 square metres of maize. They also have a small vegetable plot where they grow pumpkins, cucumbers and chillis.

She needs the loan to purchase fertilizer and agricultural supplies for pest and weed control. Nelly dreams of having a good maize crop, because in the winter crop she sustained some losses due to the drought that affected the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and agricultural supplies for pest and weed control.

loans.name: Husaini

texts.en:
Husaini is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Husaini is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone.

As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Husaini would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing.

With Babban Gona’s support, Husaini will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Husaini now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mujeres Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth Bertha, tiene 52 años de edad, ella forma parte del grupo "Mujeres sin fronteras" que está formado por seis socias.
Elizabeth Bertha, se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a la elaboración y venta de postres, al inicio los ofrecía a sus vecinos y amigos y poco a poco al ver la aceptación de sus clientes y a que una amiga la animó, ella se animó a crear una dulcería. Todos los días desde muy temprano empieza con las compras y luego durante el día empieza a elaborar los postres es una actividad que le agrada mucho. Todas las tardes empieza atender su dulcería hasta terminar la venta de sus postres.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra  de una congeladora que le servirá de mucho en su negocio ya que viene el verano para poder mantener  las bebidas frescas y los postres
texts.en:
Elizabeth Bertha is 52 years old. She belongs to the "Women without Borders" group, which has six members. Elizabeth Bertha has worked for more than 10 years making and selling desserts. At first she sold them to her neighbors and friends, and little by little as they were well received, at the urging of a friend she opened a bakery.. She starts every day very early by shopping, and later throughout the day creates the desserts. This is an activity that she enjoys very much. She stays at her bakery every day until her desserts are sold.

The loan will be used to buy a freezer, which will help her a lot in her business as summer is coming, and she needs to keep her desserts and beverages cold.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Khamalu

texts.en:
Khamalu is a maize farmer from Kwalo village. As a Babban Gona member, Khamalu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Khamalu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

As a Babban Gona member, Khamalu can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Khamalu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Khamalu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Radical Faith Group

texts.en:
Stella is a 40 year old married woman with 3 children all going to school. Her husband is employed at a local printing company as a driver. She spent 5 of her early years of marriage as a housewife, but these days has proven to be the pillar for her family as dependence upon the income of her poorly paid husband could not adequately cater for her household’s expenses.

With this in mind Stella received some vocational training in tailoring offered by a donor organization in 2010. After this training, she worked for a local firm as a tailor specialising in manufacturing school uniforms. Through the savings of her employment and assistance from her husband, she managed to buy a domestic sewing machine. She stopped work and started her own business.

She is now a self-employed tailor specialising in the tailoring of boys’ shorts and girls’ skirts. She supplies these clothes to rural areas of Mutoko, Mt Darwin and Chinhoyi. She sells these for cash and sometimes in the event that rural residents do not have cash she barter trades for maize. Over the years, however, she has not managed to employ anyone to assist her in her business except for her husband who over some weekends and some of his leave days travels with her stock for selling in the rural areas.

She will now be supplying school uniforms to the schools. To do so, she now needs a capital injection so that she can buy fabric in bulk and have the uniforms made ahead of the next academic term. Stella and 3 other women of the Radical Faith group and have approached Thrive Microfinance for a loan of $1900 to help them and their families break free from poverty.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk and have school uniforms made ahead of the next academic term.

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, she can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hannatu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

She is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Vanna is 45-year-old and a married mother of three children, one of whom is a dependent child. To make a living, she has been growing rice to support her family's living condition for ages. She is able to get additional income via working for others for a fee. The rice cropping is growing not well recently, so she could save only around 6USD each day after offsetting her expenses.

Vanna, she has been with VisionFund for four cycles already and she paid back her past loans completely. Those loans helped her to have enough to support her living. In a group of two, she is the group leader and she is going to apply for this new loan in order to buy a plot of land to expand her farming area, which is expected to increase the productivity her crop. She hopes her rice farm will be well growing and enable to earn more income so that she can afford to expand her current business and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to expand her farming area, which is expected to increase the outputs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Shukrani Group

texts.fr: Lugweyi est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Shukrani», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 4 enfants dont 3 étudient et 1 est encore gamin. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires au marché de la ville depuis 3 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en un sac d’haricots. Elle commença son business  avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite construire une maison et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler  que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Lugweyi is an entrepreneur, a member of the Shukrani community bank and a client of the IMF Hekima. She is married, 40 years old, and the mother of four children, three of whom are in school and one is still very young. Lugweyi sells food products at the town market for three years. 

Lugweyi will buy a bag of beans. She launched her business with  funds received from her husband. Her wish is to be able to build a house and provide for her children's education. To conclude, Lugweyi thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking. We would like to point out that some of the clients [in the photo] are holding their children.

loans.use: to buy a bag of beans.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos con 36 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Santos de dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y poder invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Santos es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, no se encuentra bancarizado.
texts.en:
Santos is 36 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his partner and their four children in the district of Cañaris, Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque department, Peru. The inhabitants of this area work primarily in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry.

Santos works in agriculture, specifically coffee growing, with 10 years experience in the trade. He is applying for this loan for the purchase of fertilizers and to be able to invest in the maintenance of his farm. In this manner he will obtain a better yield.

Santos is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa. He is unbanked.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and be able to invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Rasolovao

texts.fr:
41 ans, Rasolovao est une femme mariée. Son mari est commerçant comme elle. Le couple a six enfants dont deux déjà mariés et quatre encore à leur charge et deux d'entre eux seulement sont scolarisés.
Elle exerce une activité de commerce de détail de plusieurs appareils utiles dans les ménages. Elle démarrait cette activité en 2010 et elle voudrait la développer pour pouvoir épargner davantage. L'objectif est de pouvoir construire sa propre maison un jour pour éviter la location.
texts.en:
Rasolovao is a 41-year-old married woman. Her husband is a shopkeeper, as is she. The couple have six children; two are already married and four are still in their charge. Only two of these four children are in school. 

She is involved in retail, trading several useful household appliances. She started this business in 2010 and she would like to develop it in order to save more money. Her aim is to be able to build her own house one day to avoid paying rent.

loans.use: to buy household electrical appliances: radios, torches, irons, food processors, etc.

loans.name: Ruhsoramo

texts.ru:
Она Рухсорамо. Рухсорамо работает портнихой. Ей 31 год. Рухсорамо живет в Душанбе вместе со своим 5 летним сыном. Ее муж, чтобы прокормить семью уехал на заработки в Россию  и там сейчас работает разнорабочим. Он старается по мере возможности помогать жене и сыну. Рухсорамо не отставая от мужа тоже старается принести в дом доход. 
  В таджикской культуре каждый родитель имеет долг перед сыном в проведении мероприятия в честь обрезания. Рухсорамо с мужем хотят исполнить свой долг и провести мероприятия. Для покрытия расходов она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
This is Ruhsoramo. She works as a seamstress. She is 31 year old. Ruhsoramo lives in Dushanbe with her 5-year old son.  In order to support their family, her husband  left for Russia, where he currently finds work as an unskilled laborer. He tries to help his wife and son as much as he can. Ruhsoramo also does her part and works hard to to earn an income.


In the Tajik culture, parents are expected to organize a celebration in honor of their son's circumcision ceremony. Ruhsoramo and her husband would like to fulfill their duty and organize such an event. Ruhsoramo has applied for a credit in order to cover these expenses.

loans.use: to celebrate her son's circumcision.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be energetic. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to have better living conditions within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is a 34-year-old lady, and she is completely devoted to her husband who earns a very low income. He provides sheltering services for houses under construction. He builds temporary shelters with help from bamboo and wooden planks to cover concrete mixtures for up to 2 weeks. Most of his work depends upon the specific contract, though much of the time he is unable to get any contract for sheltering services.

Recently Nabila's husband received a huge contract but he does not have enough sheltering material in order to provide proper services. Nabila has requested a loan so that her husband will be able to buy more sheltering material such as wooden planks, bamboo, and nails and fulfill this contract.

Nabila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that Kiva's lenders take pity on her and support her in the form of loan support.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks and bamboo for her husband's sheltering services business.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiva est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans qui habite à Tokoin. Mère de trois enfants, Akossiwa est une marchande de pains « Sakomi » accompagné de la mayonnaise et du beurre. Akossiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier et à domicile pour gagner des revenus. Pour commander des douzaines de pains, des unités de mayonnaises et de beurres, Akossiva nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir aider son mari à la survie de sa famille.
texts.en: Akossiva is a married woman, 30 years old, living in Tokoin. The mother of three, she is a merchant of “sakomi” bread served with mayonnaise and butter. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market and resells from neighborhood to neighborhood and out of her home in order to earn an income. To put in an order for dozens of breads, units of mayonnaise, and units of butter, Akossiva has need of these funds for financing her supplies and realizing a good profit margin. She could then help out her husband for her family’s survival.

loans.use: to purchase 20 dozen of bread, 40 units of mayonnaise, and 40 units of butter

loans.name: Ummaru

texts.en:
Ummaru is a maize farmer from Kurungofi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ummaru is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ummaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ummaru can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Ummaru is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt: O Sr. Manuel é casado, vive com sua esposa e 3 filhos. É militar. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção tal como chapas de zinco, barrotes, tijoleira, cimento, areia, ferros, portas. Tem sonho de abrir um estabelecimento comercial para as vendas a grosso e criação de gado bovino. Tem como maior desafio financiamento
texts.en:
Manuel is married and lives with his wife and three children. He works for the military. With this loan, he is planning to purchase construction materials, such as zinc sheets, bars, bricks, cement, sand, iron, and doors.

His dream is to open a wholesale store and start raising cattle. His biggest challenge is the lack of funding.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, bars, bricks, cement, sand, iron, and doors.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt: A Sra. Luísa é mãe solteira vivendo com dois filhos e um irmão. É comerciante e promotora de venda na empresa onde trabalha, faz a sua prestação de serviços com sua irmã, sua filha e seu irmão. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar equipamentos para o seu negócio, nomeadamente mesas, cadeiras, capas para ornamentar eventos. Tem sonho de crescer mais no seu negócio, ter um espaço de realização de eventos com uma capacidade considerável. Tem como maior desafio o financiamento.
texts.en: Luísa is a single mother who lives with two children and a brother. She is a saleswoman and sales promoter in the company where she works. She works with her sister, her daughter, and her brother. She plans to use this loan to buy supplies for her business--namely, tables, chairs, and decorative slipcovers. Her dream is to expand her business and have a large event space. Her biggest challenge is acquiring financing.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and decorative slipcovers.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be focused.

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, flour, soap, sweets, and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, bread, soda, and sweets.

His business goal is to have a big business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, bread, soda, and sweets.

loans.name: Ryna's Group

texts.en:
Ryna is 36 years old, living in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum province. She is a married mother of 2 children. She has been growing cassava and black pepper to support her family.

Due to lack of working capital, Ryna decided to take a new loan with VisionFund by leading a group of 4 members. She will manage her loan portion in order to buy fertilizer to grow cassava, which is expected to increase her crop yield.

Ryna hopes to earn more income to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow cassava, which is expected to increase her crop yield.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum Province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Harisu

texts.en:
Harisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Harisu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Harisu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Harisu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Harisu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 

Harisu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en: Perpetual is 24 years old and from the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She runs a clothing shop.Using the money from her first Kiva loan, Perpetual purchased more products for her shop, including bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and jewelry. Perpetual was able to spend her profits on expanding her business and start a flourishing poultry-raising project as well.In light of her business success, Perpetual is requesting a second Kiva loan to stock more clothing in her shop. The interest on Perpetual’s “social-interest” loan will continue to be repaid through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life-skills sessions for students at the nearby high school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen is 27 years old and lives in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. In 2013, Ellen finished school and opened her clothing shop in the local market. Using the money from her first Kiva loan, Ellen was able to expand her stock. This boosted her profits, which helped her improve her standard of living, expand her business and create employment opportunities in the community.In light of her business success, Ellen is requesting a second Kiva loan to purchase more clothing stock to increase business, especially during the Christmas holiday.  Ellen will continue to repay her interest as “social-interest” through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students in the nearby high school. She helps students form and maintain study groups to promote cooperative learning.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock to increase her business, especially during the Christmas holiday.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is a 26-year-old married businesswoman with two children. She lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe.

Yvonne operates a mobile stand from which she sells popsicles and drinks to the community. She started her business in 2012 as a hobby and has come to love it. From her business, Yvonne has found economic independence from her husband.

She used her first Kiva loan to increase stock, and has used the proceeds from that growth to enroll in school. With the expansion of her business, Yvonne is now able to buy supplies in bulk and save on costs. She is also able to provide sick family members with money to go to the clinic.

Yvonne seeks a second Kiva loan to purchase more drinks and popsicles and to increase sales. She intends to open a permanent shop and to become self-sufficient in her business. Yvonne volunteers in her community as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students life skills sessions. Yvonne will continue to repay the interest on her “social-interest” loan through her weekly volunteer work.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks and popsicles and to increase sales.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Divorcée, Adjo est une femme âgée de 37 ans résidant à Tokoin. Adjo vit avec ses deux enfants et est une revendeuse  de chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Adjo demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des douzaines de chaussures en vue de mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis à certaines dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: Adjo is a 37-year-old divorced woman residing in Tokoin. She lives with her two children and sells shoes, which she gets twice a month at the market to resell out of her home and by circulating through nearby neighborhoods. Adjo is asking for this loan to realize her purchase of dozens of shoes with the aim of doing better in her sales and earning a profit. The purpose is to help her children with their education and then to cover certain day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase six dozen shoes

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 34 years old and lives in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe with her husband and three children. She has been successfully operating a clothing stand at her local market for over two and a half years.Dorcas used the money from her first Kiva loan to expand her business into a large boutique. She supports her family on the profits from her business.In light of her business success, Dorcas is seeking a second Kiva loan to further expand her business by offering an increased variety of goods and by building her own shop. She also hopes to create employment options within the community. The interest on Dorcas’s “social-interest” loan will continue to be repaid through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions with students at her local high school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lugazi Umea School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ibrahim. He is the Head Teacher of Lugazi UMEA School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Lugazi with 522 students. Lugazi UMEA School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Lugazi UMEA School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Ibrahim ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 36-year-old married mother of five. Seven years ago, she started working in chocolate decorating to help her husband cover the increasing needs and expenses of their children. Nadia is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who is trying her best to increase her income. Lately, she started selling clothes as a second source of income. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to attract new customers.

Nadia hopes to expand her two businesses more in the upcoming future to increase her income and to provide her family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to attract new customers

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Membre depuis  Janvier 2004,  cette brave femme a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit. Elle a comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou est mariée. Elle est vendeuse de couscous de produits alimentaires. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 15 sacs  de 50 kg de mil à 120f le kg , du bois pour la cuisson à 50 000f et d’autres condiments pour la préparation du couscous 100 000f pour après préparation  le revendre en détails dans son quartier 07 sacs de riz 13500f le sac, 04 bouteilles de 20 litre d'huile raffiné à 20 000f la bouteille,03 bouteilles de 20 litres d'huile de palme à 12 000f la bouteille. elle compte a chaque 15 jours renouveler son stock à hauteur de 500 000f.

Avec se bénéfices, elle compte prendre en charge ses enfants (dépense journalière, scolarité et soins médicaux) et renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
A member since January 2004, this brave lady has a good experience in terms of borrowing. Her main activity is petty trade. Mrs Aissatou is married. She sells couscous made from food products.

With this new loan, she intends to buy 15 50-kg bags of millet at 120f per kg, wood for cooking at 50 000f and other condiments for the preparation of couscous for an amount of 100 000f. After preparation she will retail it in her neighbourhood, along with 7 bags of rice at 13 500f per bag, 4 20-litre bottles of refined oil at 20 000f per bottle and 3 bottles of 20-litre palm oil at 12 000f per unit. She plans to restock every 15 days up to 500 000f. However, the rest of the money is used to renew her stock.

With her profits, she intends to care for her children (daily expenses, schooling and medical care) and build her savings.

loans.use: to buy 15 50-kg bags of millet at 120f per kg, wood for cooking at 50 000f and other condiments for the preparation of couscous for the sum of 100 000f.

loans.name: Floridelia

texts.es:
La señora Floridelia de 35 años de edad, tiene un hijo que depende de ella, vive en  San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica hace 6  años al negocio de abarrotería como ser; producto lácteo, frescos, granos básicos, carnes y otros productos de la canasta familiar, tiene una buena clientela por  estar  ubicada en un punto muy  bueno.
La señora Floridelia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como; jabón, manteca, papel higiénico, frescos, pollo, azúcar y cosméticos etc. está muy contenta del apoyo que Prisma le puede brindar. 

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, honduras - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Floridelia is 35 years old. She has a son who depends upon her. She lives in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. For 6 years she has had a grocery store with goods such as dairy products, cold drinks, staple grains, meats, and other products that fill basic family needs. She has a good clientele since she is located in a very good spot.

Floridelia is requesting a loan to buy products such as soap, butter, toilet paper, cold drinks, chicken, sugar, cosmetics etc. She is very happy for the help that Prisma can provide her.

Her dream is to improve her business and to be able to have a better quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy products such as soap, butter, toilet paper, cold drinks, chicken, sugar, cosmetics etc.

loans.name: Dutanguyubuzima Group

texts.fr:
Salomon  fait partie du groupe  Dutaguyubuzima et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 31 ans et est marié à Yvette ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 4 mois à 7ans ans,dont  2 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce d'essence  depuis  4 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d'essence  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Salomon is a member of the Dutaguyubuzima group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 31 and married to a farmer named Yvette. They have three children aged between four months and seven years old.  Two of them go to school.

He has been selling gasoline for four years.

This is his second loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that he requests, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of gasoline for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land, and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of gasoline for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Alexi Neftali

texts.es:
Alexi estudió hasta cuarto grado del nivel básico, no continuó estudiando pues tenía que apoyar a sus padres con los trabajos en el campo (siembra de maíz, frijoles y otros) se acompañó hace dos años y es padre de una niña de tres meses de edad y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.


Alexi trabaja en la siembra de granos básicos desde que tenia ochos años de edad cuando su padre lo llevaba a los cultivos, ahora en día, él tiene cultivada media hectárea de maíz y media de frijoles las cuales trabaja para así asegurar la alimentación de la familia y una parte para vender. A los 22 años aprendió  gracias a un amigo con quien él trabajaba de ayudante de albañil, y por eso es que también se dedica a la construcción.


Él solicita ayuda con este crédito para comprar abono para la el cultivo de maíz y frijol, además pagará alquiler del terreno donde cultiva.


Él espera seguir trabajando duro para asegurar un buen futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Alexi went to school through the fourth grade of the basic level. He did not continue going to school since he had to help his parents with the field work (he plants corn, beans, and other crops). He married two years ago and is the father of a three-month-old girl. His wife does the domestic tasks.

Alexi has worked raising basic grains since he was eight years old, when his father took him to the fields. Now he has half a hectare of corn and half [a hectare] of beans under cultivation, which he works to thus assure the feeding of his family, and [he raises] a part to sell. At the age of 22, he learned [masonry], thanks to a friend with whom he was working as a mason's assistant, and because of this he also works in construction.

He is applying for help with this loan to buy compost for the corn and bean crops; in addition, he will pay to rent the land that he cultivates.

He hopes to continue working hard to assure his family of a good future.

loans.use: to buy compost for the corn and bean crops; in addition, he will pay to rent the land where he plants.

loans.name: Adzawa

texts.fr: Mariée et  mère d’un enfant, Adzowa est une femme âgée de 51 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Adzowa est une couturière qui expose des pagnes dans son atelier de couture pour sa clientèle. Pour s’approvisionner, Adzowa se rend une fois par mois au marché. Adzowa demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner un gain et pouvoir bien relancer son activité puis subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: A married mother of one child, Adzowa is 51 years old and lives in Tokoin. She is a seamstress who displays 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in her sewing workshop for her customers. To stock up, she goes once a month to the market. Adzowa is asking for this loan to order lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth with the aim of doing well in her sales and earning a profit, so as to relaunch her business and then to meet the needs of her children and support their education.

loans.use: to purchase 42 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Pelucy

texts.en:
Pelucy is a divorced mother of two children who lives in Kasese district. She is the family's sole bread winner. She sells water as her main source of income.

Previously, Pelucy used to sell charcoal, but she was affected by price fluctuations. But now the season is so good that she wants to resume selling charcoal to supplement her income. The challenge is that there is little money at hand to buy start-off stock.

Pelucy is requesting money to start her project of buying charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat is an 18-year-old freshman in the International and Business Law (IBL) Program at AUCA. He has dreams of making his country much better and he wishes to realize them. He plans to get a good education at a good university. He will be an open-minded person and have more chances to make his goals come true. He wants to acquire skills and knowledge.

His goal is to study at IBL at AUCA and improve the social and economic situation of his country through the judicial system. He says that Kyrgyzstan needs to have professional lawyers to represent the country’s interests in international lawsuits. The absence of professional lawyers forces his government to hire lawyers from abroad and spend a lot of money.

His family (mother and sister) don't have enough money for his education. They live in the Issyk-Kul region of Kyrgyzstan, which is far from Bishkek (the university). Azat rents a flat with friends and lives in Bishkek. His mother’s salary can not cover everything. He has a part-time job.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Mrs. Hue is 55 years old, married, and has three children. She has been practicing agro-forestry for the last eight years. She wants to apply for her loan to buy more certified seeds and fertilizers to improve her farming. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hope is to improve family living standards. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To buy more certified seeds and fertilizer to improve her farming.

loans.name: Devora De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Sus dos hijos y el deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida, son los motores que impulsan a Devora para superarse día a día, y con la ayuda de algunos préstamos pasados ha logrado cambiar algunos aspectos en su vida, como mejorar su casa y la alimentación de sus hijos, sin embargo, aún queda mucho camino por recorrer y es por eso que Devora solicita otro crédito.
Este nuevo crédito indica que, lo necesita para comprar frutas y verduras frescas y que resulten atractivas para el cliente, y con las ganancias que estas le generen piensa seguir mejorando su hogar, y la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Her two children and the desire to improve their quality of life are the forces that drive Devora to outdo herself day after day. With the help of some past loans, she has succeeded in changing some aspects of their life, such as improving her house and the feeding of her children. Nevertheless, there still remain many roads to travel, and it is for this reason that Devora is applying for another loan.

As this new loan indicates, she needs to buy fruits and fresh vegetables that will look attractive to her customers, and with the earnings that these will generate, she is thinking of continuing to improve her house and the diet of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 53-year-old married mother of five. Almost a year ago, she started selling accessories and makeup to help her husband cover the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Hanan is trying hard to develop her business and attract customers.

Hanan is a sacrificing mother who is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay her son's university tuition fees. He is studying accounting in his second academic year. She believes that this is the only way to guarantee her son's future.

Hanan hopes to develop her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees for her son, who is studying accounting in his second academic year.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Amadu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Amadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Amadu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Amadu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es:
Ramón, de 57 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen dos hijos, pero solo el menor vive con ellos.

Ramón, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de especies menores como aves y cerdos; eta actividad la realiza desde que era joven y lo aprendió de su padre.

Ramón, necesita el préstamo para comprar una docena de pollitos, de patos y una docena de guajolotes, porque se acerca la época navideña y él comercializar las aves a un buen precio.

Ramón, sueña con tener una granja de gallinas ponedoras para la producción de huevo y además quiere tener su propia producción de patos y guajolotes.
texts.en:
Ramón is 57 years old. He didn't go to school. He is married, and his partner is a housewife. They have two children, but only the younger one lives with them.

Ramón farms and raises small animals such as poultry and pigs. He has done this work since he was young and learned it from his father.

Ramón needs the loan to buy a dozen small chickens, a dozen ducks and a dozen turkeys, because the Christmas season is approaching and he will sell the poultry at a good price..

Ramón dreams of having a farm for egg-laying hens, and also wants to have his own facility for raising ducks and turkeys..

loans.use: to buy a dozen small chickens, a dozen ducks, and a dozen turkeys.

loans.name: Wamama Imani Group

texts.fr: Ayant acquis l'expérience de la vente de pagnes de sa mère il ya maintenant quinze ans, Cécile se rappelle que cette activité les a permis d'étudier et d'avoir un logis. Quoiqu'elle réalise une vente moyenne de dix-neuf dollars par jour, Cecile se plaint de l'insuffisance du fond de roulement et de la suppression du défilé organisé à chaque journée internationale de la femme, occasion spéciale pour vendre une grande quantité des pagnes (uniformes choisies par les femmes). Elle souhaite agrandir son activité en diversifiant la qualité de pagnes surtout en cette période de préparatoire de fêtes de fin d'année; tout ceci dans le but d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille (scolarisation, habitat,...). Membre du groupe WAMAMA IMANI, Cecile est en troisième position sur photo (de gauche à droite) et porte sur sa tête un foulard orange.
texts.en:
Having acquired experience selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) with her mother fifteen years ago, Cécile recalls that this business enabled them to go to school and have a place to live. Although her sales average $19 per day, Cécile complains of a lack of working capital and the suppression of organized marches at every International Women’s Day, a special occasion for selling a large quantity of ‘pagne’ (the type of wear favored by women).

Her wish is to expand her business by diversifying the quality of pagne, especially at this time preparing for the year-end holidays; it is all with the aim of improving her family's living conditions (education, clothing, …) A member of the group WAMAMA IMANI, Cecile appears third from the left in the photo with an orange headscarf.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth to resell by diversifying in quality

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a native from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She grows and sells rice. She is 35 years old and is married with 4 young children.

Flordeliza owns rice paddies and sells rice to the local residents in her area. Aside from farming, she also raises hogs as an additional source of income. Her husband works in construction, and his income is a great help in catering to the needs of their entire family.

Flordeliza has been engaged in farming for the past 4 years. She would like to acquire funds to be able to expand her sources of income. But she faces challenges in her livelihood: the lack of capital and the high cost of farm maintenance.

Flordeliza would like to both buy rice seedlings, fertilizer, pig feed, and pay for labor fees. This would help boost and improve the yield of her farm. She would be able to raise quality hogs and slowly improve her finances. This also would enable her to provide for her family's needs and continue expanding her farm to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to both buy rice seedlings, fertilizer, pig feed, and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Binnaz

texts.en:
Binnaz is married and sews tulle at home. She learned this from one of her mother's employers. She is sewing in order to make her own money and not to be a burden to her family for three years. With the help of her second loan she is going to buy bulks of tulle and sew different kinds of tulle for her customers. In the future she wants to open a shop on her own and buy a car.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Binnaz Hanım evli, evinde tül dikiyor. Annesinin iş yerinde ki elemandan tül dikmeyi öğreniyor. Kendi parasını kazanmak, ailesine yük olmamak için evinde üç yıldır tül dikimi yapıyor. Aldığı ikinci kredi ile tül alacak müşterilerine daha çok çeşit seçenek sunacak. İleride kendine dükkan açmak,araba almak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy tulle.

loans.name: María Evangelista

texts.es:
María, de 51 años de edad, estudió hasta 7° grado, es viuda y se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, vive en compañía de un hijo, su nuera y 2 nietos.


María se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años, vende ropa para niños, niñas, hombres y mujeres, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de medicina, la cliente para vender la ropa lo hace de casa en casa y a veces tiene que recorrer grandes distancias.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar camisas, blusas, pantalones, calzonetas, ropa interior, etc para surtir su negocio.



El sueño de María es seguir trabajando para salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos para obtener mayor ganancia.
texts.en: Maria is 51 years old. She studied up to 7th grade. She is a widow and works buying and selling clothes. She lives with her son, her daughter-in-law and 2 grandchildren. Maria has worked selling clothes for three years. She sells clothes for boys, girls, men and women. Before, she used to sell medicine. She sells clothes door to door, and sometimes she has to travel long distances. She will use the loan to buy shirts, blouses, pants, swimming trunks, underwear, etc. to stock up her business. Maria's dream is to keep on working to move ahead and improve her income, in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, swimming trunks, underwear, etc. to stock up her business.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: Ishrat is a 57-year-old married woman, living with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son drives a van in Lahore city, and provides transportation to the passengers from one stop to another. Due to continuous work, most of the parts of the van have become depreciated and there is an urgent need for replacement with a new one. Therefore, Ishrat requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan which is the field partner of Kiva. Ishrat hopes that through this amount, her husband would be able to buy the spare parts so he can drive it again. Ishrat belongs to a poor family. Her son is the only wage earner; this is the reason she does not have any other source of income. Ishrat thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of the van for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ibrahim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy improved machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
PROFIL DU GROUPE BENKADI (YA103527)
YACOUBA est le Monsieur qui a levé sa main  sur la photo. C’est un cultivateur malien, non scolarisé, âgé de 40 ans et père de 5 enfants âgés de 6 à 12 ans dont 2 scolarisés.
Il exerce l’élevage de mouton il y a plus de 10 ans. YACOUBA s’approvisionne dans les marchés de sa localité et revend dans les mêmes marchés. Le profit qu’il gagne lui permet de satisfaire certains besoins de sa famille.
YACOUBA prend le prêt au RMCR pour financer son  activité au moment opportun afin d’accroitre son profit. Malgré qu’il soit  souvent confronté au problème d’augmentation du prix des animaux lors de l’approvisionnement, il se sent à l’aise d’exercer cette activité car il se voit  participer au développement économique de sa communauté.
   Dans les jours à venir, YACOUBA rêve d’être  un grand éleveur- exportateur des bœufs.
texts.en:
Profile of GROUPE BENKADI (YA103527)

YACOUBA is the gentleman with a hand raised in the photo. He is a Malian farmer, uneducated, 49 years old, and the father of five children, aged 6 to 12, of whom two are in school.

He has been raising sheep for over ten years. He gets his supplies from his town’s markets and resells at the same markets. The profit he earns will enable him to meet certain family needs.

YACOUBA is taking out a loan from RMCR to finance his business at the right time, so as to grow his profit. Despite being confronted often with the problem of price increases when stocking up on animals, he feels all right about operating his business, since he sees himself helping to develop his community economically. In the coming years, YACOUBA’s dream is to be a major livestock farmer/exporter of cattle.

loans.use: to raise sheep to sell

loans.name: Tania Bismara

texts.es:
Tania es una profesora de primaria y como muchas profesoras en Nicaragua necesita de un ingreso extra, es por eso que tiene dos trabajos, debido al bajo sueldo de los maestros en el país; su otro empleo, el cual ejerce en su tiempo libre, es la venta de cosméticos. 
El préstamo que Tania solicita lo requiere para diversificar su negocio y comprar variedad de ropa y calzado, ya que, además de vender cosméticos también le gustaría vender ropa y calzado, y debido a que se acerca la temporada navideña espera que las ventas aumenten y obtenga un margen de ganancia bastante amplio y con eso espera mejorar su hogar y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Tania is an elementary school teacher, and like many teachers in Nicaragua, she needs extra income because of the low salary of teachers in the country. Therefore, she has two jobs. Her other job, which she does in her free time, is selling cosmetics. Tania is requesting a loan to diversify her business and buy an assortment of clothes and footwear, because besides selling cosmetics she would also like to sell clothes and footwear. Also, because the Christmas season is approaching, she hopes to sell more and have a larger margin of profit. With this, she hopes to improve her household and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Güner

texts.en:
Güner is a widow and a mother of three. Twenty years ago she had a serious illness and, in order to overcome the stress of her illness, she decided to work. She thought that the best thing for her was to open a millinery shop. Over twenty years she has expanded her business to include home textiles and trousseau materials.

Güner wants to expand her business further. With help from her second loan, she will increase the number of her products she sells.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.

Güner Hanım dul üç çocuk annesi. Yirmi yıl önce rahatsızlığından dolayı sorunlarını unutmak için bir işle uğraşmaya karar veriyor. Yapabileceği en iyi iş olarak tuhafiye dükkanı açmayı uygun buluyor. Yirmi yıl içinde işini ilerleterek ev tekstil ve çeyizlik malzemeler ile çeşidini arttırarak çeyizlik satışı mağazasına çeviriyor. Aldığı ikinci kredi ile mağazasın da ürün çeşidini arttıracak. İşini daha da büyütmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy dowry materials to resell.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
For the past 5 years, Marichu's main source of income has been raising hogs. She raises and sells pigs to the local residents in her community. She is 46 years old and is married with one grown child. She hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol.

Marichu decided to join Kiva's field partner CEVI to access a loan and buy pig feed, piglets, and pig supplements. This could help enhance her source of income and slowly be able to fulfill her obligations. Thus she will now have an adequate supply of food for her livestock to grow healthy.

Marichu is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage them successfully so she can become financially stable and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, piglets, and pig supplements.

loans.name: Rosa Cándida

texts.es:
Rosa de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta 1º grado, esta acompañada, su esposo es agricultor y tienen 5 hijos pero  solo dos  viven junto con ellos.


Rosa ha trabajado en la siembra de granos básicos desde la edad de 10 años. Actualmente siembran 2 hectáreas de cultivo de maíz y yuca, además tiene 6 bovinos. Todo lo realiza con ayuda de su esposo y sus dos hijos, gracias a ese esfuerzo han logrado salir adelante.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar una novilla.

Rosa tiene el sueño de mejorar su vivienda y le gustaría tener mayor numero de bovinos.
texts.en: Rosa is 63 years old and studied up to first grade. She has a common law partner who is a farmer, and they have 5 children, but only two live with them. Rosa has worked growing basic grains since she was 10 years old. Currently, they grow 2 hectares of corn and cassava. Also, she has 6 cattle. She works with help from her husband and their two children. Thanks to this effort, they have been able to move ahead. She needs the loan to buy a heifer. Rosa's dream is to improve her house and have more cattle.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Nohemi Yolany

texts.es:
Nohemí, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo e hijos en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.
Ella tiene mas de 11 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería, este negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, zapatos, cremas y lociones. el préstamo que solicita es por 16,000 lempiras, es el onceavo préstamo solicitado a ODEF y va comprar mercadería nueva para su negocio como ser ropa, calzado, productos de belleza y otros para surtir. Una de su meta es hacer una reparación a su casa para ampliar el local del negocio  e incrementar ingresos para cumplir su sueño de ver graduados a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nohemí is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives with her husband and children in a village that is part of the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.

She has been selling merchandise for more than 11 years. Her business is located in her home, and she sells women's, men's and children's clothing, shoes, as well as creams and lotions.

The loan she is requesting is for 16,000 lempiras. This is the eleventh loan requested from ODEF, and she is going to buy new merchandise for her business, such as clothing, footwear, beauty products and other items for stocking her store.

One of her goals is to repair her home in order to expand the shop area and increase her income in order to fulfill her dream of seeing her children graduate.

loans.use: to re-stock clothing, footwear and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Anagban

texts.fr: Anagban est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère d’un enfant, Anagban est une marchande de verres à boire et des gâteaux qui achète ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le au bord de la route sous un hangar pour gagner ses revenus. Pour commander des cartons de verres à boire et des gâteaux ; Anagban nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de venir en aide à son enfant dans son éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Anagban is a married woman, 53 years old, living in Tokoin. The mother of one child, she is a merchant of drinking glasses and cakes, which she purchases twice a month at the market and then [resells] in a shed on the roadside, so as to earn an income. To put in an order for boxes of drinking glasses and some cakes, Anagban has need of these funds to finance her supplies and realize a good profit margin. This is for assisting her child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 2 units of cakes and 20 boxes of drinking glasses

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Doña María Cristina tiene ya más de tres años de estar recibiendo el apoyo de Kiva y Fape. Esta muy agradecida ya que lamentablemente  es viuda y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a cuatro hijos y ella se está esforzando por darle lo mejor a sus hijos y con el apoyo que está recibiendo ha mejorado su negocio que es venta de comidas y tortillas y también su hogar. Es bien puntual en sus pagos y solicita el crédito para comprar leña para cocinar, maíz y artículos de consumo diario para cocinar.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina has been receiving help from Kiva and Fape for more than three years. She is very grateful since, sadly, she is a widow and has four children under her care. She is working hard to give the best to her children and with the support that she is receiving she has improved her business which is the selling of meals and tortillas.

She is very punctual in her payments and she is requesting the loan to buy firewood for cooking, corn and daily food items to cook.

loans.use: to buy firewood for cooking and daily food items to cook

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr: Veuve et âgée de 62 ans, Tchotcho est une femme qui a un seul enfant à charge. Résidant à Tokoin, Tchotcho prépare de la pâte bandée appelée « Akpan » et vend aussi des œufs qu’elle revend à la devanture de son domicile en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité financière. Tchotcho s’approvisionne sept fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour la préparation. Pour commander le sac de maïs et des plateaux d’œufs, Tchotcho demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat en vue de bien revendre et de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants en aidant son mari à payer les frais scolaires  dès le début de cette rentrée.
texts.en: Tchotcho, a 62-year-old widow, has one child to support. Residing in Tokoin, she makes pâte bandée [a sort of polenta] called “akpan”. She also sells eggs in front of her home with the aim of having good profitability. She gets her necessary supplies seven times a month at the market for her production. To put in an order for a sack of corn and trays of eggs, Tchotcho is asking for this loan to realize her purchase, so as to have better sales and earn more income. She can then cope with her children’s needs and help out her husband in covering schooling costs at the start of this school year.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of corn and five trays of eggs

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De La Ensenada Group
