texts.es: Luis tiene 47 años de edad es soltero y no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un stand alquilado en un mercado cerca a su casa, se dedica aproximadamente 60 horas semanales al trabajo desde hace dos años,sus principales clientes son personas aledañas al lugar donde vive,atiende entre 60 a 70 personas diarias,el préstamo que solicitó lo invertirá para la compra de abarrotes como arroz,azúcar,leche,aceite,huevos y mas. y así poder ampliar su negocio, se siente orgulloso de haber logrado el préstamo  por que lo incentiva a mejorar  y llegar a su meta de tener el negocio mas grande y variado del mercado.Luis tuvo que superar el obstáculo mas grande de su vida que fue la enfermedad y muerte de su madre que lo deprimió bastante, tuvo que sacar fuerzas para poder levantarse y seguir adelante. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el gran apoyo que le ayuda a ser perseverante.
texts.en:
Luis is 47 years old, single and childless. For two years he has worked selling groceries in a rented stand in a market near his home.His main customers are people who live near where he lives, and he serves 60 to 70 customers per day. 

The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of groceries like rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs and more, and so he will be able to expand his business. He feels proud of having gotten this loan because it motivates him to improve and reach his goal of having the largest and most varied business of the market.

Luis had to get through the biggest hurdle of his life which was the sickness and death of his mother, which depressed him greatly. He had to gather strength to be able to get up and move ahead. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for the support which helps him to be resolute.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as milk, sugar, eggs, oil and more.

loans.name: Dúo Las Perlas Group

texts.es: Dúo las Perlas Doña Gelia lisett tiene 46 años de edad es la de blusa azul ella es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos de 26,21,19, y 12 años de edad los 4 estudian ella vive con sus hijos sus ingresos provienen de su negocio y es venta de comida, quiere utilizar su crédito en comprar productos de comida para tener más ganancias en su negocio ella inicio su proyecto vendiendo poco y dando a conocer las delicias que ella prepara hasta hoy en dia que ella tiene más clientes y no le alcanza el producto, ella tuvo que contratar a una empleada por la cantidad de comida que entrega sus clientes son vecinos y fábricas, sus metas son: mejorar los ingresos económicos de su familia ofrecer variedad de productos, fortalecer el negocio es el primer crédito kiva que solicita a fape.
texts.en: Gelia Lisett, from the Duo las Perlas is 46 years old. She is wearing a blue blouse. She is a single mother of 4 children, ages 26, 21, 19 and 12. All four of them attend school and live with her. Her income comes from her business of selling food. She wants to use the loan to buy food items in order to have more income with her business. She started her project small by selling little and by having the delicious dishes she prepares be known. Nowadays that she has more customers, she does not have enough product to satisfy their demand. She had to hire an employee, because of the amount of food she must deliver. Her customers are her neighbors and factories. Her goals are: to improve her family's financial income, to offer a variety of products and to strengthen her business with this first Credikiva she is requesting to Fape.

loans.use: to buy food items in order to prepare meals to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Villa Petapa Group

texts.es: Dúo Villa Petapa Doña Oralia Marina tiene 36 años de edad es la de blusa gris, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos de 16,12,9 años de edad de ellos 3 estudian vive con su esposos e hijos sus ingresos provienen de sus ventas ella trabaja en venta de comida ella va a invertir su crédito en productos de comida(productos comestibles) ella empezó su proyecto con pocos materiales sus clientes son vecinos, y peatonales, espera que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
From the group Dúo Villa Petapa, Oralia Marina is 36 years old. [She is wearing the gray blouse in the photo.] She is married and has 3 children, 16, 12 and 9 years old. All 3 are in school. She lives with her husband and children. Her income comes from sales. She works selling food.

She will invest the loan in food products (comestible products). She began her project with very little materials. Her customers are neighbors and passersby. She hopes that she will be helped with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy edible products to make food to sell.

loans.name: José Morán

texts.es:
José de 33 años de edad,  asistió a la escuela hasta tercer grado, actualmente se encuentra  casado y su esposa  se dedica a los oficios domésticos, y a la atención en una pequeña tienda que tiene en el hogar, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo dos asisten a la escuela.

José se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y a trabajar en jornal, también él es diácono de una iglesia evangélica,  donde es responsable de la administración, también elabora pan artesanal. 

El crédito lo necesita para invertir en sus cultivos de granos básicos de maíz y frijol.

Él espera seguir trabajando para superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old. He went to school up until the third grade. He is currently married and his wife is a homemaker and she also runs a small store they run out of their home. He has three children of whom only two are in school.

José grows corn and beans and does farm labor for a living. He is also the deacon of an evangelical church where he is responsible for administration. He also bakes artisanal bread.

He needs this loan to invest in his crops of the staple grains beans and corn.

He hopes to keep working so he can better himself in life.

loans.use: to invest in his crops of the staple grains beans and corn.

loans.name: Khlaida

texts.en:
Khlaida is a 38-year-old married mother living with her husband and 5 children in the Lahore area of Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and he drives his rickshaw in Lahore city, which is a highly populated area.

A few days ago, Khlaida's husband was in a road accident. He was looking for passenger fares while standing beside the road when a speeding car collided with his rickshaw from behind. He was not injured, but the rickshaw body was seriously damaged and now needs to be replaced with a new one.

Khlaida's husband is short funds to be able to buy a new body for his auto rickshaw. Therefore, Khlaida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy a new body.

Khlaida is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and the field partner BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: to buy a new body for the maintenance of her husband's auto rickshaw transportation service.

loans.name: José Danis

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, culminó sus estudios hasta el bachillerato, actualmente se encuentra casado, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios del hogar, mientras él  presta sus servicios al oficio de albañilería teniendo en cuenta que también trabaja en sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, trabajo que realiza desde que estaba con sus padres y de esta manera cubre las necesidades de su familia, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen únicamente de sus ingresos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar  abono y fertilizantes para el cultivo del maíz. 

Su mayor sueño es darle el estudio a sus hijos para que estos se desarrollen en el ámbito empresarial teniendo en cuenta que el estudio le abre mejores oportunidades de desarrollo.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old. He finished his education with a high school diploma. He is currently married; his life parter is a homemaker while he works in construction. He also works on his bean and corn crops. He has been doing this work since he was with his parents and this is how he covers his family's necessities. He has two children who are completely dependent on his income.

He needs this loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop.

His greatest dream is to provide his children with an education so they can succeed in the business world, as education opens up better opportunities for development.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop.

loans.name: Mario Elber

texts.es: Mario es un hombre de 38 años que vive junto a su esposa en la localidad rural de Santa Rosa de Pucara, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Él trabaja como obrero de construcción y además se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar tres vacas orgánicas, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio por ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is a 38 year old man who lives with his wife in the rural location of Santa Rosa de Pucara, which is located in Moquegua.
He's a construction worker and also works in agriculture and the raising of organic cattle. He pays a lot of attention to the care and feeding of his cattle; the feed is organic alfalfa which he raises.
He's requesting a micro loan for the purchase of three organic cows and hopes that their milk will fetch a higher price because it's organic. In the future he hopes to be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy three organic cows in order to sell the milk they produce and so increase his income.

loans.name: Futuro Para El Bien Group

texts.es: Justina tiene un hijo de 17 años en estudio superior, se dedica a su negocio de Librería desde hace 25 años con la ayuda de su hermano,sus principales cliente son estudiantes de una universidad cercana y personas aledañas al lugar, ella sueña con tener un local mas amplio para poder poner un bazar ya que no hay uno cerca de la zona, el dinero que solicitó lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería como papelería,cuadernos,útiles de oficina y escolares,Agradece a los Inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado y piden que no dejen de ayudar a gente que desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Justina has a 17-year-old son who is pursuing higher education. She has worked in her bookstore business for 25 years with the help of her brother. Her main clients are students from a nearby university and people who live in the surrounding area of the store.

She dreams of having a larger storefront to be able to open up a bazaar as there is not one in the area. She will use the money she is requesting to purchase merchandise such as stationary, notebooks, and office and school supplies. She is thankful for the Kiva lenders for the support that they provide and she asks that they continue to help people who hope to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy school and office supplies.

loans.name: Deguberto

texts.es:
Deguberto con 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge,en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Deguberto se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de cafeto, de variedad Catimor, de tres años, su predio se ubica en el Sector la Tuna en el Caserio Viza del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, se dedica a la agricultura hace 26 años, así mismo cultiva dos has de maíz criollo, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, su producción de cafeto y maíz criollo lo comercializa en el Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de una hectárea de cafeto de variedad Catimor de tres años de edad, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Deguberto es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firmará sólo.
texts.en: Deguberto is 37 years old. He lives in his own house of rustic material with his wife, in the district of Santo Tomas, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, in Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the residents of the area. The inhabitants of this town work mainly in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry. Deguberto works mainly in agriculture, specifically cultivating coffee of the Catimor variety, three years old. His plot is located in the Section of Tuna in the village of  Viza of the district of Santo Tomas, in Cutervo. He has worked for 26 years old in agriculture. He also cultivates two hectares of local corn. He has a lot of experience in this business. He sells his coffee and corn production in the District of Santo Tomas in Cutervo. He will invest his loan to invest in maintaining a three year old hectare of coffee of the Catimor variety. With it he will obtain more income in order to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family. Deguberto is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa. He will sign on his own.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining a three year old hectare of coffee of the Catimor variety.

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena is a 28-year-old divorced mother of one child who has worked as a hairdresser for four years to cover the needs and expenses of her beloved kid.

She is the breadwinner of her family and she is trying hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions. Thus today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of beauty products and cosmetics in addition to hair tools in order to facilitate her work and provide her customers with better service.

Amena hopes to open her own beauty salon in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of beauty cosmetics and to buy hair tools to provide her customers with better service.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is married and has 5 children, 2 of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 4 years, Sofia has owned a food stall business where she serves both her neighbours and town dwellers. In her business, she faces the major challenge of seasonality.

With the 30,000 KES loan she is taking, Sofia wants to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flours, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flours, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 29-year-old lady. She is the mother of four children and is a very poor and needy woman living in the area of Lahore Pakistan. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years. He has been using wooden planks and bamboo which has been depreciated from time to time. Now her husband is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Shazia requested a loan for her husband so that her husband can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo to resume his business. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn the maximum profit with the help of this loan.

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material. This is Shazia's second loan. She assured us that she will pay all installments on time as usual. She is very thankful to Kiva for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy sheltering material for providing sheltering services.

loans.name: Maura Elsy

texts.es:
Maura de 22 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra estudiando el bachillerato a distancia, además trabaja como empleada en un chalet, tiene 1 hija la cual se encuentra estudiando kínder. Maura se encuentra viviendo con una amiga ya que por problemas con su familia decidió apartarse.


Desde la edad de 15 años, Maura se dedica a trabajar en negocios donde le han brindado la oportunidad de empleo, aparte de esto ella se creció en el trabajo del campo, es decir ha trabajado en los cafetales. 

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para gastos de graduación ya que se encuentra culminando sus estudios de bachillerato. 

Sus metas a futuro son poder darle el estudio a su hija para que ella  pueda tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Maura is 22-years-old. She is currently studying for her diploma through distance learning. In addition, she works as an employee in a chalet. She has 1 daughter who is studying in kindergarten. Maura is living with a friend, since she decided to move away because of problems with her family.

For the past 15 years, Maura has earned a living working in businesses who have offered her the opportunity for employment. Apart from this, she grew up doing field work, which is to say she has worked in the coffee plantations.

She needs the money from the loan for graduation expenses, since she is finishing her diploma studies.

Her future goals are to be able to give her daughter an education so that she may have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to pay graduation expenses since she is finishing her diploma studies.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a mother of two children. Her business is hair dressing in her personal salon. She has done this for two years. She has a responsibility of paying school fees for her two children. She has challenges of little capital, and competition. She desires to buy land and build a residential house for her family. At the moment, she wants to buy more beauty supplies but lacks money to do so ahead of the festive season. She is requesting a loan to buy beauty supplies like relaxers, weaves, and braids to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies like relaxers, weaves, and braids to use in her salon.

loans.name: Fidaa

texts.en:
Fidaa is a 48-year-old married mother of two. Twenty years ago she started working in the beauty care field to help her husband who has limited income to cover their family's needs and expenses. She has professional skills in this domain and has her loyal customers.

Fidaa is a sacrificing mother and her family is her priority. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her daughter's university tuition fees. Her daughter is studying translation in her last academic year. Fidaa hopes her daughter will finish her studies successfully, for education is the only way to build a better future.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition fees. She is studying translation in her last academic year.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 39-year-old married father of four. He is a hardworking person who puts so much effort into providing his family with the necessary standards of living. Hassan works as a nurse with a limited monthly salary. He is working hard to manage it very well to cover his family's living needs.

Hassan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children's school tuition fees. Hassan insists on providing his children with the best education available so that they can benefit from a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylvia sells second hand clothes. It's now been nine years and her business is doing pretty well, though faced with the challenges of competition and scarcity of second hand clothes due to high exchange rates, making it hard for traders to import these clothes.

She has the responsibility of taking care of her family and desires to educate her children to higher levels of learning. At the moment she wants to complete her residential house, but lacks some materials to complete the job. Sylivia is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets and timber to complete her house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and timber to complete her house.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer from Kunda village. As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season. Then he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yohanna no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yohanna hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer from Bazai village. As a member of Babban Gona, Yakubu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Yakubu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end, he hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nurcan

texts.en:
Nurcan is married and a mother of two. She is making various ornaments and trousseaus and from felt and selling them. She designs her own products. She says that she loves dealing with handicrafts and loves to produce them.

For seven years she has been making and selling them to her neighbourhood. She is making a contribution to the family budget and alse to the education to her children's school expenses.

She has no trouble in finding customers. She dreams of having a store on her own. She wants her children to get education without having financial problems.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nurcan Hanım evli, iki çocuk annesi. Evinde çeşitli süslemeler, çeyizlik ürünler, bebeklerden çöp torbaları, keçelerden süslemeler yapıp satıyor. İşlerini kendi tasarlayarak yapıyor. El işine çok yatkın olduğunu ve üretmeyi çok sevdiğini söylüyor. Sipariş üzerine yaptığı ürünleri yedi yıldır çevresine satıyor. Hem evinin ihtiyaçlarına hem de çocuklarının okul masraflarına katkıda bulunuyor. Müşteri bulmak da sıkıntı yaşamıyor. Hayali ileride kendi tasarımlarını satacağı bir dükkan açmak. Çocuklarını maddi sıkıntı yaşatmadan okumalarını sağlamak.

loans.use: to buy fabric and felt

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 38 years old, a mother of three children, and living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables. So, Fozia requested a loan so her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Fozia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 26-year-old single lady who started six years ago working as an accountant to cover her needs and expenses. She is an ambitious and independent lady who is still continuing her studies too.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university tuition fees. She believes that higher education serves as the gateway to better options and more opportunity.

She hopes to finish her studies successfully and open her own business which will be the first step toward achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees

loans.name: Dúo Mártires De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es: Dúo Mártires de Villa Nueva Doña Mayra tiene 28 años de edad,  ella  es la de blusa blanca es casada tiene 2 hijos una nena de 6 meses y un niño de 5 años  ella vive con su esposo e hijos  ella se dedica a la venta de tacos, tortas y refacciones   ella quiere invertir su crédito en comprar todo por mayor y no tener más deudas  ella inicio su proyecto cuando tenía 8 años de edad comenzó a trabajar ayudándole a su abuelita a vender refacciones  ya que su mama la dejo cuando ella tenía 1 año de edad ella ha luchado hasta poder comprar la carreta de tacos.  Sus clientes son empleados de las diferentes maquilas, vecinos, y personas que pasan por el lugar, sus esperanzas son: mejorar su calidad de vida, mejorar los ingresos económicos, ofrecer variedad de productos, fortalecer el negocio,  poder superarse y poder comprarle una casa  para el futuro de sus hijos, es el primer crédito kiva que solicita a fape y espera que sean muchos más, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboración de refacciones.
texts.en:
Dúo Mártires de Villa Nueva
Mayra is wearing the white shirt in the photo. She is 28 years old, is married and has two children, a 6-month-old daughter and a five-year-old son. She lives with her husband and children. She works selling tacos, sandwiches and snacks. She wants to invest her loan to purchase in bulk and to pay off her debts.

She started her business when she was 8 years old. She started working, helping her grandmother to sell snacks, since her mother left her when she was 1 year old. She has worked hard and was even able to buy a taco cart. Her clients are workers from different factories, neighbors, and people who pass through the area.

Her hopes are to: improve her quality of life, improve her economic income, offer a variety of products, strengthen her business, be able to get ahead and to be able to buy a house for the future of her children. This is the first Kiva loan that she has applied for from FAPE and she hopes that there will be more in the future. She is asking for this loan to buy food products to make snacks.

loans.use: to buy food products to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial con 70 años de edad,vive solo en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Santa Rosa,provincia de Bagua,departamento de Amazonas,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Marcial se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de arroz.Solicita préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su terreno cultivable. Esta inversión le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias. De esta manera mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.

Marcial es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Marcial is 70 years old. He lives alone in his own house of rustic materials in Santa Rosa district, Bagua province, Amazonas department, in the country of Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the area's inhabitants. The majority of this town's residents earn a living in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

Marcial earns a living in agriculture, specifically rice cultivation. She requests a loan in order to invest in the maintenance of his arable land. This investment will allow him to obtain better profits. In this way, he will improve his economic condition and therefore invest in better living conditions.

Marcial is a recurring member for Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his arable land.

loans.name: God's Hand Group

texts.en:
The demand of lubricants for the efficiency and performance of machines in the mechanical industry within the locality of Chorkor is alarming. Adjetey is a very hardworking young man who is married with a male child who is in the elementary level of education. He is a dealer in the buying and selling of lubricants. Due to the high consumption of lubricant, there has been a greater demand. He is seeking a loan to purchase more lubricants to attend to his customers' demands.

Adjetey is the group representative of God's Hand Group with two women who are also in need of loans for their respective businesses. With heartfelt gratitude, Adjetey and his counterparts will be very glad if their needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase more lubricants to attend to his customers' demands.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Ayawa est une femme célibataire âgée de 35 ans résidant à Tokoin. Avec un enfant à charge, Ayawa est une revendeuse d’ignames frit qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Ayawa sollicite ce prêt pour commander la calebasse d’ignames et des bidons d’huile. Ayawa désire gagner plus de bénéfice afin de venir en aide à  son enfant dans son éducation scolaire puis à prendre à charge les diverses dépenses quotidiennes qu’elle éprouve.
texts.en: Ayawa is a single 35-year old woman living in Tokoin. She has one  child in her care. Ayawa sells fried yams, stocking up three times a month at the market and selling in front of her house. Ayawa is seeking this loan to buy a container of yams and jugs of oil. She would like to earn more in order to provide for her child's schooling as well as take care of various everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy one container of yams and two jugs of oil.

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer from Kunda village. As a Babban Gona member, Hannatu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Hannatu can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hannatu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Hannatu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Wakati

texts.en:
Wakati is married with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale .She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Sanaa1 Group

texts.en:
Hiyam is the featured borrower for Sanaa1 Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Hiyam is a 51-year-old married mother of four. Almost a year ago, she started selling cosmetics to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker who is trying to develop her business and gain loyal customers. Hiyam is a sacrificing mother who is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her daughter's university tuition fees. Her daughter studies biology in her fourth academic year. Hiyam is the woman on the left in the photo. Jamal is the lady in the middle, and Randa is the woman on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition fees. Her daughter studies biology in her fourth academic year

loans.name: Imane

texts.en: Imane is a 29 year-old Lebanese married woman mother of two children, both of whom attend school. They all live with her husband who is the income provider. She states that living costs are becoming very expensive. This is the reason why she is in real need today of borrowing a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. The funds will be paid at once to cover her children's study fees. Her first goal is to insure a good education for them.

loans.use: to cover her children's study fees.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with four children, none of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman and has three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, which neighbours and town dwellers patronize. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients, hence perishability of goods leading to losses.

With the KES 45,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Estelia Noemi

texts.es:
Estelia de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta el 9° grado, ya que  su situación económica no le lo permitía continuar, tiene una hija y es madre soltera.

Estelia se dedica a la venta de artículos de belleza, vende por catálogos de revista, esta es la principal fuente de ingresos de ella ya que no realiza otra actividad productiva. 

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar más productos de belleza para vender, como lociones, cremas, pinturas, etc.

Su mayor sueño es poder crecer en su negocio y hacer todo por ayudar a su hija.
texts.en:
Estelia is 25 years old and went as far as 9th grade in school, as her financial situation did not allow her to continue. She is a single mother and has a daughter.

Estelia sells beauty products by catalog. It is her main source of income as she has no other employment. She needs this loan to buy more beauty products to sell, such as lotions, creams and nail polishes, etc.

Her greatest dream is to be able to see her business grow, and do everything for the sake of helping her daughter.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell, such as lotions, creams, nail polishes, etc.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 26-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband and one child. She is providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services. Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her tailoring services.

loans.name: Ithanji Muirungi Shg Group

texts.en: The lady raising her hand in the photo is Irene. She is 48 years old and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to gain skills in enterprise management. She does dairy farming and is borrowing a Kiva loan for the second time to repair her cowshed which will result in high levels of milk production. She hopes for more income that will enable her to provide the basic needs, such as food and clothing, for her family. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to pay for cowshed construction that will ensure high milk yield.

loans.name: Müge

texts.en:
Müge is divorced and living with her two children.  She could not find a regular job so she is trying to work from home. She had been making and selling spices before but with the help of this loan she will make and buy sausages.  She thinks that she will gain more with this.  She only wants her children to get educated without being a burden to anybody else.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Müge hanım eşinden ayrılmış, iki çocuğu ile yaşıyor.  Düzenli bir iş bulamadığından evinde bir şeyler yaparak geçimini sağlamaya çalışıyor.  Daha önceleri çeşitli baharat satışı yapan Müge Hanım aldığı bu kredi ile sucuk yapıp satacak.  Daha çok kazanacağını düşünüyor.  Tek amacı  kimseye muhtaç olmadan çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını karşılayıp onları okutmak.

loans.use: to buy sausage materials

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan Hanım is married and a mother of three. For long years she has been making noodles, tomato paste, tomato juice and tarhana at home and selling them. She has her own customers and sells by order. In the future she wants to open a store of her own.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Reyhan Hanım evli, üç çocuk annesi. Uzun yıllardır evinde makarna, salça, domates suları, tarhana gibi ürünler yapıp satıyor. Kendine ait müşterileri oluşmuş sipariş üzerine ürünlerini yapıyor. İleride ürünlerini satacağı bir dükkan açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy flour, egg and tomato

loans.name: Zeynep Ebru

texts.en:
Zeynep is married and a mother of two. For two years she has been selling jewelry from a stand by the sea in order to make a contribution to the family budget. With the first loan she will buy jewelry in bulk. She wants to expand her business and open a shop of her own.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Zeynep Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. İki yıldır ailesinin geçimine katkı sağlamak için sahilde stand açarak bijuteri ürünleri satıyor. Aldığı ilk kredi ile toplu malzeme alacak. İleri de işinde ilerlemek, kendine ait bir dükkan açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy jewelry materials.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Ibrahim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Ibrahim can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ibrahim has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Ibrahim is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sibel

texts.en:
Sibel is married and a mother of two. In order to make a contribution to the family budget and to meet the school needs of her children, she is doing knitting and sewing towels and scarfs at home. She sells them to her neighbors and to a friend selling them in bazaars. With the help of her first loan she is planning to buy materials in bulk. She wants to produce more with the help of these materials. In the future she wants to open a shop of her own and to buy a house.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sibel hanım evli, iki çocuk annesi. Eşine ev ekonomisinde katkı sağlamak ve çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını daha rahat karşılamak için evde tülbent, havlu, örgü işleri yapıyor. Yaptığı işleri çevresine ve pazarcı bir arkadaşına satıyor. Aldığı ilk kredi ile malzeme alacak. Elinde toplu ürün bulundurarak siparişlerini karşılayacak. İleride bir dükkan açmak ve ev almak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy towels, cheesecloth and braid rope for her home crafting activities

loans.name: Dúo San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Dúo San Miguel Este dúo está liderado por la señorita Irma Silvia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y maíz  y en el ultimo crédito también decidió  invertir en la compra de telas para la confección de playeras y blusas, este es el tercer crédito que ella solicita en KIVA.
Ella dice que se siente muy animada ya que tiene muchos planes para invertir y poder aprovechar los últimos meses del año  en los que se incrementa la demanda de maíz y tortilla, también tiene estimada la compra de varios rollos de tela licra para la elaboración de playeras y de tela de algodón para la elaboración de blusas para damas,  ella tiene experiencia en la elaboración de prendas de vestir  por eso  busca ampliar sus venta y ya cuenta con clientes en diferentes mercados a quienes entrega las prendas de vestir (por docena)
Ella manifiesta que se siente feliz de ser económicamente estable y su deseo es ser una empresaria con éxito y de esa manera apoyar a sus padres ya que ella es soltera y vive con ellos. Por lo tanto agradece el apoyo que recibe con el crédito.
texts.en:
The "Dúo San Miguel" ["Saint Michael Duo"] is led by Ms. Irma Silvia. She earns a living selling tortillas and corn. During the latest loan, she also decided to invest in purchasing fabric for making t-shirts and blouses. This is the third loan she is requesting on Kiva.

She says that she feels very cheerful since she has many plans for investing and being able to take advantage of the final months of the year, in which demand for corn and tortillas increases. In addition, she has estimated the purchase of various rolls of lycra fabric for making t-shirts and cotton fabric for making women's blouses. She has experience making dress garments. Because of this, she seeks to increase her sales and she already has clients in different markets to whom she delivers dress garments by the dozen.

She states that she feels happy for being economically stable. Her desire is to be a successful business owner and in this way support her parents since she is single and lives with them. She is thankful for the support that she receives from the loan.

loans.use: to buy corn to sell and to buy fabric for making dress garments.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Sadiye

texts.en:
Sadiye is married and a mother of three. She is selling jewellry and ornaments on stands. She says that she earns her own pocket money, help her children and socialize. She wants to continue with this as long as it takes.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sadiye Hanım evli, üç çocuk annesi. İki yıldır boş durmamak için tezgah da süs eşyaları, takı satışı yapıyor. Kendi harçlığını çıkardığını, çocuklarına yardım ettiğini ve sosyalleştiğini söylüyor. Sağlıklı oldukça çalışmaya devam edecek.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and small gifts

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 23-year-old single lady who opened two years ago cosmetics and accessories shop to help in covering the needs and expenses of her family that consists of seven members. She is an ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her region. She is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new diversified collection of cosmetics and accessories to satisfy her customers' needs.
Zahraa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new diversified collection of cosmetics and accessories to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Claudio Alonso

texts.es:
Claudio de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta 2°grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando.


Claudio se dedica  al trabajo de agricultura, trabajo que aprendió desde que estaba pequeño, también se dedica a la crianza de vacas  las cuales le generan ingresos en la producción de lácteos 


El crédito lo necesita para comprar zacate el cual es utilizado para la elaboración de alimento de las vacas.

 Su sueño a futuro es seguir en el trabajo de la ganadería y poder así comercializar sus productos y tener una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Claudio is 43 years old, and went as far as 2nd grade in school. He is married and his spouse is a housewife. He has 4 children who are attending school.

Claudio farms, an occupation he learned from a young age. He also raises cows, who generate income for him through the production of dairy products.

He needs the loan to buy zacate grass, which is used for making cattle feed.

His dream for the future is to continue his cattle-raising work and thereby be able to sell his products and have a better quality of life for him and for his family.

loans.use: to buy zacate grass, which is used for making cattle feed.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad, 55, is a Palestinian man, married and father of three. He lives with his family in a refugee camp for Palestinians located in North Lebanon. His wife is unemployment and his kids all graduated from school.
After working as an employee for more than 25 years, Imad , a passionate salesman, decided to open his own shoes shop in 2009 in which he sells men's shoes. His main concern is currently to satisfy his client's demand. He is well-known in the camp as he is always follows the latest trends.
In order to buy the new winter collection, he decided to ask for a 1,799,994 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa for the first time. Imad believes that with this new collection, he will be able to serve more customers and increase his sales and income. That way, he will be providing his wife and children with more stable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new shoes collection for his shop.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina is 25 years old, married and a mother of two children. She joined Kiva's field partner Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 so as to benefit from its training programs, especially enterprise development. With this training she was able to start a beauty salon and keep proper business records.

Rosina has applied for a 10,000 KES loan to buy more salon equipment such as a hair drier and blow drier. She hopes this will enable her to attract more customers and earn her more income to support her family with food and pay for school fees.

Rosina is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for its financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more beauty salon equipment such as a hair drier and blow drier.

loans.name: Amé

texts.fr: Amé est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans résidant à Tokoin. Avec trois enfants à charge, Amé est une revendeuse des produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Amé sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de sucre et de douzaines de sandalettes. Amé désire gagner  plus de bénéfice pour venir en aide à son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées dans son foyer.
texts.en: Amé is a 53-year-old woman who lives in Tokoin.  With three children under her care, she makes a living selling general food products.  She stocks up five times per month at the market and resells in front of her house.  Amé is taking this loan in order to purchase a few bags of sugar and two dozen sandals.  She would like to increase her profits and help her husband cover the various day-to-day expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy two bags of sugar and two dozen sandals.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée  âgée de 35 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Sans enfant à charge, Afi  s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant de l’huile végétale.  Pour s’approvisionner, Afi se rend six fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bidons d’huile végétale, Afi nécessite ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Afi va pouvoir améliorer son activité et aider son mari à bien prendre en charge certaines dépenses quotidiennes puis améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Afi is 35 years old, married, and she lives in Tokoin.  She has no children in her care.  Afi works hard to earn an income and she makes a living selling vegetable oil.  She stocks up at the market six times per month.  She is taking this loan in order to purchase a few cans of oil.  Thanks to the profit margin that this loan will generate, Afi will be able to improve her activity.  She will also be in a position to help her husband fully cover some of the family's expenses, which will lead to an improvement of their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy four cans of oil.

loans.name: Beato Roque Gonzalez Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Beato Roque González de Santacruz está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 23 mujeres todos ellas vecinas y amigas del lugar, ellas se esfuerzan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Eva es una de las personas que integra este grupo, tiene una humilde huerta donde cultiva todo tipo de verduras y hortalizas que después vende, tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hace pedidos de lo que vende. Ella se esfuerza por su familia para poder darles una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de semillas y abonos, y de esa manera poder seguir con el cultivo en su huerta. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group called Beato Roque González de Santacruz is in its 5th cycle of the women's committee program, and is made up of 23 women who are all neighbors and friends from that place. They strive to improve their living conditions and that of their loved ones.

Eva is one of the people that form this group. She has a simple garden where she grows all kinds of vegetables and produce that she later sells. She has very good customers that always order what she sells. She is striving for her family so they can have a life of dignity, without being deprived like she has been.

This loan is to buy seeds and fertilizers, so she can continue growing her garden. She appreciates this opportunity she is getting to be able to grow and improve every day.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to plant in the garden.

loans.name: Dúo Pinares De San Cristóbal Group

texts.es: Dúo Pinares de San Cristóbal Ana lilian es comerciante  de 42 años, madre soltera de 3 hijas menores de edad las cuales asisten a la escuela de su comunidad. Ana lilian se dedica a la venta de verduras, productos de consumo de primera necesidad, pollo y productos lácteos.  En esta ocasión solicita un nuevo crédito para surtir su negocio de productos comestibles, y así poder obtener mayor número de clientes y tener mejores ganancias. El sueño de Ana lilian es tener otro negocio para poder brindarle una mejor estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Dúo Pinares de San Cristóbal.  Ana Lilian is a 42 year old merchant.  She is a single mother of three young daughters who go to school in the community.  Ana Lilian works selling vegetables, consumer staples, chicken, and dairy products.  

On this occasion, she is requesting a new loan to stock her grocery business and thus be able to get more customers and to have better earnings.  Ana Lilian's dream is to have another business to be able to give better stability to her family.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angelita Victoria

texts.es: Angelita es una mujer de 48 años que vive en la localidad rural de Subin, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Ella trabaja como obrera agrícola y además se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas orgánicas, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Angelita is a 48 year old woman who lives in the rural town of Subin that is located in Moquequa.  She works as a farmer and also works in agriculture and raising organic cattle, always paying a lot of attention in the care and the feeding that she gives them, which is made up of organic alfalfa that she grows.

She is requesting the microloan to be able to buy two organic cows.  She hopes that their milk will sell at a better price for being organic.  In the future, she hopes to be able to improve her living conditions and to continue having good health, the reason that she chose organic.

loans.use: To buy two organic cows to sell the milk that they produce.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Ayawa est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec ses deux enfants à charge. Agée de 44 ans, Ayawa est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires et des bassines qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Ayawa nécessite ce prêt pour commander des bidons d’huile et des unités de bassines en vue de mieux vendre puis de réaliser plus de bénéfice et pouvoir aider sa famille à subvenir à certains besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve.
texts.en: Ayawa is married and she lives in Tokoin with her two dependent children.  She is 44 and she makes a living reselling food products as well as plastic tubs.  She stocks up three times per month at the market and resells her goods in front of her house.  She is taking this loan to purchase some cans of oil and a few plastic tubs.  This loan will allow her to increase her sales and profits, and will help her take care of some of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy two cans of oil and eight plastic tubs.

loans.name: Ana Celina

texts.es:
Ana de 52 años de edad,  estudió hasta el bachillerato, está casada y tiene dos hijas las cuales estudian en bachillerato y universidad, el esposo de Ana se dedica a trabajar en finca.

Actualmente, Ana trabaja como promotora de salud, trabajo que le permite ayudar con los gastos del hogar y a cubrir algunas necesidades de sus hijas.

El crédito lo necesita para iniciar negocio de librería, comprará cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, plumones, borradores, cartulinas, etc.

Ella sueña con poder sacar adelante a sus  hijas apoyándole con lo necesario en los gastos de educación y para darles una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 52 year old.  She studied until high school.  She is married and has two daughters who go to high school and college.  Ana's husband works on the farm.  

Currently, Ana works promoting health, a job that allows her to help with the costs of the home and to cover some needs of her daughters.

She needs the loan to start a bookstore.  She will buy notebooks, pens, pencils, markers, erasers, cardboard, etc.

She dreams of being able to get her daughters ahead, supporting them with what they need in the education costs and to give them a better living condition.

loans.use: To start a bookstore, she will buy notebooks, pens, pencils, markers, erasers, cardboard, etc.

loans.name: Cesiri Group

texts.fr:
Moussa  est le monsieur qui a le sac de mil sur la photo. Il  est  un  malien  non scolarisé, âgé de 55 ans, marié et  Père de 07 enfants, âgés de 3 ans à  27 ans dont 3   scolarisés. Sa femme est une ménagère.
 Moussa fait  le commerce et le stockage des céréales il y a plus 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend ses céréales dans les mêmes foires. Le profit qu’il y gagne lui permet de subvenir à certains besoins de sa famille.
 Dans l’avenir  Moussa souhaite avoir un financement plus élevé afin de développer son activité.
texts.en:
Moussa, age 55, is the man holding the bag of millet in the photo.  He comes from Mali and never went to school.  He is the father of seven children between the ages of 3 and 27.  Three of his children attend school.  His wife is a homemaker.

Moussa has been selling and storing cereals for over 10 years.  He stocks up at the local markets and resells at the same venues.  Thanks to the profits he makes, he is able to cover some of his family's needs.

In the future, Moussa would like to receive a larger loan, which will help him to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy and store bags of cereal for resale.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: Don Rufino  tiene 55 años de edad en casado tiene 4 hijos de 28,24,20, y 36 años de edad vive con sus hijos y esposa sus ingresos provienen de sus ventas de ropa vende también algo de productos de librería inicio su proyecto vendiendo ropa interior, sus clientes son vecino de la colonia y personas del mercado donde tiene su venta él trabaja su proyecto con su esposa, sus metas son: mejorar la calidad de vida, mejorar los ingresos económicos, alimentar la producción, fortalecer el negocio, pagar los gastos de su casa ofrecer variedad de productos, lleva 6 préstamos con fape los cuales los ha utilizado para poder comprar producto para su venta.  El agradece los préstamos que le ha brindado KIVA porque gracias a ello tiene una librería y una venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Don Rufino is 55 years old.  He is married and he has four children who are 28, 24, 20, and 36 years old.  He lives with his children and wife.  He gets his income from selling clothing.  He also sells some stationary.  He started his business selling underwear.  His customers are the neighbors in the area and the people of the market where he has his sales.  He works his business with his wife.  His goals are to improve the quality of life, improve the income, increase the production, strengthen the business, to pay the costs of his home, and to offer a variety of products.  

This is his 6th loan with FAPE, which he has used to be able to buy products for his sales.  He is grateful for the loan that KIVA offers him.  Thanks to them, he has a bookstore and a clothing store.

loans.use: To buy clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama San Rafael está en el Primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus respectivas familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fidelina quien tiene una confitería en la que todos los días trabaja vendiendo los confites que ella misma hace, comenta que por medio de la venta de sus productos ayuda a sus seres queridos y les da una vida digna y sin privaciones. Fidelina comenta que gracias al sacrificio que esta haciendo tiene los medios para ayudar a sus seres queridos dándoles una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar harina, dulces, mantecas, y otros insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus confites y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called San Rafael is in its first cycle of the program of the committee of women.  They are also in the program to eliminate poverty, striving to improve their living conditions and those of their respective families.

One of the member is la señora Fidelina who has a candy shop in which she works everyday selling candies that she made herself.  She says that through the sales of her products, she helps her loved ones and gives them a dignified life without want.  Fidelina says that thanks to the sacrifice that she is making, she has the means to help her loved ones giving them a dignified life.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy flour, sweets, butter, and other products to be able to continue making her candies and in this way be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.  She is grateful or the opportunity that she receives to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy products to make candies, such as flour, sweets, butter, and other products.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor  Francisco  de 53  tiene un hijo que depende de él. Vive en Nacaome, valle al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace más de 10  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería como ser: frescos, granos básicos y dulces, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario lo visitan.

El señor Francisco está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abarrotería, como frescos, churros, dulces y agua en fardos etc. está muy contento del apoyo que Prisma le puede brindar.
 
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - de Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Francisco is 53 years of age and he has one dependent son. He lives in Nacaome, a valley in the south of Honduras. He has earned a living for more than 10 years through his grocery business which sells drinks, basic grains and sweets. His clients are friends and customers who visit his store daily.

Francisco is requesting this loan to purchase groceries such as drinks, chips, sweets and packs of water. He is very happy with the support that Prisma is offering him. His dream is to improve his business and his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, October 2015.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as drinks, chips, sweets, packs of water, etc.

loans.name: Aguitas De Luribay Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUITAS DE LURIBAY” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de mantas, venta de dulces, venta de llantas, venta  de colchones, servicio de construcción, salón de belleza. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a su promocionar a  su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de colchones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo hace cinco años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de colchones por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Bolivia-Perú y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Aguitas de Luribay" communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, and belongs to the Santiago II regional office. The group consists of 8 members and is led by a board of directors, of which Maria is the president. The members of the group run a variety of businesses, including the sale of food, clothing, blankets, sweets, tyres, mattresses, as well as building services and a beauty salon.

The loan will benefit microentrepreneurs such as Maria. She says that this is the first time she has been part of Pro Mujer, and she joined after an invitation by the institution, which was promoting its work in her area. She currently sells mattresses for a living. She says that she learnt this business from her husband 5 years ago.

The loan that she is requesting is to increase her capital (purchase of mattresses wholesale). She will buy them from the wholesalers on the Bolivian-Peruvian border and will later sell them in her store. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically, as she is married with three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses wholesale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora  Gloria  de 22 años de edad, es soltera  convive con su madre  y sus hermanos no tiene hijos, vive en  San Lorenzo al  sur de Honduras se dedica desde hace 02 años  a la venta de ropa usada sus clientes son los amigos y compañero de trabajo y las personas de la zona.

La señora gloria está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de un fardo de ropa clasificada porque sé hacer  la época de navidad, está contenta del apoyo que Prisma le puede brindar.

Su sueño es que su negocio mejore para poder tener una buena vida.


San Lorenzo, honduras - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Gloria is 22 years of age and single. She lives with her mother and her siblings and does not have any children. She lives in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras and she has earned a living for the past 2 years selling recyled clothing. Her clients are friends, work colleagues and locals.

Gloria is requesting the loan to purchase a package of used clothing for the Christmas season. She is happy with the support that Prisma is offering her. Her dream is to develop her business so that she can have a good life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, October, 2015.

loans.use: to purchase a package of used clothing.

loans.name: Vilma Marely

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 45 años de edad, ella manifiesta que desde muy pequeña se dedicó a los quehaceres del hogar  junto a su madre,   está soltera y tiene 5 hijos, uno de ellos es independiente y los otros 4 si dependen de ella.


Vilma trabaja en la agricultura, sus hijos le ayudan a realizar dicha actividad, decidió trabajar por la necesidad de cubrir los gastos del hogar y mantener a sus hijos.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes para aplicar a sus cultivos de granos básicos.

Ella sueña con que sus hijos tengan una oportunidad de desarrollo profesional y que siempre sean una familia unida.
texts.en:
Vilma is 45 years of age. She says that since she was very young she has done the household chores with her mother. She is single and has 5 children. One of them is independent and the other four are her dependents.

Vilma works in farming and her children help her in this activity. She decided to work because she needed to pay for the household expenses and to support her children.

She needs the loan to buy fertilizers to put on her grain crops. Her dream is for her children to have the opportunity to develop professionally and that they will always be a close family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to apply to her basic grain crops

loans.name: Dunda Mu Yesu Group

texts.fr: Shanyungu est commerçante, trésorière de la banque communautaire «Dunda mu Yesu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, divorcée, âgée de 38 ans. Elle est vendeuse de la braise dans un marché du bidonville depuis 3 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 10 sacs de braises. Elle debuta par le fonds reçu de sa famille. Elle souhaite construire une maison et accroitre son activités. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Shanyungu is a merchant and the treasurer of the "Dunda mu Yesu" borrowing group, a client of IMF Hekima. She is divorced and 38 years old. She has been selling charcoal in a market in the slums for three years. She will buy 10 bags of charcoal. She started with funds received from her family. She would like to build a house and grow her business.

In closing, she thanks Hekima for their support of non-bankable entrepreneurs. We would like to point out that some of the clients [in the photo] are holding their children.

loans.use: buy 10 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Luis Hernan

texts.es: Luis es un joven de 19 años de edad que tiene muchos planes para su futuro y su principal ambición es ingresar a la policía nacional y cursar una carrera en esta institución, recursos que está ahorrando con su negocio de venta de cervezas que expende desde su vivienda.  Él es un joven soltero que cuenta con apoyo de sus padres y todos los días de la semana está dispuesto a atender a su clientela conformada principalmente por vecinos del sector a partir de la  1 p.m. en jornada continua hasta la 1 a.m., un horario amplio para todas aquellas personas que deseen compartir esta bebida con amigos, celebrar alguna festividad o refrescarse por las sofocantes olas de calor en Barranquilla. Como se está acercando una temporada llena de festividades, Luis aplicó a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar canastas de cervezas al por mayor y tener un inventario de acuerdo a los requerimientos de los clientes. Esta inversión será de éxito y lo acercara a su meta de estudio.
texts.en:
Luis is 19 years of age and he is a young man with many plans for the future. His main ambition is to join the national police and to study a course in this organisation. He is saving money from his business selling beer, which he carries out from his home.

He is a single and he has his parents' support. Every day of the week he attends to customers, who are primarily made up of his neighbours in his area. He works a long shift from 1pm until 1am and sells to all those people who want to share a beer with friends to celebrate a special occasion or to refresh themselves from Barranquilla's suffocating heatwaves.

As the season full of festivities is approaching, Luis has applied for a Kiva loan. It's his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, and he will use it to purchase crates of beer wholesale so that he has enough stock to meet his customers' orders. This investment will be successfull and will bring him closer to his goal of studying.

loans.use: to purchase crates of beer wholesale.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.fr: Lekesa est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Shalom», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, femme vivant seule, âgée de 34 ans et mère de trois enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de friperies dans un marché de la ville depuis 8 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en ½ ballon de friperie. Elle débuta par le premier fonds reçu de sa famille. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Lekesa is a merchant and a member of the "Shalom" banc villageois, a client of IMF Hekima. She lives alone, is 34 years old, and is the mother of three children who all go to school.

She has been selling second-hand clothing in a city market for eight years. She will buy 1/2 bale of second-hand clothing. She got her start with funds received form her family.

She would like to construct a house and to educate and feed her children. In closing, she thanks Hekima for their support of non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy 1/2 bale of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Guérison Group

texts.fr: Mala est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Guérison», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 23 ans, mère de six enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse de la braise dans le marché central depuis 5 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 4 sacs de braises. Elle débuta par le fonds reçu de son mari qui est chauffeur. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mala is a merchant and a member of the "Guérison" loan group, a client of IMF Hekima. She is married, 23 years old, and the mother of six children who all go to school.

She has been selling in the central market for five years. She will buy four bags of charcoal. She started with funds received from her husband, who is a chauffeur.

She would like to grow her business and educate and feed her children. In closing, she thanks Hekima for their support of non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy 4 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, es un comité nuevo que pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada y la de sus seres queridos.
Eleuteria es una de las personas que integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de helados, comenta que le está yendo muy  bien y que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran de ella los ricos helados que vende. Eleuteria es una mujer muy sacrificada que pone todo de si para poder seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos a través de sus ventas.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar helados variados, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Villa Elisa. It is a new communal bank that is putting every effort into improving the quality of life of each member and their loved ones.

Eleuteria is one of the people who make up this group. She sells ice cream. She tells us that it is going very well for her and that she has a lot of customers who always buy the delicious ice creams she sells. Eleuteria is a very selfless woman who gives her all so she can help her loved ones through her sales.

She is requesting this loan to he able to buy different kinds of ice cream and thereby be able to keep up her sales. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to improve living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Alicia, tiene 53 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo "Santa Rosa Rumbo al Progreso", es un grupo con poco tiempo de formado pero que poco a poco van conociéndose y compenetrándose para sacar adelante al grupo y cumplir con los compromisos de pago.
Desde hace mas de diez años ella se dedica a atender su salón de belleza que es su fuente de ingreso diario, atendiendo a damas, caballeros y niños, en cortes de cabello, peinados, tintes, manicure y pedicure. Paralelamente al trabajo en el salón de belleza complementa su negocio con la venta de productos de belleza.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos de salón, como tintes, líquidos de permanente y esmaltes, así como también en la compra de productos de belleza para stock.
texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old. She is a member of the Santa Rosa Rumbo al Progreso Group. This group was formed a short time ago, but little by little they are getting to know each other and working together to get the group ahead and make their payments.

For over ten years she has run a beauty salon, which is her daily source of income. She serves women, men, and children providing cuts, styling, color treatments, manicures, and pedicures. Alongside her work at the beauty salon she has a complementary business selling beauty products.

She will use the loan she has received to buy salon products, such as dyes, perm solutions, and nail polishes, and she will also buy beauty products for her stock.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and salon products.

loans.name: Marina Concepción

texts.es:
Marina tiene 60 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por los escasos recursos económicos, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al trabajo de albañilería, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella.


Marina se dedica a la elaboración de tamales, pasteles  y otros antojitos, su hija mayor es quien le ayuda en el trabajo, esa es la principal fuente de ingresos de Marina con la que sostiene a su familia.


El préstamo lo está solicitando para comprar leña, gas, maíz, frijoles y demás materiales necesarios  para la elaboración de antojitos.

Ella sueña con seguir delante luchando por sus objetivos y contar siempre con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
Marina, 60, was unable to get an education because of her low income. She has a partner who works as a builder and two dependent children.

Marina makes tamales, meat pies and snack foods. Her eldest daughter helps in the business which is the main source of income for Marina who supports the family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy firewood, gas, corn, beans and other supplies necessary to make the snack foods.

She dreams of getting ahead and struggling toward her goals; always with the support of the loans.

loans.use: to buy firewood, gas, corn, beans and other supplies to make snack foods.

loans.name: Heysi Kitty

texts.es:
La Joven. Heysi  tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su compañero de hogar y su  hijo, en el Paraíso, al oriente de Honduras, es una joven emprendedora, su actividad principal es el comercio, cuenta con una pequeña  pulperia donde vende muchos productos como ser: azúcar, arroz, manteca, maseca, harina, jabon, avena papel higiénico, sardinas etc. así poder seguir luchando día con día para poder tener una mejor vida.

La joven con el crédito que nos esta solicitando pretende  comprar  producto de la canasta básica como ser: café manteca, arroz, azúcar, harina,  huevos pan refresco, etc. Esta muy contenta del apoyo que Prisma le puede brindar

Su sueño es poder darle una buena educacion a su hijo.

Trojes, Honduras -Octubre 2015.
texts.en:
Heysi is only 25 years old and lives with her partner and son in Paraiso in eastern Honduras. This young entrepreneur's main business is commerce and she has a small grocery store where she sells products such as sugar, rice, shortening, cornflour, flour, soap, oats, toilet paper, sardines, etc. to continue her daily struggle toward a better lifestyle.

The loan she is requesting is to buy basic foods such as coffee, shortening, rice, sugar, flour, eggs, bread, soft drinks, etc. She is very pleased with the support offered her by Prisma.

Her dream is to give her son a good education.


Trojes, Honduras - October, 2015.
